loans.name: Perla Lisbet

texts.es: La señora Perla Lisbet es una mujer muy emprendedora que a pesar de la situación económica que esta en el país, cuenta con su negocio de venta de ropa usada de buena calidad que ofrece a sus amistades y vecinos aun bajo precio. Perla es madre de dos pequeños a los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida es por ello que opto por dedicarse al negocio para no descuidarlos y darles toda la atención. El negocio ha permanecido 4 años por la atención que ofrece y amabilidad al atender a sus clientes, esta es parte de su fuente de ingresos a parte la que su esposo gana por trabajar en maquiladora. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar mercancía de temporada.
texts.en:
Perla Lisbet is a very enterprising woman who despite the economic situation in the country has her business selling good quality, used clothes to her friends and neighbors at affordable prices. 

Perla is the mother of two little ones that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.  This is why she opted for this type of business so that she could take care of them and give them all her attention.

The business has lasted four years due to the service she provides and the kindness with which she treats her customers.  This is part of her source of income besides what her husband earns working at an assembly plant.  

So that the business will continue to earn income she needs to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Yaracet

texts.es:
La señora Yaracet tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio hasta tercer semestre de la preparatorio y esta casada con el señor Luis que trabaja de Jornalero, ellos tiene dos hijos de 6 años y otro de 8 meses  la mayor asiste a la primaria.
Ella nos platica que siempre habia tenido la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar pero apenas hace dos años inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Ella nos dice que le ha ido bien en el negocio y que quiere hacerlo crecer iniciando a vender zapatos po catalogo para tener mas clientes y que sus ganacias aumenten, asi poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro puedan sus hijos estudiar una profesion. Ella necesita este credito para la compra de catalogos, zapatos, blusas, shorts, pantalones, camisas, calsetines, ropa interior y vestidos para su posterior venta.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundacion por la confianza que le dio.
texts.en:
Yaracet is 25 years old, and she attended high school until the third semester.  She is married to Luis, who works as a day laborer.  They have two children.  One is six years old, and the other is eight months.  The oldest goes to elementary school.

She tells us that she has always been concerned about helping her husband with the household expenses.  Two years ago she started selling women’s and men’s clothing door to door to her friends and neighbors in the community.

She tells us that the business has gone well for her.  She wants to make it grow by starting to sell shoes by catalog.  She will do this in order to have more customers and increased income.  That way she will be able to give her family a better quality of life, and her children will be able to study for a profession in the future.

She needs this loan to buy catalogs, shoes, blouses, shorts, pants, shirts, socks, underwear, and dresses for her to later sell.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Nelly Margot

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Bienestar y Progreso que se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

La señora Nelly es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque allí se siente como en familia. Tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos aun viven con ella.

Nuestra amiga desde hace mucho tiempo atrás ha tenido que luchar sola para sacar adelante a sus hijos para lo cual tiene un negocio en su casa en el cual vende pañales. También tiene un taxi en el cual trabajaba su esposo hasta que falleció y ahora lo conduce  un chofer a quien le paga un sueldo semanal. Ella comenta que ha sido muy duro salir adelante pero gracias a Dios ahora sus hijos ya están grandes y se defienden solos y gracias a los créditos ha podido salir de situaciones muy difíciles en su vida.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en sus dos negocios, va a comprar pañales y dos llantas para el taxi.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The "Bienestar y Progreso" (Well-being and Progress) group meets every 15 days in the Colorado area of the Montecristi canton. Montecristi is known at the national and international level for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicrafts. It is the place where the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats) are made.  

Nelly is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because it feels like a family.  She is 50, and several years ago her husband passed away. She has three children from this relationship, who are now adults; but two of them still still live with her. 

Our friend has had to struggle for a long time on her own to help her family get ahead in life. This is why she has a home business selling diapers.  She also has a taxi which her husband used to drive, until he passed away. Now a driver operates it, to whom she pays a weekly salary. 

She says that it's been very hard to move forward, but thanks to God her children are now grown up and can manage on their own. She says that thanks to the loans she has been able to overcome very difficult situations in her life. 

She is going to use this loan in her two businesses. She is going to buy diapers, and two tires for the taxi. Her dream is to keep moving forward in life and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy tires and diapers.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 64 years old and a widow with six children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Pilar runs a ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years.
 
She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

In the future, Pilar would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Maria  Elena

texts.es: La señora María es   muy  trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de tamales y platillos   lo cual le permite  obtener  ingresos  para  salir adelante, esta muy contenta de habernos encontrado ya que vamos a apoyarla en su proyecto el cual  consiste en realizar  la  compra de  mercancía para seguir  ofertando a sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio  que  la  caracteriza y con esto su negocio le generara mejores ganancias y así tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, además de  obtener  la oportunidad de  apoyar a sus hijos lo  cuales  son los  mas  importantes   en   su  vida.
texts.en: María is very hardworking; she sells tamales and meals which makes it possible for her to earn income to get ahead.  She’s very happy to have found us because we are going to support her project consisting in purchasing merchandise to continue to offer her customers the excellent service that characterizes her and with this her business will generate better profits and she’ll have an improved quality of life besides having the opportunity to support her children who are the most important in her life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales and meals.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  She is 53 years old, a widow and she lives with her child.

Halima has been a tailor since 1990; she makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids.  She has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and knows about their needs.  She has a good reputation and she is well known in her surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $3,000 to purchase two industrial sewing machines, a generator and to add more materials such as buttons, zippers, and thread. She is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase two industrial sewing machines, a generator and to add more materials as buttons, zippers, and thread.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto is 34 years old, married and has four children.

Toto owns & operates a business venture selling poultry products in the local community.  She has five years of experience in this business. Toto needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Toto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Toto's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with two school-going children. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Kabibi has operated a mobile phone accessory shop for the past three years; her potential clients are local area residents. She dreams of establishing another shop in the future

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more mobile phone spare parts and accessories for her shop. She decided to join Yehu because it offers loans to small entrepreneurs which help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phone spare parts and accessories for her shop.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a 42-year-old, married woman with three children.  To earn a living, she sells clothes, table clothes and mosquito nets.  Reginah has been in this business for seven years and employs one person.  She also runs a salon to earn extra income.  Reginah started the salon business after getting start-up capital from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya.

Reginah has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for sale in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old, married and has one child. To make a living, Luzviminda runs a general store selling a variety of food and home use products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many other items in her community. Luzviminda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Luzviminda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Luzviminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase sugar, wheat flour, eggs, and milk for his bakery. In the future, Stephen aspires to continue improving his business.

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Stephen has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, eggs, and milk for his bakery.

loans.name: Shaheen Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen bibi, 26 years old, is a kind and responsible woman. She is married and lives with her family and three children, 7, 5 and 3 years old. Shaheen’s days are focused on managing the progress of her home-based decorative embroidery business. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which helps to attract many customers in her community.

Shaheen bibi's husband has owned a barber shop for the past 10 years. He has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is becoming well known in his area. He will use this loan to purchase chairs to provide better seating arrangements, scissors and beauty products (face creams, masks, etc.) for his barber shop. Shaheen is hopeful that her husband will be able to gain more profits after the loan investment and to provide a better life to the family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy chairs, scissors and beauty products

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice sells slippers at Besease. She has been selling slippers for 2 years.  Eunice is married to an electrician and has one child. Eunice uses her income to help support the family. Eunice will use her loan to purchase more slippers. With the new profit Eunice will expand her busiiness.

loans.use: Eunice will use her loan to purchase more slippers

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra, nuevamente quiere seguir trabajando con nuestra institución y por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir trabando en su negocio ya que comprara lociones de diferentes marcas y enchape como pulseras, aretes, anillos y collares debido a la época navideña es cuando mejor están las ventas y las ganancias  mejoran. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque invirtió mucho en otros productos que no tenia y los clientes los solicitan y ella como su familia viven en otras condiciones.
texts.en:
Sandra wants to continue working with our institution. That's why she is applying for a new loan, so that she can keep working in her business. 

She will buy different brands of lotions, and jewelry such as bracelets, earrings, rings, and necklaces, because the Christmas season is when sales are better and earnings improve. 

The previous loans helped her, because she invested a lot in other products that she didn't have. Customers asked for them, so she and her family are in a better situation.

loans.use: To buy bracelets, earrings, rings, and necklaces.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is an 18-year-old single girl. She has five brothers and sisters. 

After successfully passing her high school exams, Ola registered herself in a college to get a diploma in the English language. After that she is planning on continuing to get a bachelor's degree too. 

Now Ola has applied for a loan so she can pay for her school fees.

loans.use: to pay her school fees

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell to customers.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is married with eight children.

He had training with Uganda Drug Authority before he started his business.

The second training he attended was on business skills and stock control organized by Village Enterprise Fund. He was given a donation of $150 by village Enterprise Fund in 2000. He has succeeded in giving medical services to the people of his community.

Given a loan of $500, he plans to increase his stock by buying more medicine that can cure common diseases in the community like: - malaria, fever, antibiotics, body ointments for scabies, ringworms, Candida etc, stomach dewormers, flu, cough, diarrhoea. These medications are hard to find in his village He is capable of handling the loan money and refund it without any problem. The loan term will be six months.

loans.use: Selling Medication for humans

loans.name: Yeni Rosibel

texts.en:
My name is Yeni P. and I make and sell cotton candy. I have had my business for 3 years and as I am a single mother, I have my son's help making and selling my product. I have a good clientel because I am located in the central park where there are many children who come to play every afternoon. My business generates enough income to support my family. My goal is to increase sales and with the additional earnings I will be able to give a university education to my son and be able to feed my family as well.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Mi nombre es Yeni P. me dedico a la produccion y venta de algodones de azucar, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hijo para la produccion y venta de mi producto ya que soy madre soltera, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicada en un parque central en donde muchos niños vienen a jugar todas las tardes, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder darle un buen estudio de universidad a mi hijo asi mismo alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, artificial flavorings, bags and wooden spoons.

loans.name: Flor Estela

texts.en:
Mrs. Flor Estela has run her business in her own home for 6 months. She says: "I have had my business for 6 months but because one of my sons passed away, I was closed for 1 month. Now I need to buy merchandise to be able to open once again, I have a very good location but I lack many things." She asks for a loan of $1,000.00 in order to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. Flor Estela tiene su negocio en su casa desde hace 6 meses. “Mi negocio lo tengo desde hace 6 meses pero debido al fallecimiento de uno de mis hijos lo tuve cerrado 1 mes, ahora necesito comprar mercancía para poder abrirlo otra ves, tengo muy buena ubicación pero me hacen falta muchas cosas” SOLICITO $ 1,000.0 dlls para la compra de mercancía

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Bilender

texts.en: N. Bilender Azazil oglu is a local farmer living in Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. He has a big family consisting of 4 children and his wife. He has an animal husbandry business. He has very big problems in improving the business because of the number of animals and feeding them. He applied for 1200 USD as credit, of which 900 USD will be spent  for an additional  cow  and 300 USD to purchase feed.

loans.use: Purchase a cow and feed

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mrs. Meth H. has been married for more than 20 years and has 9 children -- 8 daughters and one son. Currently, only 3 daughters are married and living in separate houses. Six children are living with her and they are all attending school. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor many years ago, and she has trained her daughters to weave silk as well. She is currently not only producing silk products but also raising 13 pigs in her house.

Her husband is a construction supervisor and is currently making concrete pipes at home for selling, building and repairing houses, drainages, gates and fences in their village and other villages.

Mrs. H. has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. Now she is requesting $1,000 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, raise pigs, and purchase construction materials. The construction business will also provide 10 local people with jobs.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread, raising pigs, and purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos raises and sells pork. He started with 3 baby pigs several years ago; he now owns 18 pigs.

The loan he is requesting is smaller than usual because it’s the off-season for sugarcane. When it is in season, people spend more money because the local economy is based largely on the sugarcane industry (that is where most of the jobs are), then he takes out larger loans to advance his business quicker.

With his past loans he has been able to buy the title to his house and his land, a feat that very few people in his community are ever able to do. His dream is to continue earning money, and saving so that one day soon he can buy a bigger and stronger house. He says he worries that if a strong hurricane comes it will destroy the house he and his family live in—a house made of wood and a corrugated zinc roof.

Carlos is very thankful for your help with this loan, and is excited to work hard and realize all of the blessings it will bring him.

NOTE: This $1050 loan will fund Carlos' business as well as seven other businesses in his solidarity group. They have all gone through Esperanza business training program and will receive equal shares of the loan to invest in their respective business and pay back the loan together. The entire group must pay in full and on time, otherwise group members must make up the deficit before any payment can be made. This creates accountability among the group members because each one shares in the struggles and successes of the other members in their group.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Matilde Elizabeth

texts.es:
Matilde started this business as a way to occupy her free time and to help her husband with the costs of educating their 2 small children. Today this business lets them take care of more than 70% of their family expenses. They are thinking about expanding their store since they need more space to be able to buy a better assortment of merchandise and a better way to accommodate the merchandise that they currently have.

Matilde is requesting a loan of $925 that she is sure she will be able to pay back in 6 months. With this money, Matilde will be able to invest in expanding her business to accommodate her merchandise better and to buy a little more merchandise to make better profits. With your help, Matilde will be able to take proper care of her two children and will be able to pay for their education so they will be great men in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ella inicio este negocio como medio para ocupar su tiempo libre y ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la educación de sus 2 pequeños hijos. Hoy este negocio les da para solventar más del 70% de sus gastos familiares. Están pensando en ampliar el local ya que necesitan mas espacio para poder comprar más surtido y acomodar de una mejor manera la mercancía que ya tienen actualmente.

Por lo tanto Matilde está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está segura lo podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Matilde podrá invertir en ampliar su negocio para acomodar mejor su mercancía y comprar un poco de más mercancía para obtener mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda Matilde podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos y les podrá pagar los estudios para que estos niños sean en un futuro hombres de bien.

loans.use: To expand her business and buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Boèvi Jacob

texts.fr:
Mr L. Boèvi Jacob is a 43 year-old married man, a father of two (2) children, who also takes care of another person. With only a secondary education, he is learning the shoe-making trade in order to relieve his family's financial suffering. Through this project, he is asking for a loan of $600 which will enable him to build his workshop and purchase leather and other materials. This wil improve the living conditions of his family and help them find their dignity both economically and socially.

Agé de 43 ans monsieur L. Boèvi Jacob est marié et père de deux (2) enfants et à sa charge une (1) personne. Avec son niveau d’instruction secondaire, il apprend la cordonnerie afin de palier aux maux dont souffrent sa famille en matière de support financier. Il demande à travers ce projet un prêt de $600 qui lui permettra de renforcer son atelier en matériel et cuir afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille pour retrouver sa dignité d’une manière économique et sociale.

loans.use: Building of workshop

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Mai Thị Thành, 53 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2001. Her husband passed away and she raised two children by herself. The family was in deep hardship. If just relying on small patch of rice paddy, they would not survive. She took out small loans from the Fund to invest in a chè carrying stand. Chè is a Vietnamese favorite sweet dessert. After 10 years, now her both children are grown up and have careers of their own. She changes her work to bamboo weaving so she can work at home. She would like to apply for a loan of 325USD to purchase bamboo.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Mai Thị Thành, 53 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2001. Chồng chị bị bệnh qua đời một mình chị nuôi 2 con, cuộc sống gia đình gặp nhiều khó khăn. Nếu chỉ trông vào mấy sào ruộng thì không thể đủ ăn, chị mạnh dạn vay vốn từ Quỹ Tình thương đầu tư vào mua chè về bán. Trong hơn 10 năm trời chị Thành thức khuya dậy sớm kiếm từng đồng nuôi 2 con ăn học. Đến nay 2 con chị đã trưởng thành và có công ăn việc làm tử tế. Hiện nay đã có tuổi nên chị Thành chọn nghề đan cót để có thể ở nhà ở nhà thường xuyên. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 325USD để mua tre về đan cót tăng thêm thu nhập

loans.use: Buy bamboo to make bamboo mat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy ingredients to make juice and a refrigerator to keep them cold

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Eliza M.. She is married, and has three children, ages 15, 17 and 20. In 2006, Eliza established her liquor store business. Eliza requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of beer and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Jasmini

texts.en:
Jasmini is 35 years old and is a single woman with one 12-year-old child. Jasmini has been selling used clothes since 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

Jasmini now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Feyruz

texts.en: Feyruz Q. is 56 years old and has four children. His main activity is breeding livestock and he has been engaged in this activity since 1988. He lives in the Bilasuvar Internally Displaced People Settlement and does not work anywhere, because there is nowhere to work in this newly-built settlement. As meat is very popular all across Azerbaijan, Feyruz would like to expand his activity and purchase another two calves, each for $400 USD, to increase his monthly earnings.

loans.use: Feyruz would like to purchase two calves to raise.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria works in the sale of irapay leaves, which are used to cover the roofs of country houses as well as for other uses. She has sold this product for a long time, but a small disadvantage exists in that her product is kept outdoors; she needs to construct an adequate space to protect her inventory from the rain. Gloria is 40 years old and is the mother of five children. She counts on the support of her beloved husband, Geu, who helps her with her business. Gloria wants to continue surpassing her own goals, and for this reason is seeking a loan to achieve her plan. She awaits your kind-hearted assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Gloria se dedica a la venta de hojas de irapay, que sirven para cubrir los techos de las casas de campo y para otros fines de uso. Ella vende este producto desde hace mucho tiempo, pero existe un pequeño inconveniente ya que sus productos se encuentran a la intemperie y necesita construir un espacio adecuado para protegerlos de la lluvia. Gloria de 40 años de edad es madre de 05 hijos, cuenta con el apoyo de su querido esposo el señor Geu, quien la apoya en su negocio. La señora Gloria quiere seguir superándose y para ello estima de un préstamo para cumplir con su propósito. Ella espera la ayuda de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Immediate construction of a warehouse to better maintain inventory

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj A. is the mother of 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan-Zangilan, and she has settled in the Absheron region. Six years ago she started her general store. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy food to improve her business. Sevindj was born in 1967.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Rolande

texts.fr:
Born around 1979 in Adjohoun in Ouémé County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Rolande A. is married to Paulin Houssa, a transit agent in the Autonomous Port of Cotonou. She is the mother of 2 children: Rosine, 14, is in 8th grade and Romain, 8, is in third grade. Mrs. A. is specialized in selling cold (cooled) drinks. With a view to satisfying her ever growing clientele, she is presently requesting her second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers 1979 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin, dame A. Rolande est mariée à Paulin HOUSSA agent de transit au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Elle est mère de deux (02) enfants: Rosine âgée de 14 ans est en classe de cinquième et Romain âgé de 8 ans est en classe de CE2. Dame A. Rolande est spécialiste dans la distribution des boissons fraîche. Dans l'optique de donner satisfaction à sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle vient solliciter son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.

loans.use:
Purchase of a refrigerator

Achat d'un réfrigérateur.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase pigs and food.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
En negocio de pulpería es un negocio que requiere de inversión constante por lo que a medida qeu se va agotando el inventario se requiere volverlo a llenar. En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Martha Lorena D. se dedica desde hace 7 años a su negocio de pulpería atendido en su casa de habitación.

Sus dos hijos son el motivo de sus grandes esfuerzos y por esta razón busca la forma de cómo suplir las necesidades del hogar por medio de los ingresos percibidos de la pulpería. La necesidad que ella está atravesando es que requiere el capital económico para la compra de sus productos. Por esta razón es que ha buscado el refugio en Ceprodel esperando que su crédito sea otorgado y así continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
The business of a general store is a business which requires a constant investment because of the measure of inventory is constantly rotating and requires being filled again. In the municipality of Telica in the city of Leon, Mrs. Martha Lorena Diaz has been dedicated for 7 years to her general store business in her home. Her two children are the motivation for her great strengths and for this reason she is looking for a form to supplement her household needs by means of the income received from the general store. The need that she is addressing is that she requires economic capital for the purchase of her products. For this reason she has looked for refuge in Ceprodel, hoping that her loan will be granted, and that she will be able to continue in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 30 años, vive con su pareja, con la que tienen 3 hijos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos verdes, que los compra en las diversas chacras, para después realizar el proceso de maduración, esto significa que estén listos para el mercado, lo realiza con un líquido diluido en agua, este líquido se compra de acuerdo a la cantidad que se necesite, esta actividad la realiza hace un año y le va muy bien, por semana ya tiene varios pedidos. Ahora, también quiere dedicarse a la venta de ropa, para que cuando vaya a comprar sus plátanos, al mismo tiempo vaya ofreciendo sus prendas, está segura que le ira muy bien, porque la venta de ropa es un negocio rentable porque por las chacras no tiene competidores, y eso le permitirá tener mucha clientela. Este es el primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero va a comprar ropa ligera, apropiada para el trabajo del campo.
texts.en:
Rufina is 30 years old, lives with her spouse, and they have 3 children. She earns a living with buying and selling green bananas. She buys the bananas from various farms and then carries out the ripening process so than they are ready to market. The ripening is done with a liquid diluted in water that she buys in quantities as required. She has been working at this activity for one year; it is going very well and she has several orders per week. Now, she also wants to earn money selling clothes, so that when she goes to buy her bananas, at the same time she will offer her clothing. She is certain that this will go very well because clothing sales is a profitable business and at the farms she will not have competitors, and that will allow her to have a large clientele. This is the first loan with MFP. With the money she is going to buy light clothing appropriate for farm work.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and then start selling clothing

loans.name: Sékina

texts.fr:
Né le 01 janvier 1973 à Sokodé qui est une ville du Togo, madame O. A. Sékina est divorcé de son mari DASSAIDA yakoukou qui est coiffeur. Elle a actuellement deux (02) enfants à charge. Elle a pour activité génératrice de revenu la vente des récipients en plastiques qu’elle fait de façon ambulante dans le quartier Agoè Atsanvé. 
Elle voudrait agrandir son commerce pour pouvoir subvenir correctement et quotidiennement aux besoins de ses deux enfants. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F pour s’approvisionner avec vingt (20) bassins, vingt (20) sceaux, vingt quatre (24)  glacières et vingt quatre (24) gobelets.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sékina O. A. was born on January 1, 1973 in Sokodé a town in Togo. She is divorced from her husband Yakoukou DASSAIDA, a hairdresser. She is currently financially responsible for two (02) children. Her income producing business is the door to door sale of plastic containers that she does in the neighborhood of Agoè Atsanvé.

She would like to expand her business to be able to provide fully and daily for the needs of her two children. This is why she is requesting a loan of 100,000F to stock up on twenty (20) basins, twenty (20) buckets, twenty four (24) iceboxes, and twenty four (24) tumblers.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic containers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria Cuba la misma es casada tiene 1 hijo es microempresaria se dedica al venta de ropas en la zona Baja y en la Feria Municipal Local 52 cuenta con 10 años de antigüedad en el rubro lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos. No esta demás mencionar que su cónyuge también aporta a la unidad familiar ya que atiende en el otro local que posee en la Zona baja , y la misma en su nuevo local que es propio en La Feria Municipal. Cabe destacar que opera únicamente con Fundación Paraguaya desde el 2005.
Solicito la suma de 5MM a 12 meses para compra de mercaderías de temporada verano y aumentar stocks de mercaderías lo que estaría adquiriendo de la ciudad de Posadas Argentina con menor costo y lo que estaría dando un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria Cuba is married and has 1 son. She is an entrepreneur, selling clothes in the Baja area and the city public market (Local 52) for the past 10 years. She has many customers and is able to earn a good living. Her husband also helps support their family, working in another location in the Baja district market. It is worth noting that Rosa has been a loyal client of Fundación Paraguaya since 2005. She asks for a loan of 5MM PYG, to be repaid in 12 months, in order to buy seasonal summer clothing and stock inventory with merchandise purchased at lower prices in the city of Posadas, Argentina, thus improving her profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer clothing (shorts, casual dresses, children's clothing)

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa,  vive en la  calle Junín de la  Zona de Alto Lima, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, ya que por circunstancias de la vida su esposo hizo abandono del hogar.


Ella se dedica a la compra venta de ropa de señoras en las distintas ferias de la ciudad y los días domingos se dedica a la venta de pollos en la feria  16 de julio la más grande de la ciudad, con lo cual sostiene económicamente a su familia.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mayor mercadería.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación presentada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Luisa lives in Junín St, in the Alto Lima zone, in her own home with her children. Owing to the circumstances of life, her husband abandoned their home. She works selling women's clothes in various markets around the city, and on Sundays she sells chicken in the 16 de Julio market, the largest market in the city. With this income she is able to support her family financially. The loan will be used to purchase wholesale merchandise. This is her first loan with Impro. They have evaluated her application and classified her as suitable for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on flour

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Cipriana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, Cipriana y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de panes típicos, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara de manera ambulatoria. Además Ciprina tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Ciprina necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, levadura, azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Cipriana son que su ultima hija sea profesional y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Cipriana is a member of Brisas Communal Bank. Cipriana is married, 50 years old, and has seven children. Cipriana and her husband produce bread. They bake it in a rented oven and sell it from a cart in the Santa Clara market. Cipriana also has a small grocery store in her house. Cipriana needs a loan for 1,400 soles to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, sugar and rice. Her dream is that her youngest daughter will become a professional and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, yeast, sugar and rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Mary is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a cattle keeper. She has two children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open a shop

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary C. is 28 years old and married with four children. She hires VCD's to her customers to make a living. She is hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more VCD's to hire to her customers. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To Purchase more  VCD's

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
R. Khairullo is a very happy and sociable 47-year-old man. He is happily married to a hard-working woman who has supported him in achieving all of his dreams. They have 3 children and they would have liked to have more. Khairullo’s family is one that loves working in agriculture. The whole family works together to harvest onions, tomatoes and corn. It has been 10 years since Khairullo began working the land he loves so much.

His wife sells the products in the local market. Khairullo also earns some extra income by transporting products for other farmers from the fields to the markets using his car. Khairullo is requesting a loan to acquire agricultural supplies that are necessary to maintain the crops. His dream is that his children will inherit the love to work the land that with great effort he and his wife acquired, and that some day their children will inherit that love as well.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is forty-seven years old. She is divorced and has five children, one son and four daughters. She tells us that some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.
Mary is a trader. She trades in all kinds of fruits and vegetables – oranges, pineapples, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, etc. She sells from a table in the market square and also supplies to retailers. She buys her products from farmers in nearby communities at cost effective prices. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to purchase her goods in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and to give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Đoàn Thị

texts.en:
L. Đoàn Thị (627981326) is a 50 year old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên.  She is married and has three children, who are now adults.  To making a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1998, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  L. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be the 11th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Alis

texts.es:
Alis es socia del Bancomunal el roble
Alis es casada tiene 41 años  4 hijos D. 25, 23, 20 y 14 años, los mayores están casados y los menores uno esta estudiando en el instituto superior y el ultimo en la escuela estatal. 
Alis es D. Trujillo, llego a Lima y estudio corte y confección, no lo ejerció por que salió embarazada y se caso, ella empezó vendiendo golosinas afuera D. un colegio, se entero que necesitaban  un guardianía para el colegio, y fue aceptada,  se puso a trabajar dentro del colegio dando menú y ha puesto un kiosco D. venta D. golosinas, le esta yendo bien.   
DesD. que Alis esta en Finca aprendió a superarse como persona y en el negocio.
Alis necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles para la comprar D. golosinas, galletas, chocolates y para compra víveres para dar   menú. 
El sueño D. Alis es tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Alis is a member of Bancomunal El Roble. She is 41 years old, and married with four children (25, 23, 20, and 14 years old). The oldest children are married, and the youngest is still studying, one in college and the other in public school. Alis is from Trujillo. She came to Lima and studied tailoring, but never worked as a tailor because she became pregnant and got married. She started to sell snacks outsiD. a school, and discovered they needed a guard for the school. She was accepted and started working insiD. the school offering meals, and she's set up a stall selling snacks there. Her business is going well. Now that she's part of Finca, Alis has been learning to better herself as a person and improve her business. Alis needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy sweets, cookies, and chocolates, as well as ingredients for the meals she sells. Alis's dream is to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets, cookies, chocolates, and ingredients for the meals she sells

loans.name: Francis Dalia

texts.es:
La microempresaria Francis Dalia B. Hernández tiene 47 años de edad, es casada tiene una hija la cual se encuentra estudiando en nivel secundario. La señora B. tiene un local en donde vende de todo un poco, tanto granos básicos como ropa de niños y adultos y otros productos más. Este negocio se encuentra  en el puerto El Bluff el cual esta ubicado a unos 5 kilómetros de Bluefields y cuenta con unos 3,000 habitantes.

Por esta razón la señora B. necesita un financiamiento ya que por el transporte los productos son más caros, por lo que requiere comprar en cantidades y poder vender un poco  mas barato que los demás negocios.

Cabe señalar que la señora B. ha sido cliente desde hace varios años de ADEPHCA y con el programa Kiva se ha beneficiado en una ocasión y esta solicitando un segundo crédito. Esta microempresaria ha demostrado en todos su créditos su capacidad de pagar sus compromisos.

Solicita se le financie para comprar los siguientes productos: 2 docenas de Ropa interior para hombres las que compra a US 48 dólares cada docena, 3 docenas de ropa interior para niños las que compra a US 34 dólares cada docena,  10 quintales de arroz americano, los que compra a US 40 dólares cada quintal, 6 quintales de azúcar los que compra a US 35 dólares cada quintal y 6 bidones de aceite los que compra a US 32 dólares cada bidón.
texts.en:
The small time entrepreneur Francis Dalia B. H. is 47-years old is married with one daughter who is studying in secondary school. Mrs. B. has a store where she sells all small grains, clothing for children and adults and other products. This business is located at the port of El Bluff which is situated about 5-kilometers from Bluefields and has about 3,000 inhabitants.

For this reason, Mrs. B. needs financing to transport the expensive products that are to be purchased in large quantities. Also she needs to sell needs to sell the smaller cheaper items that remain in the store. It should be noted that Mrs. B. has been a client with ADEPHCA for many years through the Kiva program and she has benefited the first time and is now seeking a second loan request. This small time entrepreneur has demonstrated to all that she has the capacity to repay her commitments.

The loan request is to purchase the following products: 2 dozen undergarments for men which cost $48 USD per dozen. 3 dozen undergarments for infants with cost $34 USD per dozen. 10 sacks of American rice which cost $40 USD for each sack, 6 sacks of sugar which cost $35 USD per sack and 6 drums of oil which costs $32 USD for each drum.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar Ropa interior para hombres, ropa interior para niños, arroz americano, azúcar y aceite.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells notebooks and textbooks. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. Victoria is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140, 000 to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more note and text books to sell

loans.name: Nifemi

texts.en: Nifemi is 32 years old and married with two children. She sells sarongs and kitchen utensils. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de 7 hijos, estudio primaria completa, y  vive  en la comunidad de López.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de ovinos.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, Dinero que será invertido en la compra de ganado ovino y porcino para mejorarlos y luego venderlos en las ferias semanales de Ilave, la Sra. Lidia también se dedica a la chacra.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovinos.

loans.name: Santa Dorotea

texts.es: La señorita Santa Dorotea  T. T. Cuanta con 41 años de edad soltera vive con su madre, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace 10 años confeccionando  chumpas y sudaderos trabaja como operaria esta actividad por lo que sus ingresos son muy bajos decidió adquirir un préstamo con la Asociacion Asdir para poder crear su propio micro empresa en la confeccion de la misma conciente con su necesidad que tiene el propósito es el mejoramiento de sus ingresos mensuales ayudando también a su madre a comprar sus medicamentos.

loans.use: Artesania (compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila es socia del Bancomunal Jadat, es separada, tiene 53 años, tres hijos mayores, Zoila trabajaba en una empresa cocinando por que le gusta la cocina, lo dejo porque se enfermó y se dedicó a la venta D. artículos D. cama, edredones, sabanas.   
En Finca ella ha recibido mucha ayuda, lo prestamos son precisos ella todo lo que recibe lo invierte  en mercadería, y pueD. comprar mas artículos para dormitorio.
Zoila necesita un préstamo D. 2400 soles para la compra D. una docena D. edredones.
El sueño D. Zoila conseguir un puesto para vender su mercadería y seguir vendiendo por que le gusta  trabajar.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the communal bank "Jadat." She 53 years old, separated and has three grown children. Zoila worked in a business cooking, because she likes to cook, but left due to an illness. She now sells bedding, comforters and sheets. She has received a lot of help from FINCA; the loans are necessary to her business as all she receives is invested in merchandise, and she can buy more bedding items. Zoila currently needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy a dozen comforters. Zoila dreams of having a stall where she can sell her merchandise and of continuing to sell because she enjoys working.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a dozen comforters

loans.name: Mardely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mardely de 46 años de edad, se dedica a las ventas de cosméticos, y venta de refrescos, gaseosas, el cual inicio con dinero propio cuando vendió una camioneta de su propiedad, su esposo es conductor  de una empresa privacidad, procreo tres hijos dos trabajan y uno de 10 años cursa su primaria, su meta es poner una boutique en un punto centrar en donde pueda a traer el cliente, cuando no le pagan es cuando se bajan su capital, ya que se arriesga adar al crédito de quincena pero los clientes trabajan de esta manera, también desea poder mejorar su casa. Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y frutas para hacer los ricos refrescos, ya que viene la mejor temporada del mes y es cuando se vende más. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos a plazo ya que se logra invertir en inventario.
texts.en:
Ms. Mardely is a 46-year-old woman who sells cosmetics and beverages for a living. She started her business with her own money that she received when she sold her van. Her husband is a driver for a private company. They have three children: two who work and a 10-year-old who is in elementary school. Her goal is to set up a boutique in a central point where she can attract more customers. Her working capital decreases when she does not get paid because she takes a risk by offering her goods on a biweekly credit, however, this is how her customers do business with her. She would also like to make home improvements. She will invest this loan in purchasing both cosmetics and the fruit that she needs to make her delicious drinks, this being her peak of the month when her products really sell. She gives thanks to Afodenic for supporting her with microloans in installments, thus allowing her to invest in inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit to make drinks and purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie O. has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells hair extension materials and drinks at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, Julie is able to support her family. This is the high season for her sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. Julie is 36 years old and married with a child. Her husband is a carpenter. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and drinks to sell. She thanks you for the support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extension materials and drinks

loans.name: Las Persistentes Gb Group

texts.es: Venta de comida, frutas, verduras, dulces, CDS, juguetes, material escolar, atención de tienda de barrio, tejido de prendas de vestir y taller de hojalata, son los diversos negocios a los cuales se dedican las integrantes del grupo Las Persistentes GB, que pertenecen al Centro Focal German Busch, se agruparon hace aproximadamente 5 años por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita incrementar su capital de trabajo. Un ejemplo claro es Ernestina Gutiérrez de 42 años,  casada y con cinco hijos, vende peluches  y juguetes hace 25 años en diferentes ferias con la ayuda de sus hijos, ahora por las fiestas de fin de año necesita mayor capital para comprar juguetes, tambien indica que ele gusta la forma de trabajo en grupo por la garantía solidaria ya que no necesita otros requisitos para acceder al préstamo.
texts.en:
The clients of the Las Persistentes GB group sell food, fruit, vegetables, sweets, CDs, toys, school materials, cloth for clothing and one has a tin workshop. They belong to the German Busch regional branch. They formed a group together 5 years ago for the necessity of a working capital loan that permitted them to increase their working capital.

One example is Ernestina, 42 years old, married with 5 children. She has sold stuffed animals and toys for 25 years in different markets with the help of her children. Now she needs more capital to buy toys for the holidays at the end of the year. She also indicates that she likes the group form of credit for the solidarity guarantee that doesn't need other requirements to apply for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna U. is from the village of Maramag , Bukidnon. She is 33 years old, married, and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The primary source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies like cassava and hotcakes in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Rosemary is a trader. She trades in second-hand bags. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She also sells in a store by the roadside in her community. Rosemary has been in business for over 16 years and desires to give her business a facelift. She wants the loan to procure more goods.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Née le 15 Juillet 1984 à So-Ava dans le département de l'Atlantique, S. Honorine est mariée à ATINDOGBE Florent. Le couple a six enfants à charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Seulement certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 8 ans environs à Godomey dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Honorine a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire, puis a appris la coiffure. Honorine exerce cette activité depuis près de 8 ans, une activité qui lui génère de revenu qu'elle utilise pour satisfaire ses différents besoins. Parallèlement à cette activité, Honorine vend des mêches et des produits de beauté dans son atelier situé à Godomey. Honorine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Honorine a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien effectué les remboursements. Honorine sollicite un deuxième crédit afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face aux différents besoins des clients.
texts.en:
Born July 15, 1984 in So-Ava in the department of the Atlantic, Honorine S. is married to Florent ATINDOGBE. The couple have six children under their care, of which three are their own. Only some of the children are educated. The family has been living for approximately eight years in the Abomey-Calavi area. The couple share household expenses. Honorine attended school up to secondary level, then learned hairdressing. She has been practicing this trade for the past eight years, which generates income to meet her different needs. Additionally, Honorine sells hair extensions and beauty products in her beauty salon located in Godomey. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Honorine has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, and reimbursed it in full. She now requests a second loan to bolster her business and better respond to her customers’ diverse needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two dozen hair extensions and two cartons of shampoo.

loans.name: Rehema Samuel

texts.en:
Rehema Samuel is a charcoal dealer in Mombasa's Mikoroshoni area. She started her business four years ago and it has been a success. She is the mother of three children and is married to Festus Baya.

Rehema is now borrowing her first loan from KADET and she plans to invest the money massively into her business by adding more stock of charcoal.

Rehema was introduced to KADET by an existing member and she joined their group. She mainly serves the residents of Mikoroshoni and the surrounding small-scale traders.

Rehema hopes to expand into a wholesaler in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Denia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Denia M. vive en la Colonia Flor del Campo, se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de Tortillas desde hace veinticinco años, Denia comienza a las 12:00 del mediodia y termina a las 4:00 de la tarde su produccion, cuenta con clientes fijos que le entrega las tortillas diariamente, tiene la ayuda de una hija que es la que se encarga de entregarlas,  vende todos los dias de la semana, su esposo labora para una empresa constructora, desempeñandose como motorista.
Tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo dos dependen de ellos.
Juntos Denia y su esposo han trabajado los dos y han logrado ayudarle a sus hijos.
La señora necesita el dinero para la compra de materia prima como ser harina de maiz y leña. En esta temporada han tenido problemas para encontrar leña y necesita tener en inventario.
texts.en:
Denia M. lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood. She has made tortillas for sale for the past 25 years. Denia starts production at noon and finishes at 4pm. She has regular customers to whom she delivers tortillas daily; her daughter helps by making the deliveries. She sells every day. Her husband is employed as a driver by a construction company. They have five children but only two are dependent on them still . Together, Denia and her husband have worked and have managed to help their children. She needs funds to buy raw materials, like corn flour and firewood. They have had difficulties this season finding firewood and she needs to have it in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, firewood, lime powder, water.

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
La señora María Marlene P. Z. , tiene 36 años, tiene una  hija de  un año, se dedica a la producción de tubérculos ( papa, oca, papa lisa) y leguminosa (haba, arveja) la Señora tiene experiencia  más 6 años,  los productos son vendidos en la fría de colomi. Los insumos agrícolas que utiliza son;  abono orgánico (gallinaza), semilla certificadas  son adquiridos de las tiendas agropecuarias  de colomi, actualmente está con la preparación de terreno para la siembra.

La señora María Marlene vive en la comunidad de liriuni a 1 km de colomi hacia norte del  pueblo,  la Sra actualmente vive en la casa de su padre, El padre no vidente perdió la vista hace 20 años, la Sra. Trabaja para mantener a su padre y a su hija, ella es muy trabajadora contrata personas eventuales para la siembra y la cosecha de productos.

Para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo a la cuidad,  el CIDRE está en la zona de colomi que  para ellos es más fácil  acceder a un crédito  para comprar insumos agrícolas que necesitan para la siembra de próxima campaña agrícola así va ampliar la producción de papa.
Ella nos cuenta que se va a casar con el padre de su hija, el mayor sueño que tiene es tener una casa propia con la comodidades propias, y ahorras dinero para hacer estudiar a su hija,
texts.en:
María Marlene P. Z. is 36 years old, and as a 1 year old daughter. She grows tubers (potatoes, oca, ulluco) and legumes (broad beans, peas). María has been doing this for over 6 years and her products are sold in the cold of Colomi. The agricultural inputs that she uses are: organic fertiliser (from chickens), certified seeds that are acquired in the agricultural shops in Colomi, plus preparing the land for sowing time. María Marlene lives in the community of Liriuni, 1 kilometre from Colomi to the north of the village. She lives in her father's house. He doesn't have sight, as he lost it 20 years ago. María Marlene works to look after her father and daughter. She is a very hard-working and contracts casual labour for sowing and harvesting. It is difficult for them to go to banks in the city in search of a loan. CIDRE is in the Colomi zone and so it is easier for them to get a loan from CIDRE to puchase the agricultural inputs that they need for sowing the next season of crops. In this way they will increase their production of potatoes. María Marlene tells us that she is going to marry her daughter's father. Her biggest dream is that she has her own house with good comforts, and savings so that her daughter can study.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de Insumos Agricolas

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme est un célibataire, il vit dans le quartier d’agoè demakpoè qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, pour subvenir à ses besoins, il s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce de charbons de bois, afin d’augmenter ses recettes plus tard, il y a associé le commerce de céréales. Il s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Kpalimé. La demande de sa clientèle est de plus en plus forte, pour pouvoir mieux les satisfaire, il doit augmenter son stock de marchandises. Pour réaliser cela il demande à WAGES un premier prêt pour acheter 35 sacs de charbons de bois, 23 sacs de maïs et assurer le transport.
texts.en:
This young man is unmarried. He lives in the Agoè Demakpoè borough, which is on the outskirts of Lomé. To meet his needs, he started a business in 2008 retailing charcoal. Later, to increase his earnings, he also started retailing cereals. He gets his supplies from the country’s interior in Kpalimé. Customer demand is increasing, so he must expand his stock supply to satisfy customer needs. He is therefore requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy 35 bags of charcoal, 23 bags of corn and ensure transportation of the merchandise.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy charcoal

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Las Pampas, del distrito de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en areas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, este negocio es de mucha utilidad para los vecinos de la zona en donde vive ya que esta se encuentra alejada de la ciudad y no cuentan con articulos de uso diario al alcance de la mano.  Adicionalmente constituye un ingreso importante para la economía familiar ya que los ingresos que percibe como trabajador agrícola no le bastan para mantener a los suyos.

Juan desea ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ventas y asegurarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas abarrotes con los cuales lograr su objetivo.

Juan es una persona bastate entregada a su familia y su progreso es su mayor anhelo, el desea incrementar el volumen de sus ventas para otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y clientes lo consideran alguien amable y confiable.
texts.en:
Juan is a 48-year old head of household, who lives with his family in the Las Pampas section of Olmos. It is known as a rural zone that belongs to the Lambayeque province, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, he has dedicated himself to the sale of products of basic necessity. This business provides a great service to the neighbors of the area, since they are located far from the city and don’t have easy access to many everyday supplies. Additionally, the business constitutes a vital source of income for the family since his work as a farmer does not provide enough to support them. Juan wants to expand his business in to increase sales which, in turn, can help assure a better standard of living for his family. For this reason, he finds himself for the first time appealing to Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of more supplies to meet his goals. Juan is devoted to his family, and getting ahead is his greatest wish. He wants to increase the volume of his sales in order to better provide for them. His neighbors and customers consider him friendly and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to expand his general store.

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
Cecilia R. is from the village of Villa Luna, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Cecilia is 24 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Mrs. Viviana R. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 54 years old and married with only one child. To make a living, she manages her sari-sari store and her husband is a farmer. She has been managing her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,500 a month. Her husband also supports their daily basic needs.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used for the expansion of her business. Now she has a new loan of 5,000 from PMPC, which will be used for additional capital of her business. She plans that the additional revenue generated from the business will help to improve the background of the borrower's family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Épé

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de friperie, sa clientèle se compose aussi bien de personnes adultes que de jeunes gens,  elle s’approvisionne au  marché local de hedrzanawoé. Elle veut gonfler son stock de marchandises et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’un balle de vêtements. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who has a revenue-generating business selling second-hand clothing. Her customer base is composed of adults, as well as youngsters. She gets her supplies at the local market of Hedrzanawoé. She wants to expand her stock of merchandise and is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying a bale of clothing. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Ana Liz

texts.es:
La Sra. Ana Liz   es casada, ella  tiene una farmacia  denominado El Pueblo, cuya venta es muy satisfactoria, generándole un buen ingreso. 

Con la ayuda de su esposo y toda la familia  están saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esmero. 

Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  cantidad de clientes en ascenso, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de medicamento para la venta.
texts.en:
Ana Liz is a married woman who has a pharmacy called El Pueblo. Her sales are very good, and the business generates a good income. With the help of her husband and all her family, she is forging ahead with great industry and sacrifice. Today, she is a successful micro-entrepreneur with an increasing number of clients, thanks to the good service she provides. She is responsible and honest in meeting her commitments. She is seeking a loan to buy medicine to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicine to sell in her pharmacy

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 45-year-old housewife. Her sons and daughters are now able to care for themselves. Her husband is a farmer who plants vegetables and fruit, and then sells his produce to shops in Jenin.

Because her children are grown, Ameera thought she might help her husband by renting a small shop to sell the vegetables and fruits he produces.
Ameera took a $1,000 loan to rent the shop and prepare it to exhibit vegetables and fruits. Ameera sells at a good price in order to have regular customers.

Ala, Ameera's son, appears in the photograph in the Faten office, because Ameera is not comfortable having her picture online.

loans.use: Open a fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 30-year-old housewife and the mother of two daughters and one son. Ola and her husband, Ala, own a small poultry business. Ola and Ala buy chickens and eggs in large quantities and sell them to small shops in the village of Howara, which is next to Nablus, the city where they live.

Ola and Ala clean the chickens so they can sell them ready-to-cook and they wrap the chickens along with the eggs. Ola and her husband noticed that their business has grown in the past eight years. They want to purchase more chickens and eggs to increase their profits. They also save from their income so that, in the future, they can have their own farm for producing chicken and eggs, instead of buying from others.

Ala appears in the picture, because Ola is not comfortable having her picture online.

loans.use: Purchase chickens and eggs

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel de 39 años, el vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, es fotógrafo y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años. 

Y tiene varios años como fotógrafo, pero tuvo que seguir esta profesión por la falta de oportunidades, con el fin de mantener a su familia el tuvo que comprar una carama fotográfica y una computadora para digitalizar las fotos, poco a poco con ayuda de su esposa pudieron tener un local y ubicar un centro de fotografías. Ahora trabajan hasta en horarios nocturnos por la cantidad numerosa de clientes. 

Para poder readecuar su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, cemento y pintura. En el futuro quiere tener una panadería para tener un ingreso adicional y mejorar la vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 39 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He is a photographer. His two children are 8 and 6 years old, respectively. He has been a photographer for several years. He had to choose this occupation to support his family because of a lack of other opportunities. He had to buy a camera and a computer to digitalize the photos. Little by little, with the help of his wife, he acquired a small photography store. Now he and his wife work late into the night because they have many customers. For the growth of his business, he wants to buy tables, glue, and paint with this loan. In the future, he would like to have a bakery in order to earn additional income and improve the life of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tables, glue, and paint

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos.
