Por muchos años atrás se dedicaba en la venta de comida, actualmente vende pescados, en el acopio principal  pesquero del cono Sur, es así que desde las 4:00 de la mañana recibe la cantidad de pescados y mariscos que previamente fue solicitado y a las 5 de la mañana los distribuye a todos los pequeños comerciantes de diversos mercados. Los pescados que más demanda tiene son: corvina, bonito y conchitas; dejándoles muy buenas rentas por lo que siente muy satisfecha por desarrollar esta actividad. Lleva 5 años trabajando en esta actividad y desea ampliar su negocio, distribuyendo toda la zona del cono sur de Lima, de ese modo podrá captar mayores ganancias. Es su séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será de mucha utilidad para el crecimiento de su capital, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente. Con el crédito que solicita, se abastecerá de más pescados y mariscos, para cumplir con la mator demanda que le hacen sus clientes minoristas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 47 years old and lives in her own home, along with her husband and two children. She’d been selling prepared food for many years, but now she sells fish in the main fish market in the Cono Sur area. She waits here from 4:00 AM to receive the fish and seafood that she has previously ordered and by 5:00 AM she distributes her wares to all of the small businesses and different markets. The fish in greatest demand are corvina, bonito, and conchita; which provide very good profits and leave her satisfied for developing this activity. She’s been doing this for five years and distributes throughout the Cono Sur zone of Lima. In this way she can have better earnings. This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she knows that this money will be very useful for the growth of her working capital. She is committed to making her payments on time and will use the money from this loan to buy more fish and seafood in order to meet her increased customer demands.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fish and seafood

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Sandiat West. She is 56 years old. Adelaida is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 38,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. This loan is Adelaida's 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Mushviq

texts.en:
Mushviq M. has an economic activity dedicated to the raising of animals in order to generate revenue from the animals and the products they provide. Mushviq has earned a living from raising cattle since he was young. He's married and has two children. His monthly income is 300-400 Azerbaijani New Manat (AZN). He usually sells cattle to the local butchers.

Mushviq needs to buy animals such as cows and calves. He's applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN.

loans.use: Purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Habiba

texts.fr:
Madame Habiba T.  est une femme mariée, âgée de 34 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit  dans une famille polygame avec ses enfants, époux, coépouse et vit bien d’autres parents dans le quartier Sincina de la ville de Koutiala ( région de Sikasso ). 
Elle  n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires, raison pour laquelle elle a vite embrassé les activités génératrices depuis son jeune âge, auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la restauration depuis maintenant  7 ans. Très courageuse, elle est très bien connue dans le secteur dont sa notoriété est bonne, car reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux mois et elle est à son 1er prêt en individuel.  
Avec ce financement, Habiba  compte acheter,  5 sacs de  50  kg de haricot  pour les stocker, 5 cartons de spaghetti et des condiments alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Koutiala et  effectue la vente de ses plats alimentaires dans son petit restaurant  à Koutiala ville à une clientèle mixte, au comptant. 
Elle espère  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activités génératrices de revenus.    
 Elle  ambitionne solliciter un financement qui pourra lui permettre d’ouvrir un grand restaurant  dans la ville de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Ms. Habiba T. is a married woman, 34 years old and mother of three children. She lives in a polygamous family with her children, husband, co-wife and many other family members in the neighborhood of Sincina in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region).
She did not have the chance to complete her primary education, which is why she began working at a very young age, together with her mother.  After several different business attempts, that ended without success, seven years ago she opted for a restaurant business. Being very courageous, she is very well known in the industry, her reputation is very good and she has a large number of customers every day.
To satisfy her customers demand and increase the size of her business, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago and she requests her first individual loan.
With this loan, Habiba plans to buy 5 bags of 50 kg of beans each, 5 boxes of spaghetti and different condiments. She buys her supplies at the open market in Koutiala and she sells her food dishes in her small restaurant, always in Koutiala, in cash and to a mixed group of customers. 
She hopes to achieve an average profit of 65.000FCFA per month, that she would use to pay interests on her loan and she would invest the rest in income generating activities. Her ambition is to obtain a loan that will allow her to open a big restaurant in the town of Koutiala.

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients for a restaurant

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is the resident of Kamoki, which is a small industrial city also known for its rice and other agricultural crops. She lives in the area of Tiba mohammad nagar with her family in a 2-room brick house.

She is a very active lady who shares the financial burden with her husband by selling shawls (a kind of cloth, worn over the shoulders and body) and doing embroidery works. She receives embroidery orders from her neighboring clients and fulfills the orders on time to make an income.  

Her husband’s name is L. A. and he deals with rice. He has a shop in the market from where he operates his business of selling rice. He purchases them from the whole sale market on cheap rates and sells it on good profit. He has been doing this business for over 15 years.

Bilqees is the mother of 3 sons and 2 daughters. Her two elder sons are employed in a factory while the remaining 3 are enrolled in a school and are getting their education.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy rice in bulk from wholesale market and earn a good return on it. She is very confident that her husband will be able to improve his business conditions with the help of the loan investment.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous the loan year, she built good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Bilqees”.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for reselling.

loans.name: Bun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun K., who is 58 years old, was selected as the leader of this group loA. located in Preaek Hour Kaeut village in Kandal province. Each of them will use their portion of the loA. for a different purpose.  

She is a banana seller in a local market where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her business does well from time-to-time, she wants to expand. So, to improve this business, she is asking for a loA. to buy more bananas to sell. 

She is married to Mr. Leng Nav, who is a fishermA., and she has two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
María de 50 años, tiene un pequeño comedor de mariscos. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 30 años comenzó con un pequeño puesto de madera en la calle principal de la playa. Pero hace 10 años que murió su esposo para poder superarse más económicamente y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos comenzó con su negocio en un local. Trabaja los fines de semana aprovechando los turistas que llegan para comprar la comida típica de la costa del Ecuador. El mínimo del costo de los platos es de $ 3.00 hasta $ 7.00 vende cebiches, pescado frito, camarones apanados etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas y sillas para poder agrandar su negocio y que sus clientes estén comodos. En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, who is 50 years old, has a small seafood eatery. She lives on a small street called "Playas" ["Beaches"], one of the tourist places in Ecuador with a diverse selection of seafood.

She began 30 years ago with a small wooden stand on the main street of the beach. But 10 years ago, after her husband died, to be able to improve economically and give her children a better life, she began her business in her home. She works on the weekends making the most of the tourists that arrive to buy the typical food of the Ecuadorian coast. The minimum cost of the dishes is from $3.00 to $7.00. She sells "cebiches" (a typical seafood dish), fried fish, breaded shrimp, etc.

With the loan, she wants to buy tables and chairs to be able to enlarge her business and so that her customers can be comfortable. In the future she wants to improve her business and quality of life.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es:
Jesús María es una madre de famiulia de 55 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su última hija en el distrito de Las Lomas, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos y público en general una diversidad de productos de consumo diario, entre artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, a precios cómodos y con un buen servicio. Debido al tiempo que ya lleva funcionando la bodega cuenta con bastante acogida por parte de sus vecinos. Gracias a ella, Jesús ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Jesús desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos que le permitan satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, sobretodo durante esta temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jesús María, 55, is a mother living with her husband and youngest daughter in Las Lomas district, a farming district in Piura region, located about four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She has a grocery store installed in her house.  She offers her neighbors and the general public diverse basic, daily use items, among which are first need items and groceries, at reasonable prices and with good customer service.  Because of the time she’s been in business the store is well received by her neighbors.  Thanks to it, Jesús is able to help her husband support the family.

Jesús would like to expand the business acquiring more stock items to meet customer demand, especially during the Christmas holidays.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan that she plans to use to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia S., age 35, runs a retail shop in Mukuku, which has many villagers. She is married to Cosmas and together they have two daughters: Winfred and Agnes, ages 20 and 18 years respectively. She has been running her business for two years and her monthly profit is 10,000 Kenyan shillings. Cecilia was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Tala office. This loan of 15,000 KES is her second loan with KADET and she plans to use it to increase stock of sugar, detergents, bread and paraffin for sale. If the loan boosts business, Cecilia will pay school fees and buy food for her children. Cecilia dreams of having a wholesale shop. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stock of sugar, detergents, bread and paraffin for sale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel forma parte del banco comunal “Confiando en Ti”, perteneciente a la ciudad Chillán. Ella arrienda un kiosco, cerca del centro de la ciudad,  en donde vende diarios y confites desde hace 4 meses. Sus horarios de trabajo son de lunes a sábado, de 8:30 hrs. A 17:30 hrs. Antes del arrendar el kiosco, vendía artículos de hogar de manera ambulante.
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, es decir, diarios y confites. 
Vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, de  14 y 4 años.
Su  sueño es tener un kiosco propio.  
A Maribel le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, para mantener su negocio. También está muy agradecida ya que, debido al terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero perdió su casa y su negocio,  y por medio de Fondo Esperanza obtuvo una mediagua, en donde ha hecho ampliaciones y vive todavía.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
Maribel is part of the communal bank, “Confiando en Ti,” in the city of Chillán. She rents a kiosk, close to the center of the city, from which she has sold newspapers and candies for 4 months. Her hours of work are Monday to Saturday from 8:30 to 5:30. Before renting the kiosk, she would sell home items from the streets.

With this loan, she will buy merchandise, as stated, newspapers and candies.

She lives with her husband and their 2 children, 14 and 4 years old.

Her dream is to have her own kiosk.

The loans from Fondo Esperanza have served Maribel well to maintain her business. Also, she is grateful since, due to the earthquake from the previous 27th of February, she lost her home and business but through Fondo Esperanza she obtained a hut, where she has made expansions and lives today.

Chillán is a municipality of the South central area of Chile. It’s name means “Seat of the sun” in mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches. Chillán is known as the “Cradle of the homeland” or the “Land of Artists,” because the city has given birth to distinguished people in the history of Chile, such as the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: Diarios y confites

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El Sr. Rosendo es un hombre que trabajo desde sus 24 años de edad en rubro de transporte actividad donde le va muy bien, en la actualidad el Sr. Rosendo tiene 46 años de edad, casado con la señora Gipsi que se dedica a labores del hogar, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando vive en casa familiar ubicado  en el barrio Oriental zona norte de la ciudad de Santa Don Rosendo utilizara el dinero del crédito para ya que el tiene un buen historial crediticio El cliente  manifestó su agradecimiento por la rapidez del crédito y lo bien que lo atendieron el la Institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Rosendo is a man who has worked in transportation since the age of 24. It is going very well. He is now 46 and married to Gipsi, who does the housework. They have 2 children who are in school. They live in the family home in the Oriental neighbourhood in the north of the city of Santa Don Rosendo.

He has a good credit history. He is grateful for how quickly he was approved and for the good service in the Institution.

loans.use: maintenance for his vehicle (auto body repair)

loans.name: Joseph Muiruri

texts.en: Joseph has practiced farming in Naivasha since 2001.  He is 39 years old, married to Eunice Wanja and they have one child. Joseph was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan.  He has repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  Joseph plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. In the future, Joseph hopes to have his own farming equipment and machinery.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Shania

texts.en: Shania is a 24-year-old married woman living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She longs to build her own permanent residence. She has been operating a bar and restaurant for four years and the business is steadily growing,  however she is challenged by unreliable customers.  She plans to move to town. Shania needs the loan to buy a deep freezer for her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es:
Grecia, tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera, ella nació en la ciudad del cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Grecia es una joven estudiosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, ella estudia la carrera profesional Psicología en la Universidad Alas Peruanas del Cusco y está en el 5 semestre, ella también tiene un pequeño negocio familiar que consiste en la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo hormigón, arena, piedra chancada,  entre otros. Ya son 3 años que trabaja y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Grecia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo arena y otras cosas más.    

Grecia pertenece al banco comunal “Sol de Oro” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Grecia is 19 years old and was born in the city of Cusco, where she still lives. She is a studious, hardworking, and enterprising young woman who is studying for her professional degree in psychology at La Universidad Alas Peruanas in Cusco. Grecia is in her fifth semester. She also has a small family business selling construction materials such as concrete, sand, crushed stone, and other products. Grecia has been working for three years and has done very well as a result of her efforts. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy more materials, such as sand and other products.

Grecia is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity being given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is currently in a business of maize flour. She is 30 years old, married, with 4 children and all of them go to school.Grace borrowed a loan to stock more maize flour to sell. Her future goal is to build a big shop with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more  maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Juan de 47 años, quien es chofer de colectivo, y de sus 2 hijos mayores de edad, que aún se mantienen solteros. Desde muy joven esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, cuando era pequeña observaba a sus padres como realizaban esta actividad y ahora que tiene su propia familia se dedica a la siembra de gladiolo, arvejas, zanahoria y  lechuga en tierras que le son propias, siendo apoyada por sus hijos. Dice que el esfuerzo y dedicación que le brinda a sus chacras tienen su recompensa, cuando obtiene una buena producción, y que son vendidos a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad. Es así como se gana la vida, permitiéndole vivir cómodamente al lado de su familia. Ana menciona que tiene muchos proyectos en mente como sembrar en mayor cantidad las verduras que tanta satisfacción económica le han dado, pues tiene más hectáreas de terrenos por cultivar y cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de sus hijos. Es el décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además esta satisfecha con el desempeño de sus compañeros de su banco comunal pues todos son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y abono para asegurar sus cultivos para la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 47 year-old Juan who is a driver (on a fixed route), and her two grown-up children who are still single. 

This hard-working woman has been farming since she was very young.  When she was a little girl she watched her parents farm and, now she has her own family, she also farms, growing gladioli, peas, carrots and lettuce on her own land, supported by her children.  She says that the effort and commitment that she puts into her farm has its reward when she had a good production and sells her produce to the wholesalers in the city.  This is how Ana earns a living and it allows her to live comfortably with her family.  Ana mentions that she has a lot of projects in mind such as sowing the vegetables that have provided her with so much financial satisfaction in larger quantities as she still has more hectares of land to cultivate and the unconditional support of her children.

This is Ana's tenth loan from MFP and she is grateful to everybody who made the loan possible as it will allow her to continue working.  She is also satisfied with the performance of her fellow bank members as they are all very responsible in making their loan repayments.  Ana plans to invest her loan in buying pea seeds and manure in order to safeguard her crops for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of manure

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos de 18 y 24 años de edad; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las cuales elabora en su casa desde hace 9 años, su horario de venta es de 10:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y gas, estos materiales son los insumos necesarios para hacer las tortillas, el préstamo será una gran ayuda para fortalecer el negocio, aumentar su producción y mejorar su vida cotidiana.
El sueño y aspiración de ella es tener un negocio más amplio, con mayor capacidad para atender a los clientes,  recibir mayores ingresos que contribuyan  al mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Jucuapa, in Usulután department, with her children aged 18 and 24.  Rosa sells tortillas which she makes in her home.  She has been in this business for nine years.  She sells her products from 10.00am to 6.00pm.

Rosa currently needs a loan to buy corn, firewood and gas.  These are the supplies she needs to make her tortillas.  The loan will be a great help in strengthening her business, increasing her production and improving her everyday life.

Rosa's dream and aspiration is to have a bigger business where she can serve more customers and make more income which she will use to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy packets of mineral water, two bags of sugar, and six bags of bissap

loans.name: Artsvi

texts.en:
This Kiva client lives in Yerevan together with his wife and parents. He earns a living by purchasing household items and stationery in bulk and delivers these to his customers, using a rented car. 

He would like to be able to purchase and deliver more goods. With the help of this loan, he will be able to make a bulk purchase of stationery and household items, as well as to increase his working capital. 

Additional income will help him to ensure better living conditions for his family in the future.

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of stationery and household items

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar, de 27 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida. Edgar pasa sus días manejando su taxi, no importa si es de día o de noche, él sigue recorriendo las calles en busca de clientes que deseen llegar a su destino. El carácter de Edgar es estar siempre de buen ánimo y muy comunicativo, eso le ha dado ventaja de tener clientes fijos, favoreciéndole también en los ingresos. Otras de las ventajas que tiene es que conoce muy bien las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa y procura siempre brindar un servicio rápido. Tiene 2 años realizando este trabajo y desea continuar ya que su principal anhelo es comprarse otro carro, de esa manera asegurará más ingresos. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y solidario. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, hará arreglar su taxi, ya que tiene algunas averías.
texts.en:
Edgar, 27, is a very kind and hard working young man.  He lives in a leased house and is very willing to work very hard to improve his quality of life.  Edgar spends his days driving his taxi; it doesn’t matter if it’s day or night, he continues riding around the streets looking for customers that want to reach their destination.  

Edgar’s personality is such that he’s always in a good mood and very communicative; this has led to his having the advantage of having regular customers which in turn leads to favorable income.  Another advantage he has is that he knows the streets in Pucallpa very well and he always strives to provide quick service.  He’s been doing this work for two years and wants to stay with it since his main wish is to buy another car to insure still more income.

This will be his first loan with MFP.  He is willing to pay all his installments on time.  He is a very responsible and supportive member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested five-hundred new soles to service his taxi since it has a few malfunctions.

loans.use: to have his car serviced.

loans.name: Argbomuma Women's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Argbomuma Women’s” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Fatmata. Fatmata was born in the village of Jumuka Faibu, 45 years ago. She is married to the village chief and the couple has 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatmata sells market-food – cooking oil, fish, groundnuts, palm-oil, etc. She has been running this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of Janneh, a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, fish, groundnuts, palm-oil, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Archangel

texts.en:
Archangel is a 51-year-old married man with six children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the local brew business for 20 years now. He says that so far in the business he sees himself on a progressive line. His main challenge is inadequate capital to buy more bananas for processing the local brew, as the demand for the product is always high in his locality. His goal is to buy a plot of land and erect rental houses on it, and to educate his children up to university level.
Archangel needs the loan facility to buy bananas for processing local brew.

loans.use: to buy bananas for processing local brew.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 26 years old, single, and planning to get married this year. She has been running her salon business for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of about 8,000 KES (~$93) which she saves and also uses in the business.

She has been loaned 15,000 KES from KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to purchase beauty / cosmetic products, and also hair extensions to sell and use in the salon.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to plan for her wedding. Ann's hopes and dreams for herself are to get married this year, start her salon nearer to her new home and make it big.

loans.use: To purchase beauty / cosmetic products, and also hair extensions to sell and use in the salon.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 30-year-old married woman and mother of three children. She works hard to provide the best living for them. Najah opened her shop three years ago. She sells women, men and children's wear, in addition to the household appliances she introduced early to her clients. Najah is a hardworking woman who seeks perfection for her family. That’s why she helps her husband increase their income to provide healthy living for her family.

Najah is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase her shop’s capital for the Holy Ramadan month's Celebrations, since most of the kids celebrate the end of this month with fireworks, candies and a lot more ways, and she has to be ready with new clothes collection they have to wear. Najah is a woman with good reputation. She has good communication skills and customer care.

loans.use: To increase her inventory for the Holy Ramadan month's celebrations

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio, tiene la edad 53 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa ye hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de  café. El cuenta con un terreno sembrado de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos, fungicidas y mano de obra para darle un mejor mantenimiento y así obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un cafetal que genere una buena producción para vender  café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Aurelio is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. With this loan he wants to invest in his coffee fields. He has a plot of land that he planted with coffee and he wants to invest in inputs such as fertilizer and fungicides and in labor so that he can maintain his land better and have a better harvest. He wants to establish a coffee plantation that produces well so that he can sell quality coffee. He wants to generate a greater amount of income for his well-being and for that of his family and to expand his coffee business.

This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Previously he had not received other loans from state-run banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him this loan with more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his coffee fields.

loans.name: Guidelyn

texts.en:
Guidelyn is 29 years old and has two children. Guidelyn is married and her two children are in school. She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Guidelyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Guidelyn has been raising livestock for four years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Guidelyn would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch (in the photo) is 59 years old and her husband, Seap, is 59 years old.  They live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children (two sons and three daughters). Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a chef for a garment factory, one is a construction worker, and another one is in school.   

Touch and her husband are rice farmers. Besides farming, Touch also sells cakes in her village, and her husband is a fisherman. 

Touch is asking for a loan of $400 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, de 50 años es una mujer valiente y trabajadora. Que lucha para sacar adelante a su esposo Apolonio y su hijo Ronaldo quien es el último de los 5 hijos que tubo. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Desde hace 20 años comenzó a forjar su vida en compañía de su esposo. En ese momento ella, empezó a trabajar en la agricultura, su principal actividad económica. Desde entonces comenzó a trabajar con ahínco para poder tener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde pueda sembrar en gran cantidad. Le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que siembra papa en grandes cantidades, además de poseer toros, que le ayudan en el arado de la tierra. Minimizando así los costos de mantenimiento. Cuenta que en todo este tiempo logró adquirir clientes fijos, tanto así que ahora ellos mismo viajan a sus terrenos a comprar sus cosechas enteras. Ahora su principal meta, es adquirir un camión grande, para poder trasladar los alimentos que siembra a la ciudad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progreso Cayan” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Flora sembró papa de la variedad “Yungay” por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales que le servirán para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Flora, 50, is a brave, hardworking woman who strives to support her husband, Apolonio, and the youngest of her five children, Ronaldo.  They live together in family unity in their own house located in the hamlet of Cayan.  She started forging her life together with her husband twenty years ago.  At that time, she started working in farming, her main economic activity.  Since then, she started working with dedication in order to have her own fields where she could plant in quantity.  She does very well in her business because she plants potatoes in large amounts and she also owns bulls that help her till the soil minimizing maintenance costs.  She relates that throughout all this time she’s managed to secure regular customers, so much so that they themselves come to her fields to buy her entire crops.  Now, her main goal is to acquire a large truck to transport the foodstuffs she grows to the city.

She is a member of the “Progreso Cayan” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where she hopes to get support from all of you to reach her goal.  Besides, she promises to be very punctual with her repayments.

Flora planted the “Yungay” variety of potatoes thanks to your support and will invest the requested funds in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizer that will help her improve the quality of her crops.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is a widow and has a 19-year-old daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Berdyansk, where she runs a water filter sales business in one of the local malls. She started this business one year ago. Her current working capital is 20,000 Grivnyas and her profit is 5,500 Grivnyas.

Natalya is a competent businesswoman, which has helped her gain the trust of her customers. Water filters sell well in Berdyansk as running water is polluted and needs additional purification. Natalya enjoys working with this type of merchandise and is hoping to continue expanding her business in the future.

Natalya is requesting a loan for 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted merchandise for further retail sale. She is hoping to generate additional profit and invest it in the reconstruction of her small selling facility.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of water filters for sale.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married with three children. Juanita is 47 years old and she lives in Pulang Yuta, Kapatagan Lanao Del Norte.

Juanita sells coconuts to earn a living and has had this business for about 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 12,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase fertilizers. Juanita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Juanita hopes to progress her business for the future of her children and she hopes to buy a motorcycle for business transport purposes.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is 61 years old and married. She lives in Migcanaway Tangub City. Alejandra operates a sari-sari store to earn a living and to sustain her own needs, and she has been in this business for 15 years. Each month she can earn PHP 7,000 from her sari-sari store. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy supplementary goods to sell. Alejandra has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future she hopes that her sari-sari store will expand.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a hair dresser and she sells slippers on the side. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. The income she makes from her sales is used to assist her spouse to take care of the home. She is requesting for a loan from Kiva to buy other types of slippers to bring variety into her business.

loans.use: to buy other types of slippers to bring variety into her business.

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, у него есть взрослый сын. Все втроем они живут в квартире в г. Бердянск. Виктор работает преподавателем в институте. Также он получает дополнительный доход, ремонтируя и обслуживая компьютеры.

Виктор просит предоставить ему кредит на ремонт квартиры. Он сможет поклеить обои, заменить канализацию и водопровод, поставить новые окна. Благодаря кредиту Виктор не только улучшит жилищные условия для своей семьи, но и расходовать меньше энергии и тепла за счет энергосберегающих окон.
texts.en:
Viktor is married and has a son. All three of them live in an apartment in the city of Berdyansk. Viktor is a professor at the local college and he supplements his salary by fixing and servicing computers.

Victor is asking for this loan to repair his apartment. He will be able to hang new wall paper, replace water and sewer pipes and install new windows. Due to this loan Victor will not only able to improve his family's living conditions but will use less energy and heat due to the new energy efficient windows.

loans.use: to hang wallpaper and repair plumbing and windows

loans.name: Ahamed

texts.en:
Ahamed is 57 years old and married with seven children. He deals in cattle buying and selling and has been in this business for 4 years. He is faced with a challenge of inflation. His business goal is to have many cows for sale and his personal goal is to have well-educated children.

Ahmed needs a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Corner Nzuri C Group

texts.en:
Berneta joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Berneta had a good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Berneta was only able to harvest 15 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Berneta will invest in her business and and educate her children.

Berneta is the facilitator of the Corner Nzuri C Group. The photograph shows Berneta with her group members. Berneta and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Corner Nzuri C Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Berneta and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ermila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ermila;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son independientes y dos socios tienen 10, 3 años de edad; la socia tiene un restaurante en el cual expende diferentes potajes de la región, la socia es una mujer muy alegre y luchadora, motivo que la lleva a destacarse en todo lo que emprende, ella en esta ocasión desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de productos al por mayor como son arroz en bolsas, aceite en bidones, papa, carnes, y otros productos que salen a diario en su restaurante, la socia mantiene el restaurante limpio y ordenado, también ella va viendo la entrada y salida de los platos, pese a que aún es un restaurante pequeño desea progresar y darle la calidad de un restaurante de categoría, la socia se levanta cada día con muchas ganas de seguir creciendo porque sabe que todo esfuerzo valdrá la pena y será destinado al bienestar de sus hijos y de sus familia. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para su restaurante como son arroz en bolsas, aceite en bidones,  fideos entre otros.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: This member belongs to communal bank "Señor del Calvario" ("Lord of the Calvary"), which is located in the district of Calca, province of Cusco, department of Cusco. The member is Ermila. She is 40 years old and single. She has four children, two of which are independent and the others are 10 and 3 years old. The member owns a restaurant where she serves various stews from that region. She is a very cheerful and hardworking woman, which is why she stands out in all of her endeavours. On this occasion she wants the loan in order to purchase wholesale goods such as sacks of rice, cans of olive oil, potatoes, meats and other foodstuffs that are used in her restaurant on a daily basis. The member keeps her restaurant clean and organized, and also oversees the orders. Although it is still a small restaurant, she wishes to make progress and provide it with the quality of a first rate restaurant. She wakes up every day with a lot of drive to keep on expanding, because she knows that all of her efforts will pay off and go towards the well-being of her children and her family. The member requests the loan in order to purchase goods for her restaurant such as sacks of rice, cans of olive oil, noodles, etc. She gives thanks for the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her restaurant such as sacks of rice, cans of olive oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Philip A

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Philip.  He is single, and has one child aged three years old. In 1996, Philip established his balusters, files and blocks business. He began his business because he found it difficult to continue his schooling.  He decided to join his elder brother in the production of bricks and balusters for sale until he became financially strong enough to establish his own shop.  

Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,559,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Philip has already received and successfully repaid one loan.  He now requires a new loan in order to purchase: cement (50 bags @ SLL 44,000); iron (30 pieces @ SLL 15,000); and sand (20 trips @ SLL 60,000). The balance amount would be for transportation. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 750,000.

In the future, Philip plans to build a house and further his education. He is nervous about the future because he wants a better standard of living. The loan will help a lot as it is his secondary source of income. His major challenge is high taxes levied by the local district council. Competition is not too high, as two businesses are dealing in the same product. He serves contractors and individuals involved in construction and he serves about 10 customers per day. Philip offers a quality product; that is why his business is popular. His suppliers are located in Makeni. He usually buys his goods twice a month by public transport. He saves some and the remainder to add to the capital of the business. He is planning to expand if he has the resources to so. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, necesita otro préstamo para cultivar granos básicos como maíz y frijoles y para que sus cosechas sean mejores que los otros años comprando los insumos adecuados para la siembra como: abono, herbicidas, semilla solo de esa forma podrá tener mejores cosechas  y podrá darles a su familia lo necesario para vivir.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho porque mejoro sus condiciones de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel needs another loan to grow basic grains such as corn and beans.  In this way his harvests will be better that in other years, by buying adequate supplies for planting, such as fertilizer, herbicide, and seed.  Only in this way will he be able to have better harvests and be able to give his family what is necessary to live.

The previous loan helped him a lot because he improved his and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and seed.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as jovial. He operates a business where he provides motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located near a busy tarmac road, and his primary customers are residents in the business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be climatic conditions; when it rains some roads are impassable. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. His business goal is to own many motorbikes within five years.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Wakilare De Coumbanboure Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Wakilaré de Coumbanbouré(qui veut dire persévérance en peulh) a été créé le 11 Juillet  2008 lors de l’inauguration du  banc villageois. Il compte 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles  font toutes le petit commerce.

Madame Tening (debout à l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle a en charge sept de ses neveux. 

Elle est vendeuse de kola, d’oseille, de gombo et divers autres produits qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaire de la sous région pour la revente dans sa localité. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de cinq ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de s’approvisionner dans ces divers produits kola, oseille pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de cette activité lui permettront d’accroître son  troupeau en parti et de mettre sa famille dans des conditions meilleures.
texts.en:
The Wakilaré de Coumbanbouré group ( which means perseverance in Fula) was created on the 11th July 2008 at the inauguration of the banc villageois (village bank).It is made up of 14 women who all live in the same village and are very determined in their lucrative activitis.They  all have small businesses.

Madame Tening  (standing on the far right) is the leader of the group. She is 45. She is married with one child, she also takes care of seven of her nephews.

She sells kola, sorrel, gumbo and various other products that she buys at the regional weekly market for resale in her village. She has been in this business for over five years.   

Her new loan will enable her to stock up on various products such as kola, sorrel for resale.

The profits from this activity will help to enlarge her flock and offer better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to stock up on various pruducts such as kola and sorrel for resale.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is still in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a General Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, bread and other snack foods.

Margie has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Margie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles, bread and other snack foods

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
This description was written by Moses Onyango, a representative for Village Enterprise Fund and Kiva in Uganda.

He got a grant of 100$ US from VEF as a kick start. He started with selling produce. After attending training on business skills twice, he got wide knowledge on how to choose and manage his business effectively.

He then started running General Merchandise business of welding, tools, work clothes, shoes and bags. He sells supplies which are used by workers who do manual labor in the region. This is a very good area. His business picked up very much and he got enough profit to stock more merchandise.

He now sells a big merchandise in one of the main market in town. The market is a main market in town built where most people go to buy all their necessities of all kinds and his shop benefits from this large numbers of customers. This market is safe, has agate with a security man and has set operational hours like from 8:00 am up to 6:00 pm monday to sunday.

I expect him to do greater business to bring development in the lives of the poor people.

loans.use: Buy tools and other work supplies

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a potato and onion wholesale distributor at a local market. He learned the trade from his parents who practice the same business in a different province of Ecuador named Chimborazo. He started off small, but now he is a wholesaler and distributes to many store owners and people who have stands in local markets. He will use the loan in order to invest in new products such as limes, sugar and oil. Jose is from Chimborazo and has two children. He and his wife are very positive about their future.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products such as limes, sugar and oil

loans.name: Marta Augusto

texts.en:
Marta Augusto M., 27 years old, native of Manhiça, Province of Maputo, widow and resident of district 7. She grew up with her parents in the countryside and was not able to escape the problems that many families with few resources suffer from - the lack of school education.

In 1997, after 7th grade, she abandoned school for an early marriage, having chosen to create her own business along with her husband. Her main activity is purchasing one-day chickens to raise and then sell in the local market. She currently has a chicken house in the yard of her home, and she employs a person who sells the chickens, as well as supplying fresh chicken meat to the community.

Translated from Portuguese by Naomi Baer, Kiva volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 7 - Boane

Cliente: Marta augusto M.

Sector de actividade: Avicultura

Valor de empréstimo: 12.000,00MT (480.00US$)

Aplicação de montante: Compra de pintos de engorde.

Inicio: 10/04/2007

Fim: 31/03/2008 Marta Augusto M. de 27 anos de idade, natural de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, viúva e residente do bairro 7. Cresceu na responsabilidade dos seus pais camponeses e não escapou as dificuldades de falta de educação escolar como passa com muitas famílias de pouca posse.

Em 1997, com a 7@ classe abandonou a escola para casamento prematuro, tendo optado por criar seu próprio negocio junto com o marido.

A sua principal actividade é compra de pintos de (um) 1 dia para posterior engorde e venda no mercado local.

Actualmente conta com uma capoeira dentro do quintal da casa dela e emprega uma pessoa que faz as vendas dos frangos, para alem de fornecer carne fresca de frangos a comunidade.

loans.use: Chickens produce

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria is an enterprising woman with a big desire of improving the quality of life of her family. She is a single mother of two children and she just adopted a two-year-old little girl. Currently she rents a store where she sales handbags, backpacks, tennis shoes and shoes. Now she has the opportunity to buy a small store with easy payments. She needs a loan of $925 for the down-payment that she will repay over a period of 6 months. The love to her children and to the little one she just adopted is the biggest reason for Maria to make an effort to provide what they need. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this family. Thanks!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es madre soltera dos hijos y ha adoptado a una pequeña de 4 años de edad. Actualmente renta un local donde vende bolsas para dama, mochilas, tenis y zapatos, ahora se le ha presentado la oportunidad de comprar un pequeño local en cómodos pagos, y para el enganche requiere de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 6 meses. El amor hacia sus hijos y hacia esa pequeña que ha logrado ganarse su cariño es el más grande motivo para que Maria salga día a día a esforzarse para obtener lo que ellos necesitan. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más, tu ayuda será de mucha utilidad para esta familia, gracias.

loans.use: Buy a store

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo B. is 49 years old. She is married with four children. Her husband works as a security guard and her children hold jobs and have families. Marhabo's business is to make and sell ground meat. Her oldest son helps her by purchasing and preparing meat.

Marhabo has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 when her assets were $125. When she started receiving loans and investing in her business, her assets grew to $340. She purchased a new scale and her own refrigerator in order to store and sell meat. In the future, she plans to add beef and mutton meat to her meat selection.

Translated from Russian to English by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer

Бобочонова Мархабо –49лет. Замужем, мать четверых детей. Муж работает сторожем, дети работают и каждый имеет свою отдельную семью. Она занимается изготовлением и продажей фарша. Старший сын помогает матери в приобретении мясо для заготовки фарша.

Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2005году, тогда её активы составляли 120$. После получения неоднократного займа и целевого использования её активы постепенно возросли до 340$. Она приобрела новые весы, собственный холодильник хранения и продажи фарша. В будущем планирует добавить в свой ассортимент говяжье мясо и баранину.

loans.use: Increase Meat Assortment

loans.name: Jero Ketut Pudak

texts.id:
In her neighborhood of Ekasari village Jero Ketut Pudak is considered a successful farmer. Because her 1 mother pig bore 9 piglets, healthy dan fat. Besides that Jero Ketut Pudak raised 3 other piglets to be fattened. Her husband Gusti Nyoman Tulis work as a building laborer. Every day Jero Ketut Pudak with persistence raised these 9 one-month old piglets. Loan from Dinari for Rp 1,700,000 (about US$190-200, depending on exchange rate) are used to buy rice and wheat shell clippings, and konsentrat (local brand). Animal feed price has increase lately, so that the Rp1,700,000 ($200) was not sufficient, since her husband who works as laborer only earns Rp40,000 (about $5)/day. The additional capital from Dinari would be used to cover the animal food shortage. That is why Jero Ketut Pudak hopes that she could obtain additional loan from Dinari. The stall condition is very simple from wood. The plan is that after harvest she could build a permanent stall. Those are Jero Ketut Pudak wishes. She also has 2 raise 2 children still at school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Di lingkungan tetangganya di desa Ekasari Jero Ketut Pudak termasuk peternak yang berhasil. Karena 1 induk babinya beranak 9 ekor, anaknya sehat dan gemuk. Disamping itu Jero Ketut Pudak memelihara 3 ekor penggemukan. Suaminya Gusti Nyoman Tulis bekerja sebagai tukang bangunan. Setiap hari Jero Ketut Pudak dengan tekun memelihara 9 anak babinya yang baru berumur 1 bulan. Semua modal pakan yang dipergunakan didapat dari Dinari. Modal yang dipinjam sebesar Rp.1.700.000,- modal ini dipergunakan untuk membeli dedak padi , dedak poral dan konsentrat. Setiap hari semua babinya diberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore. Harga pakan saat ini semua naik, modal Rp.1.700.000,- masih kurang oleh sebab itu suami Jero Ketut Pudak rajin bekerja sebagai tukang karena upah tukang perhari Rp.40,000,-. Modal tambahan ini bisa untuk menutupi kekurangan pakan ternaknya. Oleh sebab itu Jero Ketut Pudak sangat berharap pinjaman dari Dinari bisa meningkat. Kondisi kandang Jero Ketut Pudak masih sederhana kandang kayu. Rencananya panen nanti kandangnya akan dibuat kandang permanen itu harapan Jero Ketut Pudak disamping itu juga bisa membiayai 2 anaknya yang masih duduk dibangku sekolah.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedsock and animal feed

Membeli bibit dan pakan babi

loans.name: Nightingale

texts.en: Nightingale is married with two children. Her husband is a very good fisherman, and four times a week Nightingale goes to the local market to sell the strings of fish he catches. She sells as many as six strings per day, and makes 180 Tala (or $72) each week. The more her husband catches, the more she can sell, which is why she has applied for a loan to buy fishing equipment such as spears, goggles and a new canoe. She is very happy with her business and the financial help that she gets from the loan program, because it has meant a big improvement in her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy new fishing gear

loans.name: Nasa

texts.en: Nasa is 35-year-old woman who sells snacks, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, and usually earns about US$ 30 per week. Her husband, J., sells vegetables and usually earns about US$ 50 per day with a small profit. Nasa is requesting a loan to fill her shop with more goods and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Eleuteria Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Eleuteria Isabel is 50 years old. She finished gradeschool. She has two children and one of them still economically depends on her. She lives in the Mache district, Otuzco province, La Libertad state.

She has a meat, chicken and guinea pig purchasing and selling business. She also sells fresh cheese. Finally she sells cereals like barley and wheat during harvesting season and she owns a mill which she uses to grind and sell these cereals as flour.

She purchases all these products from small producers from the different farmhouses and then sells them wholesale in the Julcán province and at the city of Trujillo. She is a partner of the “Women at Work” communal bank. She got her first loan (of S/.300.00 )from this bank, which she used to buy approximately 20 kilograms of fresh cheese to sell in Trujillo. With this next loan, of S/. 1,900.00, which she will repay in four months, she plans to purchase cattle ( a bull and a cow).

Mrs. Eluteria is also partner of the popular neighborhood eatery “Maria Victoria”.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Eleuteria Isabel tiene 50 años de edad, estudió sólo primaria completa, tiene 2 hijos y uno aún depende de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Liberad. Tiene un negocio de compra y venta de reses, gallinas y cuyes, también se dedica a la compra y venta de cuajada. En tiempo de cosecha vende cereales como trigo y cebada y también cuenta con un molino para moler los cereales y vender harina de los mismos. Todos estos productos los compra a pequeños productores de los diferentes caseríos y luego los vende al por mayor en la provincia de Julcán y en la ciudad de Trujillo. Es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo”, en este banco comunal obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 y con este dinero compró aproximadamente 20 kilogramos de cuajada para vender en la ciudad de Trujillo. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,900.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 2 reses (un toro y una vaca). La señora Eleuteria también es socia del comedor popular de su sector, “Maria Victoria”.

loans.use: Purchase cattle ( a cow and a bull)

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo is a young producer of only 26 years of age. It was with the help of his father that he was able to acquire some parcels of land to plant pineapple. This would provide him a fountain of income that would permit him to become independent from his parents and become a small-business person. He has ten years experience working in the production and commercialization of pineapple of the “Monte Lirio” variety. This is a fruit that is characterized as being lush, juicy, and sweet. For a pineapple harvest to be good, one needs herbicides, weed control, complete fertilization, nitrogen fertilization, and leaf fertilization, a process which is expensive but is the most relevant process for the fruit to be well received in markets. In this form, it can generate income that provides constant money for planting and, as such, allow him to live with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Reynaldo es un joven productor de solo 26 años de edad, fue con el apoyo de su padre que pudo adquirir unas manzanas de tierras para plantar piña, con la cual pudiera tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera independizarse de sus padres y realizarse como persona y microempresario. Tiene 10 años de trabajar en la producción y comercialización de piña de variedad “Monte Lirio”, fruta que presenta características particulares tales como frondosa, jugosa y dulce. Para que la cosecha de piña sea buena necesita herbicidas, control en la maleza, fertilización completa, fertilización nitrogenada y fertilización foliar, proceso que conlleva mucho gasto pero es el proceso más relevante para que el fruto pueda ser bien acogido por el mercado y de esta forma le pueda generar ingresos que le permita brindar el mantenimiento constante a los siembros y así pueda permitir vivir dignamente.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and herbicides for the cultivation of pineapple.

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Beata L.. She is married, and has three children, ages 6, 11 and 14. In 2005, Beata established her used clothing business. Beata has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the ocean from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost, and the general appeal of anything Western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen P. and I own a small mud brick house in Mian Channu, a small town in Pakistan. My husband works in a local factory and also trades sheep and goats. I help my husband and take care of the sheep and goats at our house. We need to buy a few more sheep and goats for our business and therefore, I am requesting a loan together with a group of several other women.

Jan B. needs to buy cattle; Alveena S. has a vegetable business; Nasreen N. wants to buy sheep, and Nazira F.’s husband is a day laborer.

loans.use: Buy sheep and goats for their business

loans.name: Zouweratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Zouweratou B. was born on May 14, 1968 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. She sells fruit juice, ice, milk, and ice water. She has been in this business since 1998 in the neighborhood called Agoè Zongo in the northern part of Lomé.

In the year 2000, she used her savings to purchase a freezer so as to better serve her customers. With her earnings from this business, she helps her husband meet family expenses.

She is asking for this loan so that she she can buy a new freezer costing 300.000FCA (about US$ 715) as well as 12 sacks of sugar, milk, and small plastic bags.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame B. Zouweratou est née le 14 mai 1968 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vend du jus de fruits, du glaçon, du lait et de l’eau glacée. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1998 dans le quartier d’Agoè Zongo à l’extrême nord de Lomé.

En l’an 2000 avec l’économie qu’elle a faite, elle a acquis un congélateur pour pouvoir bien servir ses clients. Avec le revenu de son activité, elle aide son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.

Le présent crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir encore un nouveau congélateur d’une valeur de 300.000FCA et d’acheter 12 sacs de sucre, du lait et des sachets.

loans.use:
purchasing a freezer and sugar and milk for re-sale

Achat et vente d'un congelateur, du sucre, et du lait

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib, 37 years old and married with no children, lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a home appliance shop that sells a variety of accessories and paintings. Najib is a very ambitious entrepreneur and this is the third loan he has requested from Majmoua. With the previous two loans, he bought more products to sell in his shop. This time he needs $1,200 in order to open a new spare parts shop and therefore increase his revenues. Najib is the type of person who knows exactly what he wants and how to reach his goals.

loans.use: To open a new spare parts shop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Joyce N.. She is married and has three children with ages between 18 and 25.

In 2005, Joyce established her fish business. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about US $100 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband and children. Joyce requires a loan in order to purchase additional fish. In the future, Joyce plans to to increase the quantity and range of the stock.. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish.

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: De nationalité togolaise, dame S. Estelle est née le 10 Juillet 1967 à Accra au GHANA. Mariée à Monsieur KPOSSI Fiacre et ayant cinq (05) enfants à charge dont deux scolarisés, elle réside au BENIN depuis 2001 à Akpakpa-Dodomey, un bidonville de Cotonou. Ayant acquis déjà deux années d'expérience dans la vente de friperies, elle lave les vêtements de friperie qui constituent ses marchandises, les parfume puis les repasse avant de les exposer pour la vente. Elle est aidé par l'un de ses enfants dans la vente. Dame S. Estelle sollicite son quatrième crédit à ALIDé pour accroître son volume d'activité.
texts.en:
Presently Togolese, Mrs. Estelle S. was born on July 10, 1967 in Accra, Ghana. Married to Mr. Fiacre Kpossi and the mother of 5 children who are all still in her care and enrolled in school, she has been living in Benin since 2001 in Akpakpa-Dodomey, a slum area in Cotonou. Having already acquired two years of experience in the sale of used clothes, she washes the used clothing that constitutes her merchandise, perfumes the clothing, and irons it, then displays it for sale. She is helped in the sale of it by one of her children. Mrs. Estelle S. is requesting her fourth loan from Alidé in order to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
Naima T. A. is 26 years old and married with a one-year-old child. She has been a teacher and clothes seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Naima hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song V., 34, is a good housewife who stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family. Her husband works as a construction worker and makes US$10 each day; he has been doing this work since 1995. This couple has five children and all of them are students. Song would like to take out a loan of US$1200 for her husband to  get the commission to build a road. He will use this money to purchase gas and other construction tools.

loans.use: Song would like to help her husband build a road.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: hola nosotras somos el grupo Fe y Esperanza en nuestro grupo existe una cualidad las cual es que todas somos muy amigas casi hermanas diria yo, y otra cualidad es que somos muy luchadoras, estamos ubicadas en santa cruz de marcovia, cada una de nosotras contamos con nuestro propio negocio, como ser la venta de tortillas, venta de refrescos, venta de ropa y pulperia, nosotras desarrollando nuestras actividades hemos logrado salir adelante con nuestros hogares, hemos logrado brindarles a nuestros hijos educacion, vivienda, alimentacion y otras necesidades que se nos presentan, con estas actividades contribuimos al desarrollo familiar, con esto ayudamos a nuestros esposos para que salgamos adelante juntos. ahora necesitamos el credito para comprar mucha mercaderia ya que en las epocas de navidad las ventas de ropa son muy buenas y tenemos muchos clientes en nuestra comunidad.
texts.en:
Hi, we're the group called Faith and Hope. One of the greatest quality of our group is that we're all friends, almost like sisters. Another great quality about our group is that we are hard workers. We're located in Santa Cruz de Marcovia. We all have our own businesses such as selling tortillas, selling refreshments, selling clothes and managing a small store. By doing this, we have all been able to move ahead by been able to provide an education to our children, having a roof over our heads, food on the table and other neccessities. We are able to contribute to the well-being of our families and we're able to help our husbands so that we can both move ahead in life. We currently need the loan to purchase lots of merchandise since Christmas is fast approaching and this is when we sell the most, especially selling clothes, to our clients in our community.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Lach's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who all live in Chrolong village in Kampong Chhnang Province formed a village bank loan request, and they will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Pao L. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She owns a small lake where she grows lotus, and she also sells it for an income. Her husband, Mr. Pum Pon, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family. Although they have different businesses, they still cannot afford better conditions for the household. Thus, Mrs. Pao L. decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment to build their house. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy equipment to build the house.

loans.name: Hildebrando

texts.es: Hildebrando es padre soltero, vive con sus dos hijos quienes estudian y lo apoyan mucho. Su dedicación constante en el cultivo de yuca, plátano, maíz, arroz y otras variedades, la viene realizando desde hace más de 15 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es tener en buenas condiciones sus productos para luego llevarlos a vender a un buen precio. Le es rentable porque cuenta con clientes quienes están al pendiente de sus productos para comprarlos, por lo que le va muy bien. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más granos para sembrar, además, quiere mandar a cercar una parte de sus parcelas para que estén protegidos sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hildebrando is a single father who lives with his 2 children who are in school and are of great support. For more than 15 years, he has been cultivating cassava, banana, maize, rice and other varieties. What he likes about his work is to have good produce in order to sell them for a good price. His business is profitable because he has customers who are waiting to buy his products, and so it is doing very well. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he has shown himself to be punctual and responsible in his payments. With the loan money, he will purchase more grain to sow as well as fence part of his plots of land so that his crops will be protected.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more seed to sow

loans.name: Amigas Inseparables Group

texts.es:
el grupo Amigas Inseparables esta formado por 3 mujeres las cuales son muy luchadoras y les gusta bastante su trabajo, dichas pequeñas empresas que ellas tienen de produccion de tortillas son las que les han proporcionado el alimento y estudios a sus hijos, ellas estan muy felices de tener una pequeña empresa de la cual pueden sacar ganancias y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
el grupo se forma de la siguiente manera:
Sonia F. es la coordinadora del grupo y ella se dedica a la venta de maiz ya sea por libra o por quintales, esta actividad es muy lucrativa ya que de este producto se fabrican las tortillas que es una comida muy apetecida por nuestra poblacion, con este tipo de alimento se acompañan los tres tiempos de comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena).
La Sra. Vera H.: ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, gracias a su negocio ella ha podido salir adelante.
Mayra L.: tambien ella se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, y tambien recibe ayuda de su esposo para sustentar su hogar.
