todas ellas necesitan un credito para salir adelante con sus negocios ya que la situacion que esta pasando el pais es muy critica y necesitan poder reforzar sus negocios comprando mas materiales de produccion.
texts.en:
The group Amigas Inseparables ("Inseparable Friends) is formed by 3 hard working women that love their work very much. The small enterprises that they have which are dedicated to produce tortillas are the ones that provide them with the food and education for their children. They are very happy to have their small businesses which allow them an income to live and improve the quality of their lives. The group is formed by: Sonia F. who is the coordinator. She is dedicated to sell corn by the pound or by 100 pounds (quintal). This activity is very lucrative since from this product tortillas are made. This is a staple food in our diet and is very important for our people because with it, we accompany our three daily meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner). Mrs. Vera H. is the one that is the dedicated to making and selling tortillas. Thanks to her business, she has been able to move ahead. Mayra L.: she also is dedicated to make and sell tortillas and also gets help from her husband to provide her home. All of them need a loan to move ahead with their businesses since the situation that their country is going through is critical and they need to boost their businesses by buying more materials for production.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and materials to make tortillas

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: JOSE, CON 38 AÑOS DE EDAD, REALIZA CONSTRUCCIONES DE OBRAS CIVILES, ES INDEPENDIENTE Y TRABAJA CON PERSONAS PARTICULARES. TIENE 5 CINCO HIJOS DE LOS CUALES 4 ESTUDIAN EN COLEGIO DE CONVENIO Y SU ESPOSA EN OCASIONES VENDE MASITAS Y SALADITOS EN EL COLEGIO DE SUS HIJOS. EL TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 10 AÑOS EN SU TRABAJO, POR LO QUE CONOCE MUY BIEN SU ACTIVIDAD. SI BIEN NO TIENE ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES, SABE A CABALIDAD INTERPRETAR PLANOS DE CONSTRUCCION. EN NUESTRO MEDIO EXITEN MUCHAS PERSONAS QUE SE DEDICAN A ESTE TIPO DE TRABAJO, PERO ÉL TIENE PERSONAS CONOCIDAS QUE SIEMPRE LO CONTRATAN PARA DIFENRETES TIPOS DE TRABAJO DE CONSTRUCCION. DE ACUERDO A LA DIMENSION A CONSTRUIR Y SI ES CON OBRA FINA INCLUIDA DIFIERE EL PRECIO DE LA REALIZACION DE UNA VIVIENDA. ACTUALMENTE ESTA TRABAJANDO EN EL CAMPO REALIZANDO UNA CHURRASQUERA EN LA PROVINCIA DE SAN JAVIER. TIENE BUENAS REFERENCIAS DE CREDITO YA QUE SOLO TRABAJA CON AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
Jose, age 38, works independently in civil construction and works with private employers. He has 5 children, 4 of whom attend a school sponsored jointly by the church and the government, and his wife sometimes sells snacks at the children’s school. Jose has 10 years of experience in his line of work so he is very familiar with his field. Even though he did not complete higher education, he is very experienced in reading construction plans. In our area there are many people who work in this field, but Jose has many business contacts who always hire him for different construction jobs. The cost of building a house differs based on the size and whether detailed finishing is included in the job. Right now Jose is working in the countryside building a barbeque restaurant in the province of San Javier. He has good credit history since he only works with the Agrocapital organization.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cement mixer

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina es socia del Banco Comunal Brisas.
Clementina es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Clementina tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donde vende comida, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo.
Clementina necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite.
Los sueños de Clementina son que su hija obtenga su titulo, tener un local mas amplio.
texts.en:
Clementina belongs to the "Brisas" community bank. Clementina is married; she is 47 years old and has three children. Clementina has a stall in the Grau market where she sells food daily with her husband's help. Clementina needs a loan of 1,800 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil. Clementina's dreams are that her daughter obtain her degree and to have a larger locale.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, noodles and oil

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert H. has been a car dealer and taxi driver in Idan, near Cape Coast, since 2001. He is married with four children and has received a junior high school education. His wife is employed as a trader.

He is responsible for paying utility bills and feeding and clothing his children. His loan will be used to do some maintenance work on the taxi. Robert hopes to use the new profits from his business to buy land and support the his children’s education.

loans.use: Make repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is married and has 6 dependant children. For 4 years she has worked as a trader, cooking rice and stew that she sells at Siwdo. Her husband is employed as a soldier. Abena uses her income to help pay the family’s bills.

Abena will use this loan to purchase rice in larger bags, along with other ingredients, which she will cook and sell to her customers, who don't eat before leaving their homes. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase rice in larger bags, and other ingredients

loans.name: Oscar Alfredo

texts.es: Oscar Alfredo A. vive en Rosario de la paz, departamento La Paz junto a su esposa y su hijo de 2 años de edad, Oscar es empleado en una fábrica, pero también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, que le ayuda en los gastos familiares ya que ella también trabaja. Oscar y su esposa solicitan un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, con la construcción de un muro, que le dará seguridad a la casa de cualquier acto de vandalismo y también desean asegurar la parte de la zona de lavar instalando techo, porque hasta el momento esta zona se encuentra a la intemperie sin seguridad alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar Alfredo A. lives in Rosario de la Paz, La Paz state, with his wife and son who is 2 years old. Oscar works at a factory and he says that his wife also helps with the household bills by working as well. Oscar and his wife would like a loan in order to improve their housing with the construction of a wall that will provide them protection from vandalism and to install a roof because right now they do not have one.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall and a roof over their bathroom

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar K. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. According to her, some of her children are in the junior high school while others are in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase, a farming and trading community near the district capital of Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo region.

Hagar's husband is a professional carpenter and she is a trader. She trades in second-hand women's clothing. Hagar sells by hawking locally and also treks to other towns to sell. She procures bales of textiles from Dormaa. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure more textiles in bulk. She is hopeful that she can expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Douda

texts.fr: Daouda N. âgé de trente (30) ans s’active dans le secteur de l’embouche bovine depuis plus de trois ans dans son village de sandiara situé  quatre vingt kilomètre de Dakar dans la capitale sénégalaise. Cette activité il fait en même temps que son travail d’éducateur au niveau du village. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille et d’aider ses parents avec qui il vit. Le prêt sollicité lui permet d’acheter un bœuf qu’il embouchera
texts.en:
Douda N., 30, has been working in the agricultural sector fattening cattle for more than 3 years in his village of Sandiara, situated 20 km from Dakar, the Senegalese capital. He does this work at the same time as teaching in the village school. The income from this business permits him to support his family and help his parents whom he lives with. The requested loan will allow him to buy a steer that he will fatten.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a steer to fatten

loans.name: Digna Emerita

texts.es:
la sra. Digna Emerita H. tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva, este tipo de actividad lo realiza de forma domiciliar y ambulante en diferentes comunidades y caserios aledaños de Santa Maria, ella es casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales todos dependen del matrimonio, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.-  con los ingresos que le genera la venta de ropa
ella cubre sus gastos personales y tambien le colabora a su esposo a cubrir algunos gastos familiares. la meta de ella es poder ver graduados a sus hijos de la universidad y que sean hombres de bien.
texts.en:
For four years Ms Digna has sold new clothes. She sells the clothes from her home and also in other towns and neighboring hamlets near Santa Maria. She is married and has five children who are dependent upon her and her husband. Her husband works in agriculture and ranching. With the profits from her business, Ms Digna pays for her personal expenses and also helps her husband pay for the family’s expenses. Her goals are to be able to see her children graduate from University and to become good people.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for women and children

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto R. Martínez tiene la edad de 45 años, Está casado. Lamentablemente no tiene hijos con su pareja, pues ella es estéril. Luis se dedica a una librería. Dio inicio hace 4 años, ya que no tenía los suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia, el es un buen hombre, que junto a su esposa luchan para salir adelante a pesar de las duras dificultades que han atravesado juntos. Es crédito que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, engrapadoras y artículos de oficina. Su mayor deseo es poder tener una hija que llene de alegría su hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto R. Martínez is 45 years old and married. Unfortunately, his wife was not able to have children. Luis operates a bookstore, which he started 4 years ago because he was not earning enough money to support his family. He is a good man, and together with his wife, they have endured many difficulties in order to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, pencils, erasers, staplers and other office supplies. He hopes to have a home full of joy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Adjété Kokouvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur pour subvenir à ses propres besoins  a entamé le commerce des huiles à moteur, il fait ce commerce depuis 2005. Faisant face actuellement à une baisse de son stock d’huile il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidons de 25 litres d’huile à moteur.
texts.en:
To support himself, this gentleman started off in the commerce of motor oil. He has been in this business since 2005. Currently facing a drop in his inventory, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten 25-liter drums of motor oil.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten drums of motor oil

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal Y. is single and has four children. She has completed senior high school. Racheal sells books and stationary items at Nyanta near Elmina, which she has been doing since 2007.  Racheal uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She requests a loan to buy more stationary to sell in her shop, and plans to reinvest the additional profits back into her business.

loans.use: Racheal will use the loan to buy more stationary to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan E. is from the village of Mansabandy Alto. She is 35 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. Joan earns most of her living by planting a harvesting rice for sale. She has just started in this business.

In 2008, Joan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation anher ability to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers for her crops. Joan is requesting a new loan of $225 which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand rice-growing business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Urubamba.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Vilma viaja a las ferias D. L. región D. donD. compra animales, carnes, productos que venD. D. casa en casa en Ayacucho, además los fines D. semana venD. comida típica. Vilma es artesana y realiza tejidos en telar que venD. en L. ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Vilma necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cerdo.
Los sueños D. Vilma son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio se amplié.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Urubamba Communal Bank. She lives with her partner and one son. She is 30 years old. Vilma travels to the markets in her region where she buys animals, meats and other products that she sells from house to house in Ayacucho. In addition, on the weekends she sells regional food. Vilma is an artisan and makes weavings on a loom that she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Vilma needs a loan of 1200 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of hogs. Vilma's dreams are than her children become professionals and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of hogs

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida es una socia activa y  colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 59 años y es madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es carpintero. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Solidarias” desde hace ocho años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en colonias para vender, en la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 2500 que le permitirá comprar productos de belleza. La meta de Ida es comprar una vitrina grande para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Ida is an active member and contributor of her Communal Bank group. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in the Ucayali region. Ida is 59 years old and the mother of 4 adult children. She sells beauty products by catalog and has the support of her husband, who works as a carpenter.

For the past 8 years, Ida has been part of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women). The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to purchase colognes for resale. She currently needs a loan of 2500 soles to buy more beauty products. One of her goals is to purchase a large display case for exhibiting her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: La Fuerza De Cristo 5&6 Group

texts.en:
Azulia is a 53-year-old borrower who lives near La Romana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for the group La Fuerza de Cristo (The Strength of Christ), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in her group. 

The area surrounding La Romana is dominated by the vast sugar fields of the Dominican Republic. Electricity is scarce and there is no access to potable water. Despite the difficulties of living in this area, Azulia successfully runs a small business selling clothing and some other items. With this loan, Azulia will purchase new and used clothing, as well as bed sheets and sandals, to sell to her community.

This is Azulia’s third loan with Esperanza International, and with a perfect repayment record so far, she hopes it will not be her last. She came to Esperanza because the interest was lower than what she was able to find elsewhere, with no collateral. With the profits her loan brings, Azulia hopes to finish building her home. She also hopes to purchase a small van so that she will have transportation for both her business and her family. Thank you for lending to Azulia and the La Fuerza de Cristo group!

loans.use: Used & new clothing, sheets, & slippers.

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Mahamadou C. a 51 ans, 3 enfants ; marié, il vit  dans une famille monogame  à Dangassa un des villages (située à 70  kilomètres de Bamako) relevant de la deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali.
En vu de faire prospérer son commerce, il  intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel, il est  à son troisième prêt individuel, tous les deux prêts précédents  ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce  nouveau prêt, il compte acheter,  une tonne de maïs,  450  kilogrammes  d’arachide et 55 moules de beurre de karité qu’il vend  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Dangassa où il s’approvisionne  également une fois par mois auprès des producteurs et grossistes.
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen trimestriel de 250. 000 FCFA qui servira à payer l’échéance du prêt et investir  le reste dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Mahamadou C. is 51 years old and has 3 children. He is married and lives in a monogamous family in Dangassa, one of the towns (located 70 kilometers from Bamako), within the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. In order to enable his business to prosper, he joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program with which, he is on his third individual loan. He has fully repaid his two previous loans. With this new loan, he intends to purchase one ton of corn, 450 kilograms of peanuts and 55 molds of shea butter, which he sells at retail prices, for cash and credit, in the market of Dangassa. He supplies himself once a month from producers and wholesalers. With this loan he hopes to earn an average quarterly income of 250,000 FCFA, which he will use to pay back his loan and he will re-invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains and shea butter

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 26 years old and married. He has a three year-old daughter named Sasha. He has a video library that includes a selection of DVDs, films, and tapes. He's been in this business for two years and has one employee. He also runs a boutique and was previously employed by Regal Pharmaceuticals. 

Stephen repaid a loan of Kes. 25,000 from Faulu. He is now requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy a computer, renovate his shop, and add some accessories to sell. 

He describes himself as a hard-working, responsible, and social businessman, who is determined to make ends meet in life. Since Faulu's training, he says that he has adopted a culture of savings and become empowered economically. In the future, he hopes to establish himself as a businessman and own his own home.

loans.use: To buy a computer and add to his inventory

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun K. is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Now she faces some problems with her plantation. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers and pesticides. She will use the rest of her loan to buy piglets and pig feed for breeding.

Mrs. Aun K. is a villager in Phnouv village in Takeo province. She is 38 years old and the mother of six children: one is employed in a garment factory, while three others are attending the local school, and the rest stay at home because they are too young. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Troeun, is a palm juice collector.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers, pesticides, piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is forty-eight years of age. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist-attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana and as a result, the major occupation of the people is fishing.

Juliana is a trader and runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She procures her goods from Accra. Juliana has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is sixty years old. She is married and has six children. Two of her children are currently in school. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a primarily commercial community.

Philomena works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in all kinds of footwear. Philomena hawks and treks to nearby towns to sell. She procures the goods from Accra. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to procure shoes and slippers in bulk.

loans.use: To buy footwear to sell

loans.name: God's Favor Children Group

texts.en: Joseph S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Favor Children. He is 35 years old and married with three children, aged 3 to 12 years old. His children's educational levels range from kindergarten to first grade. Joseph himself is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to poverty. Joseph and his family live in the Go-Buy-Chop Community and he works at the Red Light Market, Liberia's largest market on the outskirts of the capital, Monrovia. Joseph’s business is the sale of cosmetics. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table at the Red Light Market. He has been running this business for more than 20 years and hopes to become an importer of cosmetics in the near future. Joseph started by selling for a Nigerian lady. Whenever he sold her goods, she would always share the profits. After saving money, he decided to start his own business. He sells at an ideal location in order to attract customers to buy from him. Joseph plans to use this loan to purchase more body cream, powder, soap, etc., for resale. He dreams of educating his children and his wife, and hopes for a good future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Joseph is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP, a Kiva partner, seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream, powder, soap, etc., for resale

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario M. D. U. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en Santo Tomás, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante, y junto a sus dos hijas D. 13 y 7 años D. edad. Ella posee un puesto D. comida, el cual esta ubicado en el mercado Central D. San Salvador, uno D. los mercados más grandes D. la capital salvadoreña. María se encarga D. elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, contando con mucha clientela quien llega todos los días a degustar D. los deliciosos platillos D. María, los cuales tras 13 años D. experiencia le han permitido ir mejorando y obteniendo más clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. granos básicos, verduras, bebidas y otros elementos más para la elaboración D. la comida. María y su familia dependen en gran manera D. este negocio, ya que las ganancias D. su esposo no dan a bastos con todos los gastos del hogar, es por esto que María desea seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
María del Rosario M. D. U. is 39 years old and lives in Santo Tomás which is located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a storekeeper, and their two children ages 13 and 7. She owns a food stall which is located in the Central San Salvador market, one of the largest markets in the Salvadorian capitol. María makes breakfasts and lunches, and has many customers who come every day to sample her delicious meals. She has 13 years of experience making them, which has allowed her to improve and get more customers. She is requesting a loan in order to get the necessary money to buy a large quantity of staple grains, vegetables, drinks and other ingredients for making food. María and her family greatly depend on this business because her husband's earnings aren't enough to cover their daily expenses. It is for this reason that María wants to continue developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, vegetables and drinks

location.town: Santo Tomás, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Tusuubira Mobilizers Group 1, Kampala

texts.en: K. Hamida is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is the lady at the top left and in the front of the group photo. She is a widow with nine children. One of her children is still in school and is joining the University soon. She also takes care of three dependants. Hamida has had a retail business for two years where she sells home supplies and paraffin from Nakwero B, Gayaza town council. She is able to make 35,000/=  weekly profit. Her desire is to have a variety of goods for sale, hence the expansion of her shop. She is very hard working and as a result, she has been able to offer the best gift to her children and that is education. Hamida needs a loan to be able to buy more paraffin and other general merchandise for resale.

loans.use: To buy more general merchandise and paraffin for her business.

loans.name: Mineros San Juan Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Mineros San Juan  es uno D. los grupos màs antiguos D. nuestra agencia ya que se encuentra en su 8º ciclo. Esta compuesta por señoras D. una misma zona y las que componen la mesa directiva  son las siguientes personas: 

La Sra. Carmen quien es la Presidenta y le identifican como su lider ya que ella es una persona responsable, dinamica y trabajadora; ella tiene 5 hijos y tiene el negocio D. Venta D. cosmeticos ambulando casa por casa el dinero del credito lo invertira en la compra D. cosmeticos que se encuentran en promosion, para despues poder venderlos al precio original y asi poder tener un poco mas D. ganancia; 

Como secretaria esta la Sra. Celia   tiene 4  hijos es casada y tiene el negocio D. venta D. dulces, galletas y chocolates en una D. las calles centricas D. la ciudad y con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Como Tesorera esta la señorita Marìa quien es soltera  y no  tiene hijos y su negocio es la atencion D. un local D. venta D. comida en su zona Mineros San Juan ; todas sacaron el prestamo para aumentar su capital y hacer crecer su negocio.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y dinamicas, estan agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Mineros San Juan” (St. John Miners) communal bank is one of the oldest in our agency; it’s in its 8th loan cycle and composed of women from the same neighborhood. The governing board is maD. up thus: Carmen is group president and identified as their leader because she’s a responsible, hard-working and dynamic person; she has 5 children and sells cosmetics door-to-door. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics that are on sale to later resell at full price thereby earning a bit higher profit. Celia is secretary; she’s married and has 4 children. She sells candy, cookies and chocolates in on of the city’s main streets. She will use the funds to buy merchandise at wholesale thereby increasing her working capital. María is group treasurer; she’s single and has no children. She has a food stand in the Mineros San Juan area. All the members sought the loan to increase their capital to help their businesses grow. They are all responsible, dynamic people who are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital increase.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Y. Marcelline est née le 05 octobre 1960 dans la commune de sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Cela fait déjà 15 ans que Marcelline vit à Sainte-Rita, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBEGBO Athanase, Marcelline est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Marcelline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Pour participer aux dépenses de la famille, Marcelline vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. C’est à l’intérieur du Bénin que Marcelline effectue ses achats. Marcelline n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce son activité depuis un moment. C’est la première fois que Marcelline sollicite un crédit chez ALIDé. Ce crédit permettra à Marcelline de diversifier ses activités.
texts.en:
Y. Marcelline was born in November 5, 1960 in the town Sèmè-Podji, Benin.  She has been living in Sainte-Rita, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for fifteen years.  Married to GBEGBO Athanase, she is the mother of five children, who have all attended school.  She lives with her husband and children.  Together, the couple share in covering family expenses.  To take part in meeting family expenses, Marcelline sells charcoal out of her home.  She makes her purchases in Benin's interior.  She did not attend school but has been operating her business for a while now.  This is the first time she is requesting a loan from ALIDé.  This loan will enable her to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida B. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Zenaida is married and has 9 adult children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a tailoring business, providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Zenaida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. This will be the second loan taken out by Zenaida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Lassissi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un homme marié et est père d’un enfant, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè zongo qui est un quartier périphérique et très animé de la ville de Lomé. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle s’est lancée en 2008 dans le commerce des articles de quincaillerie, il a ouvert à cet effet sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé « Ets SALBAK & fils ». Le stock de marchandises dont il dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de subvenir aux charges de sa famille raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 boîtes de faume, 4 cartons d’ampoules et de réglettes, 20 paquets de pointes d’acier, 10 boîtes de col à bois, 10 boîtes de peintures  et divers.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married and the father of one child. He lives with his family in the Agoè Zongo neighborhood, one of the very busy outlying areas surrounding the city of Lomé. To meet his family's needs, he began selling hardware in 2008. He opened his own shop which he calls « Ets SALBAK & fils » (Salbak and Son Enterprises). With his current stock of merchandise, he is unable pay his family's expenses. For this reason, he is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy ten boxes of « faume », four cartons of bulbs and lighting strips, twenty packets of steel nails, ten boxes of wood glue, ten boxes of paint, and other items.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is married to a business lady and they have three children.

Stephen is a 26-year-old manufacturer. He manufactures slabs and ventilation windows and sells them to people who are building, to hardware stores and to contractors. He also does welding to earn extra income. He has been in this business for the last six years.

Stephen has requested a loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase a machine for producing slabs. He hopes to increase his slab production and own a wholesale shop for selling slabs and ventilation windows. He describes himself as focused.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for producing slabs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the patio in front of his house

loans.name: Bairon Angel

texts.es:
Don Bairon es un hombre trabajador, padre de familia de tres hijos, casado, 
Trabaja en seguridad interna en una empresa privada, desde hace varios años, sus hijos aun estudian, y aunque su salario es  poco es un trabajo fijo.
Poco a poco ha logrado mejorar su casa, tiene materiales de construcción como: arena, Pero no ha seguido la obra por falta de efectivo, lo que con este préstamo lograra comenzar el porche, y poner el piso ya que aun es de tierra, lo que mejora la higiene, como una mejor comodidad de espacio. Para esto comprara: bloque, cemento, piso.

Contento por que a través de este financiamiento se la hecho posible mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. Bairon is a hardworking man and the father of three children. He has worked for a private security firm for several years. His children are still at school, and although his salary is small, his job is a permanent one. Over time he is managing to make improvements to his house; he already has some construction materials like sand. However, he has never been able to afford to do the work. Bairon plans to use the loan money to begin the porch and put in a floor which at the moment is made of earth. This will help keep everywhere clean and provide a more comfortable space. To do this work he will buy cement, blocks, and flooring. Bairon is happy as this loan will make it possible to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, and flooring

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon Y. is 51 years old and is a villager who lives in Spueu village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice on. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Khon Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to her old one and to buy fertilizer to use for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Hean, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family and he also helps his wife on the farm. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy an ox and fertilizer

loans.name: Cresbee

texts.en:
Cresbee P. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is 23 years old, married and has two infant-aged children.  To make a living, Cresbee owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Cresbee has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cresbee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresbee is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be her first from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

-----------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Jesús C. C. es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo desde muy joven él se dedico trabajar de agricultor, albañil, mecánico, carpintero y por ultimo moto taxista y poco a poco empezó a ganarse el pan de cada día.

Actualmente el trabaja en el sindicato de moto taxis “2 de Agosto” es socio activo y muy responsable en la labor que desempeña, es padre de familia tiene dos hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, el se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas para brindar sus servicios y así poder llevar el sustento a su familia porque es el único ingreso con que cuenta actualmente.

El señor Jesús C. C. se apersono a CIDRE por el comentario de sus compañeros del sindicato estando en la posibilidad de solicitar un prestamo para la compra de un vehículo (motocicleta), para así poder tener un poco mas de ingreso y darles una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Jesús C. C. is very dedicated to his work. From a very young age he’s been a farmer, bricklayer, carpenter and finally a taxi driver. Little by little he began to earn his daily keep. He’s currently associated with the “2 de Agosto” mototaxi (three-wheel vehicles used to transport passengers and cargo) union. He is an active member who is very responsible with the work he undertakes. He is father to two children whose education he supports. He rises very early in the morning to provide services in order to earn daily income to support his family because this is his only current source of income. Mr. Jesús C. C. came in person to CICRE’s offices thanks to comment his fellow union members made concerning the possibility of asking for a loan to buy a vehicle (motorcycle) in order thus to have a bit more income and provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es: Concepción del Carmen R. D. G. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Delgado, el cual se encuentra en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante. Concepción es una persona muy conocida y quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos no solo por ser una persona responsable, sino también por ser alguien muy amable y que atienD. D. la mejor forma a sus clientes. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, así mismo trabaja elaborando y vendiendo pupusas, las cuales comercializa con sus amigos y vecinos y personas D. los alrededores. Concepción solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su tienda y D. esta forma ofrecer todos los productos que son necesario en el hogar, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, queso, frijoles y chicharrón, con el fin D. elaborar más pupusas y D. esta forma atender a más personas. Lo que más desea Concepción, es el poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y aprovechar la oportunidad que la vida le ha brindando D. poder ganarse la vida D. una forma segura.
texts.en:
Concepción del Carmen R. D. G. is 55 years old. She lives in Ciudad Delgado which is in the San Salvador department. She lives there with her husband who is a merchant. Concepción is a very well known person who has good references from her neighbors not only because she is a responsible person, but because she is also a kind person who serves her clients in the best way. She has a perishable goods store located at her house. She also makes and sells pupusas to her friends, neighbors and people from nearby. Concepción is asking for a loan with which she will have enough money to diversify her store and in this way offer all products needed for the home. She also wants to be able to buy greater quantities of corn, cheese, beans and pork rinds in able to make more pupusas and serve more people. What Concepción wants the most is to be able to improve her financial stability and take advantage of the opportunity that life has giver her to be able to earn her living in a stable way.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable products to diversify her business

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando S.'s main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in his community. He is a 30-year-old married man from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan. Orlando has been in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Orlando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Orlando has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Orlando is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his second loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ses

texts.en:
Mrs. Ses R. is a villager in Angk Ta Phouk village in Takeo province. She is a door-to-door wedding beautician who earns income to support her family. She is also a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Vuthy Hong, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is also a photographer. She is the mother of three children who are all attending school.

Mrs. Ses R.'s problem is that she does not have a car to transport her wedding beauty supplies. To solve this problem, she is applying for a loan to have enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah K. lives in Kitawuluzi, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has eight children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). Hadjah has a business selling jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products from home, as a wholesale operation. Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through selling piped water.

Hadjah's main business challenges include transportation and thieves. Her goals for her business are to own permanent business premises and to educate her children to the university level. Hadjah lives in a house that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin and crates of beer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 31-year-old lady, married with one child. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda in a rented house. She has a retail shop business which has been in existence for two years now.  Elizabeth also sells air time in her business and says she would like to become an agent for one of the telecommunications companies around her. This is Elizabeth’s first loan from HOFOKAM and she intends to purchase air time to sell in her shop.

loans.use: Purchasing air time to sell in her shop

loans.name: Myrliza

texts.en:
Myrliza P. is from the village of Barangay Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Myrliza is married. To make a living, Myrliza owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Myrliza has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Myrliza is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Myrliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: Richard, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su madre, y trabaja para brindarle una buena calidad de vida a ella y a sus hijos menores que no viven con él ya que es separado. Cada día es de constante esfuerzo y dedicación para Richard, pues empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano. Él brinda el servicio de taxi en su auto que es propio, además manifiesta con mucho orgullo que le agrada mucho su labor pues ya tiene pasajeros fijos que lo llaman cuando requieren de sus servicios. El tiempo le ha permitido conocer que pasajeros debe movilizar o cuales son los horarios adecuados para obtener mayores ganancias, pero lo que le disgusta  es que muchas veces debe trabajar durante varias horas en busca de pasajeros. Y como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para el futuro ya  tiene planeado instalar un negocio de venta de repuestos para autos y de esta manera desea continuar progresando. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar con su trabajo sin problemas. Richard tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en mandar su auto al taller para que le brinden mantenimiento, además quiere empezar a juntar para su futuro negocio.
texts.en: Richard is 42-years-old and lives in his own house alongside his mother and works to give her a better quality of life and also for his younger children who don’t live with him as he is separated from their mother.  Each day requires constant effort and dedication from Richard.  He begins work very early.  He offers taxi service in his own car and also proudly tells us that he likes his work a lot and now has regular passengers that call him when they require his services.  With time he has gotten to know when passengers need to go somewhere and what is the best schedule to obtain the best profits, but what he does not like is that often he has to work for several hours looking for passengers.  As he is an enterprising man, he plans to open a business selling car parts in the future and in this way he would like to continue moving forward.  This is his third loan with MFP and he promises to make his payments punctually as he does not want to look bad to the people who have made this contribution possible so that he can continue working without problems.  Richard plans to invest the loan he is requesting in sending his car to a workshop so that they can do maintenance on it.  He also would like to begin to save for his future business.

loans.use: For technical maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child, who is currently in school.  Justine has a business of a grocery, which she has had for 4 years.         

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more stock.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Justine hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy stock for grocery store

loans.name: Lona

texts.en: Lona A. is currently in the business of selling wax and saddles.  She is requesting a loan to stock more wax from Congo to sell.  Lona is 31 years old and is married.  Her husband is a mechanical engineer. She has 5 children – 3 are going to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more wax to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Ladrilleros de Compañia, tiene 61 años, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos. Elena se dedica a la siembra y venta de verduras. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de remedios, abono y pago de peón. Aprendió de ésta actividad desde muy niña con sus abuelitos, ahora lo desarrolla con sus hijos, Elena vende sus verduras en el mercado mayorista Nery García.
Le gusta las reunionres de su Banco Comunal, porque le facilitan dinero para trabajar y puede ahorrar, le gusta la  capacitaciones porque aprende nuevas cosas. Su sueño es poder construir su casa para sus hijos y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en: Elena is a member of the Ladrilleros de Compañia [Bricklayers of Compañia] Community Bank. She is 61 and a single mother of 3 children. She sows and sells vegetables. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of medicines, fertilizers, and in paying her workers. She learned this work at a young age from her grandparents, and is now teaching her children. Elena sells her vegetables in the Nery Garcia wholesale market. She enjoys the meetings in her Community Bank, because they provide money for her work and she is able to save. She enjoys the training because she learns new things. Her dream is to be able to build her own home for her children, and for her business to grow.

loans.use: the purchase of medications and fertilizer

loans.name: Yaira Yulieth

texts.es:
la sra. Yaira Yulieth P. tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de tortillas todos los dias y los días miércoles y sábados se dedica a la venta de nacatamales los que distribuye de manera ambulante, siendo las rutas de mayor rentabilidad las zonas cafetaleras.
Doña Yaira a sabido ganarse la clientela ya que sus tortillas son grandes y sus tamales tienen buen sabor, este tipo de negocio es muy rentable para ella, ya que en donde reside es una aldea con bastante población.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y los nacatamales.

Se observo que sus condiciones de vida son favorables y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura
texts.en:
Yaira Yulieth P. has been making and selling tortillas for two years. She works every day and on Wednesdays and Saturdays she sells nacatamales (a Honduran tamal) which she sells as a street vendor. The most profitable routes are the the areas where the coffee plantations are located. 

Yaira has learned how to gain customers since her tortillas are big and her tamales have a lot of flavor. This type of business is very profitable for her since she lives in a neighborhood with a large population. 

She will use this loan to purchase materials to make tortillas and nacatamales. 

It was observed that her living conditions are favorable and her husband raises livestock and farms.

loans.use: Purchase corn, wood, water, chicken, pork, vegetables and banana leaves.

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en: Jorenda S.'s main source of income comes from providing motorela services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She is 52 years old, married and has seven grown-up children. She is from the village of Kibaning, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. Jorenda has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jorenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Jorenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for maintenance of the service. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed for maintenance

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For over twenty years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling at retail prices, with local neighbors as her potential customers. Veronica faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She hopes to shift the business to a market place where she can get a number of customers to purchase her products. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase a bundle of lesos, or Kikois, (traditional woven cotton cloth worn as a wrap, sarong, scarf or pareo) and school uniform materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of leso’s (Kikoi’s) and school uniform materials.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, tiene 23 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la comunidad de Tambo Real distrito de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La socia Norma es mujer que busca el bienestar de su familia y aprovecha de las pocas oportunidades que se le presentan en la vida,  ella se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella produce queso y vende leche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su labor. Norma en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería y para comprar un animal. 

Norma pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma
texts.en:
Norma is 23 years old and has four children.  She lives in the Tambo Real community in the Anta District, department of Cusco.  Norma is a woman who seeks a comfortable lifestyle for her family, taking advantage of the few opportunities coming her way.  She is a livestock farmer and makes and sells cheese and milk.  She has been involved in this activity for several years and has made it successful thanks to her hard work.  Norma is in need of a loan to buy merchandise and livestock.

She is a member of the "San Bartolomé de Tambo Real" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and livestock

loans.name: Ufalme Group

texts.fr: Mbambu S.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Ufalme, âgée de 43 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants parmi les quels, deux ont leurs propres foyers et sept vont à l’école.  Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat dans le service public. La  cliente  Mbambu S. est vendeuse des boissons locales communément appelées jus  Madrakwa. Il ya plusieurs années qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Elle vient de faire 8 cycles en bénéficiant régulièrement  le crédit de l’IMF  Hekima, pour  renforcer  son capital. La famille de la cliente Mbambu S. vit de cette activité d’autant plus que les fonctionnaires de L’Etat congolais ne sont pas régulièrement payés et quand ils sont payés, ils reçoivent de rémunération très médiocre qui ne leurs permet pas de couvrir l’ensemble de tout le mois ni de faire une épargne. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux intra (matières premières) pour la fabrication de ce jus mandrakwa (5 sacs maïs, 50 kg millet, 50 kg farine, 50 kg sorgho, bois de chauffage, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et scolariser dignement ses enfants. La cliente Mbambu S.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Ufalme est constitué de 20 membres majoritairement femmes. Cependant, l’une des clientes porte un bébé au dos.
texts.en: Mbambu S. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Ufalme work group. She is 43 yeas old, married, and the mother of 9 children, two of whom already live separately and seven are still in school. Her husband is a governmental employee in public service. Mbambu S. sells traditional local drink called “madrakwa juice.” She has been in this business for several years. She just completed eight loan cycles with IMF Hekima, with the goal of bolstering her business capital. Mbambu S.’s family depends on her business, especially since public employees in Congo are not paid regularly, and when they do receive their salaries, the pay level is so low that it does not last the family for the entire month, nor does it allow for savings. This new loan will help Mbambu S. to stock up with the new ingredients (raw matters) in order to prepare “mandrakwa” (five bags of corn, 50 kg of millet, 50 kg of flour, 50 kg of sorghum, heating wood etc). In addition, her goal is to  ensure the continuation of her business and to provide for proper education for her children. As a client of IMF, Mbambu S. is grateful to IMF Hekima for its actions in support of impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banking. The Ufalme group is composed of 20 members, mainly women. One of the group members [in the photo] is carrying a child on her back.

loans.use: to purchase  bags of corn, 50 kg of millet, 50 kg of flour, 50 kg of sorghum, heating wood etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 32 años, convive con José desde hace 10 años. En todo este tiempo tuvieron 2 hijos: José y Maryori, a los que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chincana – San Ramón (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que dedica está abnegado mujer es la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de plátanos y cítricos, los cuales fertiliza, limpia y cuida junto a su esposo quien le apoya incondicionalmente. Pues en cada cosecha comercializa los frutos a los vendedores minoristas del mercado central de la capital; donde además de vender sus propios sembríos también comercializan los frutos que acopian de los demás agricultores. Asimismo en la temporada de cosecha de café, que se realiza una vez al año, María compra el grano maduro a los diferentes agricultores, a quienes le paga un promedio de S/. 8 soles por cada kilo, vendiendo ella a una reconocida empresa procesadora de café a un precio mayor, obteniendo así una ganancia extra. Pues su principal preocupación son los gastos que realiza en el estudio de su hijo mayor. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres de éxito”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que depositan nuevamente los integrantes de su asociación. María, se está preparando para la campaña de café, donde la mayoría de los cafetaleros cosecharán los granos maduros, que ella comprará con el dinero que solicita y de esa manera acopiará para su venta.
texts.en:
María, 32, has been living with José for the last 10 years; they have two children: José and Mayori who they care for with much love in their own home located in Chincana-San Ramón (Peruvian central jungle).  The work which this selfless woman does is farming.  Her main crops are bananas and citrus fruit that she fertilizes, weeds and cares for with her husband who helps her unconditionally.  

Each harvested crop is sold to retailers in the capital’s central market where, besides selling her own crops, crops amassed from other farmers are also sold.  Similarly, during coffee harvest time, which takes place once a year, María buys ripe coffee beans from various farmers and pays 8 soles per kilo, on average.  She then resells to a renowned coffee processing plant at a higher price thus obtaining an additional profit because her main concern is the cost associated with her eldest son’s education.

She is a member of the “Mujeres de Éxito” (Women to Success) communal bank and this is her second loan with MFP where she is grateful for the trust her fellow group members once again place in her.  

María is preparing for the new coffee harvest season when most of the coffee farmers will harvest ripe beans that she’ll buy with the money requested thus supplying herself for her sales.

loans.use: to buy coffee.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda: es casada y tiene 40 años la socia tiene 3 hijos de 13, 9, 8 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el comercio minorista, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivo en los cuales produce maíz, la socia luego de recoger el choclo y venderlo, toma el restante del maíz y lo seca, para venderlo en dos meses más cuando este producto eleve su precio, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y trabaja junto a su esposo y a su parientes, ellos también venden al por mayor a los comerciantes mayoristas y es bien conocida el producto del valle sagrado de los inkas por lo que tiene mayor acogida y sus productos son comprados por extranjeros y llevados fuera del país. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de semillas, abono y remover la tierra para una nueva epoca de cultivo.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Natividad” which is located in Urubamba Province in the Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and has three children (ages 13, 9, and 8). Yolanda divides her time between her daily activities and her small business. She has land on which she grows corn. After most of her harvest is collected and sold, Yolanda takes any remaining corn and dries it. She sells the corn two months later once the price has increased.

Yolanda is a hardworking woman who partners with her husband and his relatives. She also sells in bulk to the wholesale merchants and her products have been recognized within the Sacred Valley of the Incas. Her products are even purchased by foreigners and carried outside of the country. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers, as well as pay to have her land plowed for the new crop season.

Yolanda is very grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, as well as pay to have her land plowed for the new crop season.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula es una mujer soltera de 61 años, sin hijos que tiene casa propia con servicio sólo de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío de Paredones a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Morrope y a una hora aproximadamente de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura y la crianza de aves de corral.
Ursula se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral  (gallinas, pavos y codornices), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con maíz molido, polvillo de arroz y comida balanceada.  Posteriormente vende sus aves una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo para poder venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la provincia de Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia.
El crédito que ha solicitado Ursula es de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de  alimentos balanceados, con la finalidad de que sus aves engorden y pueda venderlo a buen precio para poder pagar su préstamo y al mismo tiempo esos ingresos le ayuden a que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.
Ursula es una mujer que siempre ante los retos que le ha puesto la vida, siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida.
texts.en:
Ursula is single and she is 61 years old. She doesn't have children but she owns her house which is equipped only with running water and hydro. It is located in the community of Paredones, about 15 minutes from the district of Morrope and approximately 1 hour from the province of Chiclayo. The primary business activity in this district is agriculture and raising foul.

Ursula raises corral foul (poultry, turkeys, and quail). The corral where she raises her livestock is located outside her house. She feeds them ground corn, rice flour, and balanced feed. When the livestock have reached an optimum level in development she sells them at the different markets in the province of Chiclayo, to increase her income and to support her family.

The loan that Ursula requests from Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner) is in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. The funds will be used to purchase balanced feed with the goal of fattening her livestock in order to sell them at a good price. This will permit her to repay the loan and at the same time this will help her family have a better future.

Ursula is a woman who has always achieved the goals she has set in life to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is married and has three children. She lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Rano sells blinds and curtains. She has been in this business for eight years and she owns the business. Now she plans to purchase a new assortment of goods and for this she has requested a loan of 9,000 TJS.  
   
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new blinds and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan de 44 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es soltero. Su actividad es la venta de helado y fletes en triciclo.

Empezó hace 15 años un amigo le recomendó y le gusto esa actividad porque podía recorrer por la ciudad.  Vende desde las 8H00 am a 18H00 pm recorriendo por la ciudad. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería de helados y un triciclo nuevo para poder trabajar mejor e incrementar mas sus ganancias. En un futuro desea terminar de construir su vivienda porque le hace falta enlucir y hacer el cerramiento.
texts.en:
Juan, 44, lives in a periurban zone in La Perimetral.  He’s single.  His business is frozen treat sales and cargo hauling with a three wheeled cart.

He started 15 years ago; a friend recommended it to him and he liked the activity because he can travel throughout the city.  He sells from 8am until 6pm going throughout the city.  

He wants to use the loan to buy more merchandise for the frozen treats and a new three wheeled cart to be able to work better and increase his profits.  In the future, he’d like to finish building his house because he still needs to plaster and seal.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats and a three-wheeled cart.

loans.name: Gloria Cecilia

texts.es:
Aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar y buscar mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, así como ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad son los motores que impulsaron a Gloria Cecilia a convertirse en microempresaria, de su esposo aprendió el oficio de arreglar relojes y debido a su habilidad para vender empezó a ofrecerle a sus clientes accesorios de fantasía. 
 
Actualmente Gloria necesita de un préstamo para comprar más accesorios de fantasía y plata con el fin de aumentar su inventario y mejorar así sus ingresos para crecer poco a poco.
texts.en:
Gloria Cecilia decided to become a micro-entrepreneur so that she could cover the household expenses, improve the quality of life for herself and her family, and offer her children the opportunity to study at the university. Since her husband learned how to repair watches, she decided to take advantage of this and begin offering her customers various accessories.

At the moment, Gloria needs a loan to buy more accessories and silver jewelry so that she can increase her inventory and gradually improve her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and silver jewelry to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Cris Katherin

texts.es:
Cris Katherin nació en la ciudad de San Francisco del departamento de Ayacucho (Perú) y tiene 23 años de edad. Actualmente, Cris Katherin vive en la misma hermosa ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cris Katherin es docente de profesión y trabaja en el colegio privado “San Jose Obrero - Didaskalion” de la ciudad de Pomacanchis. Ya es un año que enseña al nivel secundario y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Cris Katherin requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para pagar sus estudios de la maestría que está realizando. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Los Emprendedores” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Cris Katherin was born in the city of San Francisco in the department of Ayacucho (Peru) and is 23 years old. Currently, Cris Katherin lives in the beautiful city of Cusco (Peru). She is a teacher by profession and works in the "San Jose Obrero - Didaskalion" private school in the city of Pomacanchis. She has been teaching second grade for a year now and it is going very well thanks to the determination she puts into her work. At this time, Cris Katherin needs a loan for personal use, specifically to pay for her ongoing teaching studies.

She is a responsible and hardworking person and it was because of these qualities that her fellow group members invited her to participate in Asociación Arariwa's "Los Emprendedores" ("The Entrepreneurs") communal bank.

loans.use: to pay for her teaching studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es:
Balvina madre soltera, mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y honesta, todavía sus hijos está cursando la primaria, los planes a futuro que sus hijos sean profesionales. Tiene su propio negocio en el cual ella vende tortilla desde hace un tiempo. Inicio su negocio con fondos propios. A planes de corto plazo es aumentar sus ventas para generar ganancias.
Requiriendo el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como: maíz, leña, cal para nezquizar, carbón entre otros productos. Para la elaboración de tortillas. 
Agradece a la financiera por  el gran apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y el mejoramiento al nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Balvina is a single mother.  She’s an enterprising, hard working and honest woman.  Her children are still going to elementary school but her plan for the future is that they become professionals.  She has had her own business selling tortillas for some time now.  She started it with funds of her own.  Her short term plan is to increase sales to generate profits.

She requires the loan to buy raw materials like: corn, firewood, lime powder and charcoal among other things to make tortillas.  She is grateful to the financial organization for the great support of her business’ development and to the improvement of her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make tortillas.

loans.name: Luz Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña luz de Lourdes, tiene una pulperia y venta de cosmeticos, que ha venido trabajando para el apoyo de la familia. comenzando con dinero y propio y hoy en dia con prestamos en Afodenic que le ha ayudado al aumento de  la inversion.
Luz tiene mucho proyecto futuro en la mejora a su vivienda, una de ella es la puesta del piso. Pero que en estos momentos no es de periodad, ya que lo que desea es aumentar de productos su negocio, para seguir teniendo la demanda de sus clientes.
Comprara granos basicos,  en quintal de arroz, maiz, frijoles, caja de jabon, bidon de aceite, ropa para niños y cosmeticos de la Avon, zermat, para seguir promoviendo sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luz de Lourdes has a grocery store and cosmetics sales that she’s been running to support her family.  She started out with her own money and today with Afodenic loans that have helped her increase the investment.

Luz plans in the future to do some home improvements, one of which is to install new flooring.  But right now that’s not a high priority because what she wants to do is increase stock inventory in her business to continue being in her customers’ demand.  She will buy basic grains by the quintal: rice and beans, a case of soap, a large jug of oil, children’s clothes and Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics to continue taking advantage of their sales.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and Avon and Zermat brand cosmetics as well as children's clothes.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 49 years old and lives in Labinay, Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is married, with 3 dependents. Seven years ago, Beatriz installed a small piggery at home. She wakes up early in the morning to clean the animals' shelter and to bathe and feed them properly. Beatriz has cared for and sold quite a number of these domestic animals. She earns PHP 4,000 a month from all income sources.

In 2008, Beatriz joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. Her previous loan transactions have been successfully repaid. Earlier this year, Beatriz requested another loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase swine fattening to boost the pigs' health in order to have a bigger chance of selling them at a high rate. She plans to invest the future revenue by buying more piglets to raise and widening their fencing area.

loans.use: To purchase swine fattening to boost the pigs' health.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat, 53, is the resident of Tup, a nice village in the Isykul region. Together with her husband, who is a farmer, she has raised five daughters. The eldest daughter is married and lives separately with her family, and the other daughters are students. 

Rahat works as a primary school teacher; in order to contribute additional money to the family budget she also sells milk (about 10 liters a day). The family also cultivates agricultural products, this year her husband is growing wheat. 

Rahat applied for the loan because they need money to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest. With the profits gained from selling the harvest she will pay for family expenses (for example, the daughters' university tuition). 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.
