MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest

loans.name: 60 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. 
Lan is 47 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in T. Hoa City, a urban town in T. Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 60 Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Lan is requesting a loan to purchase machines to offer a tailoring and clothing repair service. This is Lan's first loan with T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to buy a new motorbike, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase machines to offer a tailoring and clothing repair service.

loans.name: Tunje

texts.en:
Tunje is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. 

She has operated a vegetable stall for the past one year; her potential clients are neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where there are low sales during the rainy seasons. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase vegetables such as potatoes for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Riza works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling shells  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Riza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase shells to sell for her buying and selling of shells business.

Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase shells to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a 19-year-old married woman with one child, who is not in school. She has a business of selling beer in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Abraham's husband is a driver.

Abraham requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more beer for sale. She will use her extra income for building houses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 21 years.  He is 46 years old, married to Mary, and they have five children who go to school.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers via marketing and this will be his second loan.  He repaid all his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, John hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 34-year-old mixed-crop farmer. He is married to Loise, who is a business lady. Currently they have no children. He has been in the farming business for the past five years with the monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced to the organization by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy a tea farm. His hopes to set aside money which will improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old lady from Nyalenda Estate, a low income estate in Kisumu City, western Kenya. She is married to Henry, a businessman, and they have four children between seven and 15 years old. For the past eight years, Elizabeth has operated a beauty salon in Nyalenda. 

Elizabeth joined KADET LTD and is requesting a loan to buy additional salon equipment such as blow-driers and hair dryers. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her loan to buy land where she can build a house as this has been her hope and dream.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers

loans.name: Gonchig

texts.en:
Gonchig is 32 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife is a school teacher and his son is a kindergarten student. 

He started his raw materials (wool, cashmere) trading business in 2006. He travels to rural areas to collect his raw materials. He has many trusted suppliers.
 
Now that winter is approaching, he needs support to collect his raw materials. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "Now is the peak season for my business. It is the only season I make most of my money". 

He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (wool, cashmere).

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Calca en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina;  La socia tiene 55 años de edad, La socia es casada, La socia tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 son independientes y 2 tienen 20, 18 años de edad; la socia tiene su propia molinera, la socia tiene en casa una molinera y ella también tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de trigo, maíz, entre otros productos; La socia aparte de moler sus productos y  venderlos en el mercado central, ella también alquila su molinera a sus clientes que luego llevan  a moler sus diferentes productos ya sea para la venta o para consumo propio, la socia es muy trabajadora y está cada vez mas satisfecha con los logros que viene obteniendo, la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas como trigo, maíz, quinua y otros productos para sembrar.



La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, 55, belongs to the “Señor del Calvario” communal bank which is located in Calca District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has five children three of which are independent and two who are 20 and 18 years old.  She has her own mill at home and she also has fields where she grows wheat and corn among other products.  Aside from milling her products and selling them in the central market she also leases out her mill to her customers who bring their various products to be milled either to sell or for their own consumption.  She is very hardworking and every time she’s more satisfied with the accomplishments she’s attaining.  

On this occasion she wants to invest the money to buy seeds like wheat, corn, quinoa and other products to plant.  She appreciates the loan and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years and she is married to Charles. They are blessed with two children, aged 25 and 21 respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan  with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Helen will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and later venture into pig rearing.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: María Obdulia

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 61 años, que vive sola con un hijo de 17 años luego de la separación de su esposo hace algún tiempo. Ambos residen en Santo Domingo que  es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito la capital del Ecuador. Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del país, punto de enlace entre algunas ciudades importantes. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

María se dedica a la agricultura. Esto lo aprendió desde que era muy joven, de sus familiares. Siembra productos típicos de la zona como lo son el cacao, la yuca y el plátano. Su casita es muy humilde y carece de luz eléctrica y el piso de la misma no está en óptimas condiciones. María a confiado "Fernando", que es un joven asesor de crédito de Fundación Alternativa para que le ayude a obtener un préstamo para arreglar el piso de su casa y además invertir en abonos y pesticidas para sus plantaciones. De esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder pagar el crédito y además podrá recibir capacitación y asesoramiento y así superar sus pobrezas.

Esta mujer trabajadora sueña con tener una casita con los servicios básicos y luego de la dura separación de su esposo su preocupación también es su hijo, que desea pueda concluir sus estudios.
texts.en:
María is a 61 year old woman.  She lives alone with her 17 year old son since separating from her husband some time ago.  They both live in the Santo Domingo canton.  Santo Domingo is a canton and city in the new Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, which used to be a rural parish of Quito. Santo Domingo is between the coast and the mountain range in Ecuador, a connecting point between some important cities.  It is situated on the outer edges of the western mountains and in the lower coastal plain at 1000 meters above sea level. This area has the highest rainfall in the country. There is a great abundance of water as there are five important river basins and micro basins here. It is a rainy, subtropical zone, and the average temperature is 22 °C.

María is a farmer.  She learned how to do this from her family members when she was very young.  She grows products that are typical of the zone like cacao, yucca, and bananas.  Her small house is very humble.  It does not have electricity, and the floor is not in good condition.

María has confided in “Fernando”, a young credit adviser with the Fundación Alternativa, so that he will help her get a loan to fix the floor in her house.  She will also buy fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.  This way she will be able to improve her income and pay the loan.  She will also be able to receive training and counseling to overcome her poverty.

This hard-working woman dreams of having a small house with the basic services.  After the difficult separation from her husband she worries about her son, and she hopes that he will be able to complete his education.

loans.use: to fix the floor of her house and to invest in her banana crop.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del comité mujeres unidas se dedican a variadas actividades, pero siempre realizan actividades en conjunto como forma de poder mantener su unión.  Actualmente se encuentran en 5to.ciclo en donde se puede mencionar la responsabilidad y unión entre ellas.
Elizabeth es una de las integrantes, ella comenta que tiene una pequeña peluquería bien equipada, donde atiende a todos los clientes que tiene. Comenta que empezó con una modesta peluquería y que gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene muy buena clientela y ha podido mejorar un poco su negocio. Este es el medio con que puede mantener a su familia y desea poder seguir con el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, esmaltes y demás productos con los cuales puede seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mujeres Unidas" ["United Women"] communal bank work in a variety of fields, but they always take part in activities together as a way of keeping their unity.  Currently they are in their fifth lending cycle, and they mention the responsibility and unity that exists between the members.

Elizabeth is one of the members.  She comments that she has a small, well-equipped beauty salon, where she tends to all her customers.  She comments that she began with a modest beauty salon, and that thanks to her efforts she now has a good customer base, and has been able to grow her business a little.  It is the means with which she is able to support her family, and she wants to be able to continue with it.  She is requesting the loan for the purchase of shampoo, rinses, dyes, nail enamel, and other products with which she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, nail enamel, and other products.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 37 years old married man, a father of 4 children, he lives in Jabal Al Hussain, Jordan.
Hussein is looking to have a loan of 2000JDs to buy a container of clothes and homeholds so he can expand his work in clothes and households sales.

loans.use: to buy a container of clothes and homeholds

loans.name: Rafael Gimo

texts.pt:
Rafael de 54 anos de idade casado tem 4 filhos com idade escolar. Rafael e electricista auto e tambem comerciante, gere o seu negocio com sua esposa, o seu horario de trabalho e das 07:30 as 07:30h faz 24horas e tem 2 dias de folga durante os dias úteis, para além de ter folga no fim-de-semana.
    O emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de deterengentes para roupas, caldos, arroz, cerveja e roupas usadas. Para reforcar o seu negocio.
 As suas esperancas sao de desenvolver cada vez mais o seu negocio e ensinar tambem os seus filhos a fazer negocio. 
 O seu principal desafio e de ampliar o seu estabelecimento comercial para que fique como super mercado.
texts.en:
Rafael is 54 years old and married. He has four school-age children. Rafael is an auto electrician and also a merchant. He runs his business alongside his wife. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 7:30 a.m., a 24-hour day, and he gets two days off.
The loan will be used to purchase laundry detergent, broths, rice, beer and used clothing in order to boost his business.
He hopes to further develop his business and also teach his children to conduct business.
His main challenge is to enlarge his store so that it will be like a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase laundry detergent, broths, rice, beer and used clothing in order to boost his business.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared was born and brought up in Kisii-Nyamira. He is married with two kids. He runs a business in Nairobi and is a trained electrician.

He is seeking a loan to put up a toilet in his residential home situated in the informal settlement. He owns a house and has one rental house in the same area.

He learned about the Fresh Life toilet through one of the Fresh Life staff members who was doing marketing. He has resided in the area for a long time. His intention is to improve the living standards of his family and that of the tenant. He will pay for the loan through his rental income, as well as income from his electrical business.

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Kasih Loli Group

texts.en:
Sulce is a 41 year old woman who is married to Soleman, a 51 year old farmer. They have been blessed with 3 children namely, Marteda(21), Netri (16), is attending 3rd grade of junior high school,and Istrina (12) is attending 5 grade of elementary school.

As a mother, Sulce really cares about her children's future, especially their education. She wishes to send her children to have better level of education rather than she was. That is the reason why Sulce is also working hard to get income. Sulce sells vegetables and other spices at the local market. 

To achieve what she desires, Sulce requests loan from TLM through Kiva in total of 1.750.000. This loan will help her to purchase more stocks of vegetables such as; cabbage, tomato, water spinach, chili, turmeric, etc. Just like Sulce, 2 more members would also spend their loan to renew their business stocks.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables such as; cabbage, tomato, water spinach, chili, turmeric, etc

loans.name: Foutoumata

texts.en:
This is a group loan where a group of women will share the risk of the loan together. A representative, Fatoumata D., will deliver the repayment. Please note: The agreement with the Femmes de Nder group was that they would repay the entire Kiva loan at the end of the borrowing period (January 2007) rather than in installments.  This is because the group leader wishes to give each member the opportunity to borrow a small portion of the total loan amount for her own business activities, for a length of time that is less than the total nine-month term of the Kiva loan.  The individual will then repay the loan she has taken to the group fund, which will in turn lend it to another member.  Allowing the group to repay the entire loan at the end of the borrowing period in this way allows them to take turns borrowing, extending access to more members.

« Femmes de Nder » is the women's group of the 300 person village of Nder in the north of Senegal near the Mauritanian border, also known as the ancient capital of the Walo, one of the Kingdoms of the Wolof ethnic group, conquered by the French. GENSEN has approved this group's request for credit and has received $100 in donations to open their account.

Incorporated in 1994 as a Groupement d'Interet Economique or GIE, which is the smallest type of government recognized business, the group currently has 44 members. It first created, farmed and sold the produce from a communal field, using the profits to develop a small cash fund. By collecting dues of $0.20 per month from each member, the group began a rotating credit system, lending from $10 to $50 with 5% interest. They have continued this lending system, dropped the interest rate, and increased the membership dues to a dollar every 4 months. The total in the fund is about $1,200. The group has received and repaid a substantial loan from a federation of women's groups in their regional capital city of Saint Louis.

The group also owns large cooking utensils that it rents out to members of the village for parties and ceremonies, the profits of which go back into the fund. Either as a group or through small businesses of its members Femmes de Nder cultivates sweet potatoes, harvests and processes incenses that grows as bulbous roots of an indigenous grass, raises chickens, goats, and sheep; practices local crafts, engages in commerce between Mauritania and Senegal and operates small restaurants. Each year, the group also pays for 4 members to go on a religious pilgrimage to Tivaouane, the holy city of their Muslim religious brotherhood.

loans.use: $50 for 20 people to develop saleable foods and crafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to buy more women trousers and baby wear.  She also wants to move her business to a rental shop.

loans.name: Solialii

texts.en: Solialii’s runs a stand at the flea market in the Samoan village of Fugalei.  Solialii sells her goods to local customers and tourists alike, and most of what Solialii stocks is handmade by her and her husband using Samoan materials, especially coconut shells.  Solialii has a long history with SPBD.  She is very active and reliable participant in her local SPBD Center’s activities and is currently seeking her fourth loan, having paid back the previous three in full and on time.  Solialii would use this fourth loan to further expand her product line and differentiate her flea market stall from local competitors.

loans.use: Expand the products available to her local customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construct a stall and expand her food business

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is a dedicated entrepreneur who is sometimes accused of being a workaholic. He is pictured here outside our loan office in Nicopol. Two years ago he started a small business selling groceries. He picked a good location for his business, one that was convenient and filled a market niche, and he has poured his energy into making it successful. Vitaliy is a kind, attentive man who tries to take care of his customers.

Vitaliy has requested a loan to help open a new selling location and purchase more grocery items to sell. He’d like to continue expanding his business so that he can increase his income. He'd also like to hire other local people, providing a means of income for them as well. Another immediate goal he has is to earn enough income to purchase a self-contained heating unit for his home.

loans.use: Help open new sales location and purchase inventory

loans.name: Isgender

texts.en: Isgender S. has been engaged in this business for 10 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Gubadli region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region, and is settled in Sumgayit city. He has three children and owns a mini food shop. This 47 year-old man is the only breadwinner in family. With this business he earns little money. This money is enough for only some of his family's basic needs. He has difficulty in covering other family consumption needs like medication, clothes, and school fees, etc. He needs $600 for expanding his business and improving his family's living conditions. He wants increase the number of his clients and as well as his income. He will repay the loan within 16 months.

loans.use: For expanding her business and improving her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
Mutabar A. Obidovna has been selling children's clothing for the past 7 years. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a member of a civilian company. He is receiving a very small pension. After the birth of their youngest child Mutabar had to start selling on the market leaving her children under the care of her oldest daughter. In the beginning, she was buying goods wholesale in credit, but the cost was much higher than buying them retail. In 2006 Mutabar first found out about MicroInvest credit lending. She then took out a loan and was able to buy goods wholesale for lower prices which allowed her to make some profit. She was spending part of her income on the needs of her family and reinvested the rest in her business. To be more competitive, Mutabar intends to travel to Bishkek, the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, which will allow her to start selling wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедова Муътабар Обидовна в течение 7 лет торгует детской одеждой. Замужем.Имеет 3 детей. Муж участник гражданской компании. Получает мизерную пенсию. После рождения четвертого ребенка в семье Муътабар вынуждена была выйти на базар торговать оставив детей на попечение старшей дочки. Сначала она приобрела товар у оптовиков под реализацию, но стоимость товара был гораздо выше чем по наличке. В середине 2006г она узнала о программе кредитования «Микроинвест». Получив первый кредит она приобрела товар у оптовиков по более низким ценам, что позволило ей получить дополнительную прибыль. Часть прибыли она тратила на нужды семьи, а оставшуюся часть вложила в свой бизнес. Чтобы быть более конкурентноспособным она намеревается ездить сама за товаром в Бишкек (Республика Кыргизстан), что позволить ей перейти в оптовую торговлю товарами.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeth is 43 years old and finished her high school eduction. She and her 4 children live in the area of Campina de Moche in Trujillo. She works preparing dairy products such as cheeses and yogurts, as well raising dairy cows whose milk she sells to a large company. She is a member of the group Mientras Tanto, Siempre Adelante (always forward), from which she received her first loan to buy materials for making and packaging yogurt. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase feed for the cows, and several molds for making chocolate. Her greatest dream is to see her children with good professions.

La señora Maria Elizabeth tiene 43 años de edad, estudio superior completa y tiene 4 hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector Campiña de Moche del Distrito de Moche de la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad - Perú Actualmente la señora Maria Elizabeth elabora productos lácteos (manjar blanco, queso, quesillo, toffes, yogurt) además cría ganado y vende leche a una empresa grande del país es por eso que se animó a preparar productos derivados de la leche ya que cuenta con el insumo. La señora María Elizabeth es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Siempre Adelante” en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 con los cuales compró bolsas para envasar yogurt y cultivos para elaborarlo. Con este préstamo de S/.500.00 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará alimento para el ganado y unos cuanto moldes para la preparación de las chocotejas. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE FEED FOR HER DAIRY COWS, AND MATERIALS NEEDED TO MAKE DAIRY PRODUCTS.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Ms. Matilde belongs to the Amor y Paz community bank. She lives in the San Martín region in the Moyabamba province and district. She carries out her business in a stand in the Los Angeles Private Market of that city, where her guests visit everyday from the area or nearby towns. Her experience as a domestic worker allowed her to learn to cook and do it well, reason enough for her to establish her own business selling food a la carte daily. She does so with great pleasure, and her wellbeing has improved because she has been able to meet her children’s needs. With the loan valued at 800.00 sols, to be paid in 6 months, she will purchase the ingredients to prepare meals, such as rice, sugar, wholesale stews, all kinds of vegetables by the kilo, kilos of beef, chicken, pork and fish which will allow her to make a variety of dishes. Moreover, with her earnings she will continue paying off her car and new gas stove. Matilde is a very enthusiastic and happy woman, she is 41 years old, and she would like to forge a better future and a peaceful old age, which is why she would like to have a grocery store in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Matilde pertenece al banco comunal Amor y Paz, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Desarrolla el negocio en un puesto de ventas del Mercado Privado Los Ángeles de esta ciudad, lugar donde diariamente acuden sus comensales, los cuales son moradores de la propia localidad o visitantes de lugares cercanos, Su experiencia como trabajadora del hogar le permitió aprender a cocinar y tener una buena sazón, razones suficientes que la motivaron a instalar su propio negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo MENU, el cual lo realiza con mucha satisfacción, además siente que su economía ha mejorado porque puede satisfacer las necesidades de sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/ 800.00, el cual pagará en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como arroz, azúcar, menestras al por mayor, verduras en todas sus variedades por kilos, carnes de res, pollo, cerdo y pescado también en kilos, los cuales le permitirá preparar comida variada, además con las ganancias continuará pagando las letras de su motocarro y de su nueva cocina a gas. Matilde es una mujer entusiasta y alegre de 41 años, quien desea forjarse un futuro mejor y una vejez tranquila, por lo que anhela tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes en su propio hogar.

loans.use:
Purchase of ingredients (rice, sugar, stews, vegetables, etc)

Compra de insumos (arroz, azúcar, menestras, verduras, etc)

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif G. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. He has been settled with his family in Beylagan since 1993. Vagif is a-45 year-old man, is married and has three children. He is engaged in animal breeding and sales. Vagif purchases animals from the livestock market of Beylagan, raises them for some months and then sells them again. (He is pictured at the livestock market). Vagif applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for the KIVA loan in amount of $700 to purchase some sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Malia L.. She is married, and has two children, ages 3 and 5. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are her niece and nephew. In 2007, Malia established her milling business. Malia requires a loan in order to purchase spare parts and oil for her milling machine. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and oil for her milling machine.

loans.name: Amratully

texts.en:
Amratully is 46 years old and is married with four children. Amratully has been selling charcoal and onions since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Amratully now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for a charcoal business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard O. is a 43-year-old businessman who deals in hardware. He is married with 3 children who are currently in school. Richard is very hardworking and supportive of his family's daily needs. He sells items like radio sets, batteries, touch lights, screwdrivers, machine oil, door locks, lanterns, etc in the local market. He also provides financial support to his wife, who sells used clothes to support him and provide for the family. His dream is to build a container shop that can accommodate all his products to ease his costs and risk of theft. He wants to use the loan to buy additional products like agrochemicals and simple spraying machines to serve the farmers, who frequently demand these because the farming season has begun. Richard is a member of the community group called Confident Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy additional products like agrochemicals and simple spraying machines

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann P., 31, grows crops behind her house and earns about a $1 per day, Her husband, Soun Khy, is 39 years-old and sells fish in the market, earning about $4 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young and in school. The family lives in Betmeas Village of the Province of Siem Reap. P. is requesting a loan of $500 to buy farmland to expand her farming business. This will help her grow and sell more crops, and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: To buy farmland to expand farming business

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 50-year-old Theresia M.. She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 20. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans and she has taken them in. In 2002, Theresia established her grocery business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 30 USD every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Theresia is seeking a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, beans and vegetables in bulk. In the future, Theresia plans to renovate the building which houses her store. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania, using a sale and leaseback microfinance model as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, they are deemed not creditworthy by financial institutions, leading low incomes and inadequate access to basic needs and services. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women: when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks af beans, rice, and vegetable in bulk.

loans.name: Lucianitas Santa Lucia Group 1

texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a small village with an interesting setting. Not like most villages, the church and the community centre are situated on the same square. They are a bit apart from each other which creates two important squares and gives Santa Lucia a stretched look. This is all surrounded by steep hills on which all the houses are built in a very picturesque way. This is a very pleasant town and even when it is pouring down rain and the streets have changed into little rivers, the streets are still full of people.

The women tell me they all grew up here and for that reason, they know each other very well. Most of the women have been working on their beautiful embroideries since they were very young, as the president of the group tells me. She sells her blouses to her friends and family and some of the women present are wearing her blouses today. She and three others also sew skirts.

They sell most of their goods in Sololá which is the nearest city, about one hour away. The market days there are the best day to have good business, says Paulina. Brigida travels to a town called Godines. This is a town with an crossroads where you can go to several places and because of that, many people pass by. That's why she decided to travel the 2 hours a couple of times a week to sell her goods.

Genara tells me she went to school for four years only, and she started helping her parents from then on. It is her wish to see her children who are at university now get a degree so they have more choices in what their occupation could be. Having her business means having the means to support her children in their journey to become the professionals she was not able to become. These women are struggling for a noble cause; let's support them in their struggle.

loans.use: buy better fabric and tools for embroidery

loans.name: Mrs. Muong Sovannary Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Muong S. is the group loan leader with four members, all of whom live in Trapeang Srang Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Muong S. is 20-years-old and has just married so she does not have any children.

She is pig breeder in the local village. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Muong S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sitha, is a garment factory worker and his income helps to support his family. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan after selling her pigs.

loans.use: To buy purchase additional piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
G. Aly is an active client of MicroInvest who trusts the MicroInvest loan process. He has applied for a business development loan. Mr. G. Aly is married and has 2 children. He does not have a good education but he is very experienced in the livestock business. Mr. G. Aly has a dream that his children will get a good education. He is ready to work day and night to realize that dream.

He is engaged in the family business of livestock, agricultural, and selling rice. He also works in the collective farm as a bookkeeper. Now Mr. G. Aly asks for a business support loan of 4000 STJ to buy a pedigree bull. He appreciates his gratuity to KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigree bull

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.en:
S. Bobomurod is 30 years old. He is married with two adorable children. Bobomurod has always opted to make his life in his land, and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.

Today he wishes to increase the number of his cattle and for this reason he would like to buy cows. He hopes to increase his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1700 Somoni (US$500) for the term of 12 months.

Extend your solidarity to Bobomurod so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of the small cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Samad

texts.en:
Samad owns a kiosk at a railway market in Simferopol. He sells children's toys. He chose this business because he loves children and wants them to be a bit happier. Samad has been in this business for 4 years. Today his monthly gross income is 18,000 UAH; his net profit is about 2,000 UAH. His kiosk with toys is the only one at this particular market. That is one of the reasons why his business is quite successful.

Samad would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. He and his wife (who is also an entrepreneur) hope to generate enough income to be able to fix up their apartment and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for his toy shop

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: La señora Elvira W. es cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya hace 3 años, destacándose por  su pago excelente, es madre soltera por lo que sus esfuerzos se redoblan por tener el papel de jefa de hogar y no tener otro ingreso para sustentar los gastos de la casa. Se inició en el negocio de compra y venta hace 10 años , vendiendo ropa de ocasión casa por casa hasta lograr un pequeño capital para establecerse en su local propio   hasta hoy día , contando con un amplio stock de mercaderías varias lo cual le permite mirar con optimismo el periodo de fin de año donde hay mas expectativas de ventas.
texts.en:
Elvira W. has been a client of Kiva partner Fundacion Paraguaya for three years, standing out by making her payments well. She is a single mother, which is why she works doubly hard as the head of household. She has no other income to pay for her home's expenses. She began her business of buying and selling 10 years ago, selling, door to door, clothes for various occasions until she earned a little bit of money to set herself up in her own location, where she has been until now, relying on a wide stock of merchandise. This allows her to be optimistic about the end of the year, when there are more expected sales.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of shoes and items imported from Bolivia for end-of-year sales

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
P. lives in Banteay Meanchey Province in Cambodia. He is 51 years old and sells jars from home. The jars are made from cements. He usually sells them to wholesalers who order a few days or a week in advance, and he can make around $8 a day from his investment.

P. is married to Mrs. Lon, 56, who works with him in making jars and also is a good housewife that cooks delicious meals for family. The couple has six children; four of them are married, and the other two are single and also assist their parents in making jars.

P. is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike and a trailer and use them to transport jars to sell directly at clients' houses. The remaining loan money will be used to buy rice to store and re-sell for profit.

P.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available for photographing.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a trailer

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice T. sells fish. She buys fish from fishermen, processes and preserves the fish and sells them at the market at Bantama in Elmina, Ghana. Beatrice does not have a formal education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband works with the hydro-electrical service department. Beatrice has been selling fish since 1990. She is responsible for supporting her husband by paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to develop a plot of land, which she bought with her husband to put up their family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es:
KATY KARINA CHÁVEZ P., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” con domicilio en el Jr. Calleria N° 670 del distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 29 años, 03 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo como armador de botes.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, inició el negocio de venta de pescado fresco, de manera informal con unas canastas, encontrando un negocio rentable, y de desarrollo, por lo cual buscó y compró un puesto formal, y actualmente está administrando dos puestos más, generando 2 puestos de trabajo, adicionalmente al de ella.
 
Este crédito de S/.1,500.00, lo invertirá íntegramente en implementar los 3 puestos en total, con cuchillos, tablas de picar y artículos de limpieza y los diversas especies de pescados y contribuir económicamente con la familia. 

Ella se encuentra muy comenta con Manuela Ramos, que hizo que pudiera tener un negocio propio y lo que es más importante, salir adelante sin trabas económicas.
texts.en:
Katy Karina C. P. belongs to the New Eden community bank in Yarinacocha. She is 29 years old and has 3 children. Her partner owns a boat. With her first S/.300 new-soles loan, she started a business selling fresh fish with nothing more than a few baskets. She found that it was a profitable business and set out to develop it, finding and buying a food stall. She now manages two other food stalls, creating employment for 2 people, in addition to the stall that she operates herself. This S/.1,500 loan will be invested in supplying the 3 food stalls with knives, snack bars, cleaning products and various kinds of fish, all of which will ultimately contribute earnings to support her family. She is very happy with Manuela Ramos which has done so much to enable her to own her own business and, more importantly, to overcome her circumstances and get ahead in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for fish business.

loans.name: Nazia  Khalid Rafique Group

texts.en:
Nazia baji is the wife of K. R.. They have lived in Lahore, Pakistan for ten years. The city of Lahore is famous for its historical places and for Punajbi foods. Nazia baji is the mother of two children, one son and one daughter. Both of them are enrolled in school. Nazia baji and her husband made a commitment to themselves that they will give their children a better future, so they work really hard to fulfill their commitment. Her husband sells fruit from a cart by announcing his products in a loud voice in different areas, and Nazia baji embroiders dresses on order. She collects the orders from the cloth shop and gets money for her labor. Nazia baji is applying for a loan to buy materials, including beads and colored thread, for her decorative embroidery business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shumaila baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Razia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her sewing business. Shagufta baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the others' loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Various, including buying embroidery supplies

loans.name: Melvith

texts.es: La señora Melvith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. San Martín S/Nº - Caserío D. El Porvenir, Distrito D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 34 años y es madre D. 04 hijos, 03 que aun dependen D. ella. Con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 y las ganas D. salir adelante  emprendió su negocio D. venta D. comida como los tradicionales juanes y anticuchos, que luego decidió cambiar por la crianza y venta  D. gallinas vivas que los cría en la huerta D. su propia casa  para luego ofrecerlo en el mercado principal D. la ciudad y a los dueños D. conocidos restaurantes. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 que cancelara en 06 meses, comprará  100 gallinas bebes para criarlos, alimento balanceado y vacunas para que crezcan sanas y gordas  para luego venderlos, también comprará  20 gallos y 20 gallinas grandes para que se reproduzcan. Este negocio le rinD. muy buenas ganancias.  Es ella quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio, es una mujer emprendedora, perseverante y mira siempre el futuro con mucho optimismo. Melvith, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que viene recibiendo.
texts.en:
Melvith belongs to the “Virgen del Rosario” community bank. She lives in the village of El Porvenir in the district of Bellavista, department of San Martín. She is married, 34 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are still dependent on her. With her first loan of 300 soles and the desire to progress, she opened her business selling prepared food such as traditional "juanes" [boiled rice and meat wrapped in leaves] and anticuchos [marinated pieces of beef heart on skewers]. She later decided to change businesses and began raising and selling live chickens which she raises in the garden of her home in order to later offer them for sale in the main market of the city and to the owners of well-known restaurants. With the loan of 2,000 soles which will be repaid in six months she will buy 100 young chicks to raise, balanced feed and vaccinations so that they will grow to be healthy and fat for later resale, as well as 20 roosters and 20 hens so that they will reproduce. This business is very profitable. She is the one who makes the decisions about the revenues and profits from her business; she is an enterprising woman, persevering and always looks to the future with great enthusiasm. Melvith is grateful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy young chicks to raise, as well as roosters and hens.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh P. L. is a worker with a monthly income of about 1,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,204,000 VND (~$125 USD ) to breed pigs. She was born in 1982 and lives with her husband and two children.

No: 010114150050.

loans.use: To breed pigs

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, three sons and two daughters. She says they are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer while she is a petty trader.

Dorcas trades in maize. She procures bags of maize from the farmers in the nearby communities and sells in the local market to retailers. She also treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Dorcas is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr: Yaya B.   est un commerçant détaillant  qui vend des denrées alimentaires à sandiara village situé à 80km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise. A trente sept (37) ans il est marié et père de famille. Il est dans le secteur du commerce depuis huit  ans  tout ses biens sont acquis avec les revenus du commerce. Il sollicite un prêt pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et acheter des quantités plus importantes de marchandises.
texts.en:
Yaya B. is a retail merchant who sells grocery items in the village of Sandiara village, located 80 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He is 37 years old, married, and the father of a family. He has been in this field of business for eight years. All of his goods are gotten with the revenues from his business. He’s requesting a loan to boost his working capital and to buy more significant quantities of merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora D. makes a living operating in the food market buying and selling fish, crab, shrimp etc. in the local community. She is 60 years old, widowed and has three adult children. She is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Teodora has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teodora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teodora is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa D. is from the village of Purok 2A, Kasinglot Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Felisa is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Felisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising flowers in her flower farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting flowers for sale. Felisa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.She also just started her variety store as a sideline.

In 2009, Felisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ajike

texts.en: Ajike sells groceries and perfume from her home. She has been in this business for the past 15 years. Ajike is very happy with LAPO-KIVA for their financial support. She is 50 years old and married, and she has 4 children. Ajike is hoping for a loan of of N150,000 to purchase more groceries and perfume to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and perfume to sell

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: S. Godfrey is a client of Pearl microfinance in Ntungamo. He is 49 years old and married with 6 children aged 15 – 6 years as he takes care of 1 orphan and all the children are in school. He is a business man involved in banana trading in Ishunga Cell for 9 years and at the moment he makes a profit of 30,000/= from the sale of matooke a week. In addition to his good customer care skills, Godfrey would like a loan to help expand his business by increasing his capital base so that he can be able to buy more matooke for resale. He has high hopes of seeing all his children educated since this is the first key to success. He is a hard working and determined man who works hand in hand with his wife and children so that they could enjoy the fruits together.

loans.use: Buying more bananas for resale so as to make more profits.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
44-year-old Sonia Z. runs a buy and sell business selling “abaca” (fiber from abaca palm leaf used for handicraft production), and “copra” (dried coconut meat used for oil production). Since her early married life with Mario started seventeen years ago, this is the business that has provided income for the family. Because of this business, Sonia has been able to sustain the growing needs of their twin children each year.

When Sonia joined ASHI in 2002, she tried venturing into buying and selling other commodities such as rice and salt. Loans she was able to access then were used as additional capital for growing her business and helping other entrepreneurs in their village have access to marketing their products in other villages and municipalities.

Now, that harvest season for rice is starting, Sonia is requesting a loan which she will be using to finance her rice buy and sell business as well as her salt buy and sell business.

With her husband’s help in managing it, Sonia really wants her business to grow. For the financial capital needed, she has no other resource but to get it through ASHI. Her dreams of buying a lot away from the seashore where they will build a shelter that would secure them from the damage that typhoons bring, and the graduation of her children from college, depend on the success of her business and its profitability. Therefore Sonia is determined to use her loan well in the business and to expand her business further. In her previous loans, she never failed to pay her dues to ASHI on time.

loans.use: To finance a large volume of rice and salt for her buy and sell business

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 36 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en la casa de un familiar. Hace un año y medio decidió incursionar en la venta de pollos. De lunes a viernes recorre los restaurantes de su localidad para ofrecer sus pollos, logrando vender 3 al día y los sábados los vende en la feria ganadera de su zona. Felicita se abastece de la granja de una de sus amistades y también cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, quien la acompaña cada día. Adicionalmente, Felicita ofrece el servicio de lavado de ropa, actividad que le permite obtener ganancias extras, por lo que con ambas labores logra sostener las necesidades de su familia.
Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y tiene muchas expectativas del trabajo con su banco comunal, por su parte, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en sus dos negocios: comprará más pollos y grandes cantidades de detergente.

loans.use: Compra de más pollos

loans.name: Iris Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora IRIS FELICITAS L. MELÉNDEZ , tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito de SALPO , provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DE LAS MERCEDES
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria , 
IRIS es casada  y tiene 2  hijos mayores quienes no dependen económicamente de ella, sino ella cuenta con el apoyo económico de ellos.
IRIS se dedica a preparación y venta de pan y jamón.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de harina, levadura, aceite y huevos al por mayor para la preparación del pan.
Este crédito de 600 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar mas productos e insumos para la preparación de pan y de jamón.
IRIS  sueña con ampliar sus ventas de pan y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Iris Felicitas L. M. is 49 years old, and lives in the district of Salpo, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank Virgen de las Mercedes [Our Lady of Las Mercedes]. The businesswoman has completed her studies up to the 5th year of secondary school. Iris is married and has 2 older children that do not depend on her financially, but rather she depends on their financial support. Iris makes and sells bread and ham. She invested her previous loan of 300 PEN in the purchase of wholesale flour, yeast, oil, and eggs to make bread. This loan of 600 PEN will be used to purchase more products and supplies for the preparation of bread and ham. Iris dreams of increasing her bread sales and obtaining higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will utilize the loan to purchase more products for the preparation of bread and ham.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is James K.. James is seeking his very first loan from Kiva lenders through SMT. He wants a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy house building materials.

James is age thirty, married and with two children. James' children are attending schools – one is in class II and the other is in nursery school.

loans.use: To buy house building materials.

loans.name: María Elinor

texts.es: María Elinor es una socia con muchos anhelos D. superación, es dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 47 años, es madre D. tres hijos mayores, ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. segundo uso por los distintos caseríos que están fuera D. la ciudad y también tiene una pequeña bodega donD. venD. gaseosas y abarrotes, negocio que tiene en su casa. Su esposo es obrero D. servicios públicos. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “María Montessori” desD. hace cinco años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra D. gaseosas para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito D. 1300 soles, que será utilizado para comprar ropa D. segundo uso y otra parte invertirá en comrpar productos D. primera necesidad para su bodega. La meta D. María es tener una bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
María Elinor, 47, is a dynamic member with high hopes for self-improvement. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, has three adult children, and sells used clothing in the surrounding hamlets; she also has a small grocery story in her home where she sells soft drinks and groceries. Her husband is a public service employee. She has been a member of the “María Montessori” communal bank for the past five years. Her initial 300 sol loan was used to buy soft drinks to sell. Now, she needs a 1,300 sol loan which will be used in part to buy used clothing and in part to stock her store with basic household items. María's goal is to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy household basics and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es: La señora Dominga Pérez, mujer trabajadora, es costurera, vende ropa zapatos, cosméticos y  alquila un cuarto todo esto con el propósito de prosperar y poder cubrir sus necesidades, personales con su familia ya que todo esta caro. Cuando inicio lo hizo con ayuda de su esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, procreo tres hijos dos mayores casados y uno que estudia la universidad, con sus ingresos paga luz, agua, estudios a si como compra variedades para incrementar las ventas. Tiene 51 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación en donde ha logrado tener buena clientela en la costura, con este préstamo comprara pantalones para mujer como hombre, ropa para niños, zapatos, tela, hilos, adornos entre otros para cumplir con los encargos como mejorar la variedad de ropa. Se siente contenta ya que a través de estos préstamos ha mejorado su casa, compro un   inodoro, ha incrementado las ventas de ropa y siente que apoya a su esposo e hijos. Es por eso espera seguir trabando con la institución ya que se beneficia con el financiamiento a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Señora Dominga Pérez, a hardworking woman, is a seamstress and sells clothing and cosmetics. She rents a room for all of this with the purpose of getting ahead and being able to cover her expenses and those of her family, since everything is very expensive. When she started she did so with the help of her husband, who sells basic grains. She has three children, two of whom are married and one who studies at the university. With her income she pays for the light, water, and educational expenses, as well as a variety of goods to increase her sales. She is 51 years old, and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion where she has managed to have a good clientele for her dressmaking business. With this loan she will buy pants for women and men, clothing for children, shoes, fabric, thread, trimmings and other items to fulfill her orders and increase her variety of clothing. She feels content since through these loans she has improved her house, bought a toilet, has increased her sales of clothing and feels that she is supporting her husband and children. For this reason she hopes to continue working with the institution, since she benefits from the longer-term financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, thread, fabric, thread and trimmings

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel F. is from the village of Purok 8, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. He is 35 years old. Joel is separated from spouse. To make a living, Joel provides mechanical services to local community members. Joel has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase the materials he needs to provide service. This will be Joel's first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy aluminium cookware

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 20 years old, married and the mother of a 3-year-old. She is involved in rice farming. She says that because of their farm, her family’s needs are provided. She works hard to make the farm more productive so her income could also improve.

Sheryl asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 from CEVI. With this loan, she will be able to finance her farm and buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, de 24 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le cedió uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo es el tejido, tanto artesanal y a máquina, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 12 años cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar sus pedidos. Desde hace 4 años tiene su propio taller de tejidos donde confecciona chompas, chalinas, chullos, guantes, etc., prendas que los fines de semana vende en su puesto ubicado en la explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes.

Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedarán, y lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, ya que tiene que cuidarlo. Aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Con el tiempo, espera poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener una tienda más grande de prendas artesanales.

Este es el primer préstamo de Virginia con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar los tejidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Virginia, who is 24 years old, is a hard-working and very sensible young woman. She lives in the house that one of her family members has ceded to her, and what she wants most is to improve the quality of her life. Her work is artisanal knitting, which she does both by hand and by machine. She has carried out this activity since she was 12 years old, when she helped her parents complete their orders. For the past 4 years, she has had her own handicraft workshop where she makes sweaters, scarves, hats, gloves, etc., garments that she sells on the weekends at her location on the seasonal Laguna esplanade (the place where they have markets in the city of Juliaca), where she waits on her clients with great pleasure. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and advising them on the garments that suit them best. The most difficult part of her work is remaining all day at her sales location, since she has to take care of it. Even so, she knows that she has to work very hard to reach her goals. With time, she hopes to increase her business and have a bigger store of handmade clothing. This is Virginia's first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be punctual in her payments, since she doesn't want to damage the reputation of the other members of her community bank, where she is well-liked and respected. With the loan of 500 PEN she is applying for, she will buy more wool to increase the number of garments completed.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: V Hamoner's Group

texts.en:
Vilma H., from the village of Matugas Alto, is the 38-year-old group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is V H.'s Group.

Vilma, who is married and has seven school-aged children, owns and operates a clothing business that provides general clothing services to local community members. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. In 2009, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC, Vilma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando Rubí V., tiene la edad de 30 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres y hermanos. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Rolando también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rolando is 30 years old, single and lives with his parents and brothers. He is asking for this loan in order to maintain his fields, specifically for growing coffee. He wants to buy fertilizers. He wants to adequately maintain the coffee crop in order to produce a better quality and be able to get the best price come harvest time. This will be his first loan thorough FEDECOSUR and he is very grateful for their help. Rolando has been farming for a number of years. He hopes for a brighter future for his family, for a better quality of life, and to be able to continue to develop as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Barrio Alegre Group

texts.es:
Comité Barrio Alegre se denomina el grupo conformado en fecha 16 de julio del 2.008, gracias a que la actual Directora General Zulli González, se  contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para  informarse de como funciona el Comité de Mujeres   Emprendedoras, una vez enterada logró juntar  a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando con el Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras ya en el 5º ciclo. 
Todas las integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy contentas trabajando en forma conjunta y solidaria.
Cada una de las  señoras realiza diferentes actividades así como Doña Zulli quien elabora productos panificados para vender. Ella en su casa posee el horno a leña donde cocina sus productos como Galletas, Panes, tortas y otros.
La señora Zulli trabaja  con toda la familia para salir adelante, ella en su panadera y su marido quien se dedica a la albañilería en sus trabajo como jornalero, y de esta manera la pareja sale adelante dignamente.
El crédito solicitado fue para la compra de ingrediente para la elaboración de panificados como; harina de trigo de distintos tipos, levaduras, quesos, dulces, azúcar, leche y otros.
texts.en:
The Comité Barrio Alegre (Happy Neighborhood) group was formed on July 16, 2008 when the Managing Director, Zulli González, contacted the weekly meeting coordinator to get information about the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee for Enterprising Women). With the information at hand, she was able to find 17 women who are now working with the Committee for Enterprising Women program and they are now on their fifth loan cycle. The group members are very happy to work together in solidarity. Each of the ladies has a different type of business. Doña Zulli makes and sells baked goods, such as cookies, breads, cakes and other products. Doña Zulli and her husband, a mason, work together and aim to get ahead with dignity. The loan they are requesting is being used to buy ingredients to make baked goods such as flour, cheese, sweets, sugar, milk and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. is 44 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community.  Victoria has 1 year of experience in this business.  Victoria needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Victoria wishes to join the program to assist her business.  In 2010, Victoria joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Victoria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Ma. Dely

texts.en:
Ma. Dely A., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Sonny A., a driver/mechanic, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling frozen foods while also maintaining a cosmetics and underclothing direct selling line.

Ma. Dely has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 24,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will buy more quantities of the usual products in her current product inventory to replenish stocks and to maintain operations of her businesses.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She envisions herself to be God’s worker, and she hopes that, through her businesses, she can help as many people as she can.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying more quantities of the usual products in her current product inventory to replenish stocks and maintain operations of her businesses

loans.name: Modinatu

texts.en:
Modinatu is a hard working woman and she sells for long hours to support her home. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is happy in her business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is 32 years old, married with two children. Her children are doing well at school. Her husband also works to support their home.

Modinatu is requesting for a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bibikhol

texts.en:
K. Bibikhol’s passion lies with children. A married mother of two, Bibikhol opened her business selling clothes with the goal of providing a better standard of living for her family. For the past 13 years, Bibikhol has successfully operated her business at the market. With her profits, she has not only improved the standard of living for her children, but she has been able to support her elderly parents as well.
Bibikhol has requested a loan of 12,000 TJS to restock her clothing business. An optimistic businesswoman, Bibikhol plans to use the loan to continue developing her business and supporting her family.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
