Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To stock new clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana vive en casa propia con su esposo en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; en la puerta de su casa ella vende comida rápida a los chóferes y mecánicos que tienen sus talleres cerca, y  el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder dar comodidad a sus clientes comprando una mesa mas y algunas sillas además de comprar insumos y otros

Es cliente de Impro paga muy bien y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Emiliana lives in her own house with her husband. They live in the Tembladerani area in the city of La Paz. She sells fast food in the doorway to her house. She sells to drivers and mechanics who have shops nearby. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital. She wants to be able to make her customers more comfortable by purchasing another table and some chairs. She will also buy some supplies and other things. She is a client of Impro. She pays very well and is able to have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a table and chairs to make the customers who buy her fast food more comfortable

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, zinc, and sand to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “El Edén”, se encuentra ubicada en El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 8 socios, trabajan  con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desD. hace 2 años.
Juana tiene 28 años, conviviente, tiene 2 hijos asume el cargo D. presidenta, DesD. hace 4 años Juana se dedica a la venta D. comida en las afueras D. un cementerio, además ayuda a unos familiares a vender abarrotes en el mercado los fines D. semana, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria asume los gastos D. la educación D. sus hijos.
El gran anhelo D. Juana es construir su vivienda, el reciente préstamo lo utilizara en la compra D. materiales D. construcción. 
Todos los socios agradecemos el apoyo brindado y a la vez nos comprometemos a cumplir con el pago D. cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group “El Edén” (The Garden of Eden), is located in El Agustino, in Lima department. It is composed of 8 members, and they have worked with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERITY for the last 2 years. Juana, who is 28 years old, and lives with her partner, and has 2 children, is now president. For the last 4 years, Juana has sold meals outsiD. a cemetery, and in addition, she helps some family members selling groceries in the market on weekends. Through the efforts of her daily labor, she is able to assume the costs of her children's education. Juana's greatest wish is to construct her own house. This loan will be utilized to buy construction materials. All the members appreciate the help offered, and at the same time, commit themselves to comply with the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO BEGIN BUILDING HER HOUSE

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married man who has one young child. In 2007, he started his own business as a farmer with eight years of previous experience. He learned this occupation from his father who also works as a farmer. He owns a large piece of land where he cultivates multiple types of fruits and vegetables according to the season. He delivers the harvest to a big vegetable market in his town and to some small markets. He is thankful for his business income and he plans to make more profit by adding more cultivation. He is requesting $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a farming machine to renovate his soil and add more seeds to expand his production.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase farm machinery

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi I est constitué de dix femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne  43 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames à Ladjibougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Elles cultivent le riz, le petit mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne et le prêt précédent a été bien remboursé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU C. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1, 3 hectare de riz et de petit mil.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Les membres du groupe  espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA environ  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Benkadi I is made up of ten married women who are around 43 years old and have three children and live in polygamous families in Ladjibougou, a village in the Dioïla municipality, in the Koulikoro region, the second largest region in Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance association with the aim of better organising their businesses at the beginning of the crop wintering season. They cultivate rice, millet, peanuts and beans. They are on their second loan and successfully repaid their first. With the new loan OUMOU C. aims to purchase seeds and small tools as well as paying the labour costs to manage around 1 to 3 hectars of rice and millet. The crops are sold in Dioïla and Massigui to a customer base made up of men and women. They envisage generating a profit of around 35,000FCFA.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labour costs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Martha Marlene

texts.es:
Martha de 47 años, tiene un taller de sastrería en la parte delantera de su casa, con su esposo tienen 6 hijos y viven en el suburbio de Guayaquil. 

Cuando ella y su familia vinieron a vivir a Guayaquil para encontrar mas oportunidades, comenzaron a vender cangil (pop corn) porque no tenia suficientes ingresos para su familia. Ella inicio el taller de confección en la parte delantera de su casa. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. 

Para seguir con su taller de confección quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y hilos, en el futuro quiere comprar maquinas para que la producción de ropa aumente.
texts.en:
Martha is 47 years and lives in the Guayaquil suburbs. She has a tailor shop in the front part of her house. She and her husband have six children. When she and her family came to Guayaquil, to find more opportunities, they began selling popcorn because they didn't have enough income for the family. She started her shop in the front part of her home. Now she works from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM every day. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy fabric and thread. In the future she wants to buy some sewing machines so that her clothing production can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Busabaga Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Caroline B. belongs to Busabaga Development Group-Lugazi. She has run a tailoring business in Busabaga-Lugazi for four years now. Before that she sold snacks and she used the profits from that business to start her tailoring business. Caroline is married with four children. She earns about 100,000 shillings (UGX) per week. She will use this loan to buy more cloth material for her tailoring business.  Her dream is to build a house for her family and provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To buy cloth for tailoring.

loans.name: Si Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Si Bun K. is a villager in Si Sla village in Takeo province. She was born in 1969. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.

Her problem is that her field is infertile, far away from an irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve production, Mrs. Si Bun K. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

Her husband Mr. Kheng Khoem is an ice cream seller door-to-door and he owns an agric machine. Through those activities, they support three children. One daughter is a seamstress in a garment factory and two are students. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Marhabo and her husband can give to their three dear children. They are both very responsible parents and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married, and with the unconditional help of her husband she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their number of cattle. Marhabo and her family are waiting for your quick response. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia P. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 65 years old. Venancia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Venancia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and drinks  to local community members. Venancia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Venancia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Venancia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the second loan taken out by Venancia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old, married to Musa Cheruiyot, a farmer, who also contributes to the family's monthly income. Her husband also supports her in business and in the family's financial needs. They are blessed with nine children aged between 22 years and 11 years. 

Christine runs a grocery shop in Sacho Mosop trading centre near Kabarnet town and she had been in this business for two years now. Her business gives her a monthly profit of Kshs 3,000. 

Christine does not have a previous history in Microfinance borrowing. She joined KADET and she has currently borrowed her second loan of Kshs 10,000 after being able to repay her first loan successfully. She will use the money to buy more items for the grocery shop like bananas, tomatoes, kale, cabbages and others to restock her grocery.

Christine anticipates using her profits to open a retail shop where she will sell other perishable and/or fast-moving goods like soap, toothpaste, tissue and many more. She hopes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the grocery shop

loans.name: Arlito

texts.en:
Mr. Arlito C. is from the barangay (suburb) of Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old, married to Andressa C. and blessed with 1 child. Arlito is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store as well as a rice retailing business. He has been operating these businesses for 6 years and earns an monthly average of at least 3,500 PHP from them. 

In 2009, Arlito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Arlito has successfully repaid a loan of 40,000 PHP. He is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as his 4th loan, which will be used as additional capital for his existing businesses. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses to improve his family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs and in saving for future use, loan repayments, his child’s education and possible business expansions.


 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for his existing sari-sari store and rice retailing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plant Maintenance

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 34 years old, married, and has five children between 2 and 13 years old. Presently, three of her children attend school. Esperance sells goats and sheep, which she has done for nine years. Her husband sells palm oil.  

Esperance will use the loan to purchase more goats and sheep to sell. With the new profits from her growing business, Esperance hopes to buy more houses for commercial purposes. In the future, she would like to own a truck for animal transportation, which should increase the profitability of her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Las Nazarenas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Nelly forma parte del grupo “Las Nazarenas”, conformado desde hace 5 meses por 7 amigas-vecinas y fue conformado en sus inicios por la directora del colegio “El Nazareno” donde asisten sus hijos, Nelly tiene 29 años y vive en Huaycan, esta conviviendo y tiene tres hijos de 09, 03 y 02 años. Ella tiene seis meses trabajando con Edaprospo y fábrica Muebles en su mueblería llamado “Mueblería Nelly” desde hace dos años, su padre es carpintero y tiene una avanzada edad por lo que ella comenzó a encargarse del taller. Ella desea abrir su Stand de muebles en el futuro y para esto fue que se unió al grupo, mas también sabe que tendrá que ahorrar y pide a Edaprospo siga haciéndole habilitaciones para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nelly is a member of the group “Las Nazarenas” (The Nazarenes), which was formed five months ago and consists of seven friends and neighbors. It was founded by the director of the Nazarene School where their children attend.

Nelly is 29 years old and lives in Huaycan. She is in a common law marriage and has three children (ages 9, 3, and 2). She has been working with EDAPROSPO for six months and makes furniture from her store called “Mueblería Nelly” (Nelly’s Furniture Store) which she started two years ago. Her father is a carpenter who is elderly, so she has started to take charge of the workshop. She wants to open a furniture stand in the future, an idea she had when she joined the group. Nelly knows that she will have to save more money and request continued assistance from EDAPROSPO to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Unidas Somos Más (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas Somos Más está formado por un grupo de 7 señoras y un señor, quienes trabajan en el campo realizando diferentes actividades para obtener el sustento diario de sus hogares. Viven en la comunidad de Nonadel en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, respirando un aire de tranquilidad fuera del ruido de la ciudad. 

La Señora. Elsa S. es socia del banco comunal Unidas Somos Más, vive en la comunidad de Nonadel. Este es su primer crédito y fue  invitada por una vecina a formar parte del banco comunal. Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha el tiempo que pasa en su casa para criar animales como son pollos y borregos a los cuales los  vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También labora 3 días a la semana lavando y arreglando casas. 
Doña Elsa tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 11, 9 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de un mes de nacido, su primer hijo trabajar para sus gastos, su segunda y tercera hija pasan en la casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es mejorar su casa.

La Señora. Hilda B. es socia del banco comunal Unidas Somos Más, vive por la comunidad de Deleg. Tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Hilda se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidando de sus niños, también cría pollos, inicio este negocio con su primer crédito y ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y al igual que los créditos anteriores lo va a invertir en la compra mas pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Unidas Somos Más” [United We are More] communal bank is made up of a group of 7 women and one man. They work in the countryside in various business to earn a living for their households. 

They live in the community of Nonadel, where one can admire nature in all of its splendor, breathing an air of tranquility far from the noise of the city.

Elsa S. is a member of the “Unidas Somos Más” community bank. She lives in Nonadel. This is her first loan and she was invited to join the bank by a neighbor. She is a homemaker and she takes advantage of the time she spends at home to raise animals, such as chickens and goats, which she sells when she has economic need. She also works 3 days a week washing clothing and cleaning houses.

Elsa is 35 years old, married, and has 6 children who are 18, 16, 14, 11, and 9 years old, and one son who is one month old. Her first son works and pays his expenses. Her first and second daughters stay at home, and the last two children study in a school in the community. Her husband works as a mason and between the two of them they have managed to build their own house. She will use the loan to buy more chickens. Her goal is to improve her house.

Hilda B. is a member of the “Unidas Somos Más” communal bank. She lives in the community of Deleg. She is 26 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 10, 7, 5, and 3 years old. Her first three children study in a community school. They don’t have their own house, so they rent. Hilda is a homemaker and along with taking care of her children, she also raises chickens. She started this business with the first loan and it has been growing, bit by bit. This is the third loan she has taken through the communal bank. As with her previous loans, she will invest it in buying more chickens and chicken feed. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey P. is a 51 year-old villager in Samraong village, Takeo province. She is a pig breeder who earns money to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Ong, is a chef who also earns money to support his family. Although they work hard, they earn a small income. So to improve her income, Mrs. Srey P. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer, while the other one is a seamstress in garment factory, and the youngest one is attending local public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chory

texts.en:
Chory K. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.

K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of US $1.30 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend US $50 on food and US $5 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase a house for the children to live in. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. 

K.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a house for the children to live in

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo dependiente a su cargo. Actualmente, vive en el caserío Punto Nueve - Cruz de Chalpon, situado 10 minutes de la ciudad de Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida desde hace dos años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino y cuando éstos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Su negocio cuenta con competencia en la región pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus cerdos grandes y alimento de engorde y crecimiento para sus lechones. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternative un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Jose es  honesto y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, age 25, is married and has one dependent child under his care.  He lives in Punto Nueve – Cruz de Chalpon.  It is a rural community, which is situated ten minutes from the city of Lambayeque.

For two years he has earned a living selling small animals.  They are in pens in back of his house.  He generally raises pigs.  When they have reached a good level of development, he sells them to the merchants who always visit the area where he lives.  He learned this activity from his parents.  That is to say that he knows this line of work to perfection.  His business has competition in the region, but he also has ample merchandise to sell.

He wishes to use the loan to pay for balanced feed for his large pigs.  He also wants to buy food to fatten his piglets and to make them grow.

Therefore, he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Jose is honest and hard-working.  His greatest desire is to make sure that his family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed

loans.name: Hold Am Fine Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hold Am Fine” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Abu Bakarr K. is the leader of this group. The 34-year-old is married to a businesswoman.  They have 2 children who are not of school age. Abu Bakarr has been a businessman for 5 years now.  He sells groundnuts. With his share of this loan, he will buy groundnuts in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts in large quantity

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Patapo ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña y se caracteriza por ser una comunidad unida. Se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos y trabajos de costura. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años en casa propia. Aprendió esta actividad de familiar cercano, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida en su comunidad y en la parte urbana del distrito. Los productos que Irene expende son muy requeridos ya que ella brinda productos de primera calidad. La demanda para sus servicios y productos ha aumentado y necesita cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes. Por eso, desea usar su préstamo para comprar unos insumos. Con esta inversión, podrá cumplir los pedidos de sus clientes y por ende aumentar sus ingresos. También, desea usar una parte de su crédito para realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Irene es muy conocida en su zona y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su mayor anhelo es crecer su negocio y sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Irene, 43, is married and has a son. She lives in her own house in the rural zone of Pátapo District located in Chiclayo Province in northern Perú.  Her community is small and noted for being very united.  She makes weavings and sewn items.  She’s been doing this for the past five years at home.  She learned from a close relative, that is to say, she knows this occupation to perfection.  She has a well-established clientele in the community as well as in the urban part of the district.  The items Irene produces are highly sought after because she makes items of the best quality.  Demand for her services and products has increased and she needs to fill pending customer orders.  To do so, she needs to buy supplies.

This investment will make it possible for her to fill all her customer orders and thus increase income.  She also wants to use part of the loan to do some home repairs because her house is in a deteriorated condition.  To reach her goals she has thought it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.  Irene is very well known in her area and has good personal and work references.  Her greatest wish is to grow in business and income to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy thermoses for coffee and supplies

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro tiene una pulpería. Tiene más de 16 años de tener este negocio, ella tiene su negocio en su vivienda. Ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable por lo que se siente muy agradecida al tener un trabajo que le genere ingresos. Inicio con muy pocos productos pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan una gran variedad, Vicenta solicita este crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, leche, huevos, sopas, enlatados y detergentes.
texts.en: Vicenta del Socorro has a grocery store. She has had her business for more than 16 years. She has her business in her house. She has demonstrated to be a very responsible person and she feels very thankful to have a business that generates an income. She started out with very few products and her clients always request a wide variety of products. Vicenta requests a loan to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, milk, eggs, soups, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, breads, milk, eggs, soups, canned goods, and detergents.

loans.name: Kamoliddin

texts.ru: Камолиддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством, а также у него имеется виноградник. В основном он выращивает виноград и овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и саженцев.
texts.en: Kamoliddin lives in Yavan. Hi is 41 years old and married. He has a secondary education. He is a farmer, and he also has a vineyard. Basically he grows grapes and vegetables. He has been doing this work for twenty years. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Elias Jose

texts.es:
Elías, es originario de Nueva Guinea un pueblo ubicado en la región del Atlántico sur del país  ahí vivió durante 10 años, posteriormente sus padres se mudaron a la ciudad de Leon que es donde vive actualmente, el tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, el se dedica a vender ropa, es comerciante, lleva tres años en este negocio. 
El señor Elías inicio su negocio hacer tres años, el comercializa mercadería en general, específicamente ropa de varón tales como pantalones, camisas, shorts. Su primera experiencia en los negocios fue a los 15 años de edad, ya que sus padres son comerciantes   también en el mercado de La Estación de Buses  en León, con muchos esfuerzos y sacrificios instalo su propio negocio, se independizo de  la tienda de sus padres. 
El solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería en general como pantalones, camisas de mujer, camisetas. El espera que con esta inversión, le brinde la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. En un futuro le gustaría tener suficientes ahorrors para poder construir su propia casa, realizar mejoras a su local, poder poner piso de cerámica, hacerles paredes para dar una mejor presentación a su local de venta.
texts.en:
Elias, is from Nueva Guinea, a town in the South Atlantic region of the country.  He lived there for 10 years, after his parents moved to the city of Leon which is where he now lives.  Elias is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children that are 10 and 2 years old respectively.  He is a merchant who sells clothes and has spent three years in this business.

Elias sells general merchandise, specifically male clothing such as pants, shirts, shorts. His first business experience was at 15 years old, because his parents are also traders in the market at the Bus Station in Leon.  With much effort and sacrifice he installed his own business and became independent from his parents' shop.

The requested loan is to buy general merchandise such as pants, women's shirts, and t-shirts. He hopes that with this investment, he will be given the opportunity to improve business conditions. In the future he would like to save enough to build his own home, and make improvements to the premises, such as putting down a ceramic floor and a wall to give a better presentation of his local shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as pants, women's shirts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Marlon Vicente

texts.en:
Marlon is 20 years old, single, has no children, and lives with his parents near the city of San Gabriel in northern Ecuador. He is a calm person who does not neglect his parents and enjoys working and having friends.

Working in agriculture, Marlon grows potatoes, carrots, and onions on land his father helped provide him with. He is now requesting his first loan, with which he will purchase sacks for his harvested onions. Marlon hopes this loan will help him continue working, supporting his family, and improving the quality of their lives. In the future, he would like to support himself and be able to afford a motorbike to get around his fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks for his onion harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She has a lumberyard business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sugarcane farming. Ma. Fe is requesting to borrow 20,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase a chainsaw to be used in her lumberyard business.
Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she is able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a chainsaw to be used in her business.

loans.name: Abena Matilda

texts.en: The picture above shows some pastries that Abena had baked. She is a baker at Elmina. She is a single parent, taking care of 2 children. She has been in the baking business for 10 years. She sees to the well-being of the home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for baking items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a snack bar.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for baking items to sell.

loans.name: Letty Diana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia La Sequita que  pertenece al cantón Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro y por los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla que son apreciados dentro y fuera del país.

En este jugar conocimos a la señora Letty, ella tiene 42 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación ha tenido cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos están solteros y aun viven con ella, con nuestra amiga también vive una pequeña nieta de dos años la misma que la tiene desde que nació y es una hija mas para ella y su ilusión de vivir. Su esposo es albañil.

Para colaborar con los gastos del hogar ella se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones así como también a la cría de pollos para lo cual  tiene una pequeña granja, trabaja todos los días en el cuidado y alimentación de sus pollos mientras que sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta por las tardes y los fines de semana, ella deja a crédito las sabanas y cobra todos los sábados. Compra las sabanas en Picoaza, en cuanto a los pollos los compra en una incubadora y después de tres meses los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los mercados de Manta y Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar sabanas y alimento para los pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace seis años y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos.
  
Su sueño es terminar de arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora communal bank meets in the parish of La Sequita, which belongs to the canton of Montecristi. This prosperous canton of Manabi province is known as the birthplace of the historic fighter Eloy Alfaro and also known for the famous hats woven from paja toquilla fiber ["Panama" hats] which are prized within the country and abroad.

In this place, we meet Letty, who is 42 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has had four children, all of them now grown. Two of the children are single and still live with her. A small granddaughter, two years old, also lives with Letty. The girl has been with her since she was born, and she is like another daughter to Letty and the joy of her life. Her husband is a mason. 

To contribute to the household expenses, Letty works selling sheets and comforters, and she also raises chickens, for which purpose she has a small farmyard. She works every day feeding and caring for her chickens, and in her sales business she goes door to door during the evenings and weekends. She sells the sheets on credit and collects payments every Saturday. She buys the sheets in Picoaza, and in the case of the chickens, she buys them from an incubator, and after three months she sells them to dealers who come to her house to take them to the markets of Manta and Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to buy sheets as well as feed for her chickens. She has been in the communal bank for six years, and she likes it because of the help given to her through the loans.
  
Her dream is to finish fixing up her house.

loans.use: to buy sheets to sell as well as feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Sara Pastoriza

texts.es:
Sara Pastoriza tiene 57 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo e hijos de 38, 36, 33,30, 26, 24, 22 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C PATRON SAN JUAN , se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad San Juan, sector Llullundondo, parroquia Guanujo, a una distancia de 25 minutos  perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Sara Pastoriza se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene casa propia, 2 cuadras de terreno, siembra papas, maíz trigo, además cría otras especies de animales como cerdos, ovejas pollos y cuyes. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda

Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos, semillas y para sembrar papas. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. Su sueño es ampliar su producción, tener una vida tranquila con salud y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta las festividades del carnaval y del patrón San Juan, realizar actividades como pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Sara Pastoriza, 57, is married and lives with her husband and their children aged 38, 36, 33,30 26, 24, and 22 in Guaranda canton in Bolivar province.


The members of the rural communal bank "Patron San Juan" live in the community of San Juan de Llullundondo in Guanujo parish, 25 minutes from Guaranda.  The members of this communal bank work in agriculture and animal husbandry.

Sara Pastoriza farms and raises livestock.  She has her own house and 3 hectares of land where she cultivates potatoes, corn and wheat.  In addition she raises animals such as pigs, sheep, chickens and guinea pigs.  She buys and sells her products in the city of Guaranda.

She requests a loan to buy manure and seeds to plant potatoes.  The loan will help her by enabling her to purchase all of the supplies she needs for her agricultural activities.  She encounters challenges such as the rise and fall of the prices of the products she sells, as well as the abrupt climate changes we are experiencing.  Her dream is to increase her production and to have a tranquil and healthy life in which her children can get ahead. 

She enjoys the carnival and the patron saint San Juan festivities, and doing things like going on walks with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is an expert in embroidery work. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes. Mainly, she works for her neighboring clients and earns income for her family. She is a mother of two children. Both of them are young and studying in a nearby school. 

Her husband is also an embroidery expert. He has been operating his business for the past seven years and it is going well for him. He crafts beautiful embroidery designs on clothes, which helps attract more customers. He is very knowledgeable in his work and keeps himself updated about the latest designs and fashion. 

The wedding season is about to arrive and her husband needs money to buy a quantity of embroidery material in bulk. This will help him fulfill the demands of his customers and increase his profits. Therefore, Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. She is very confident that her husband will use the loan in a positive way and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (pictured here) is a construction worker. His wife, Sambo is a garment worker. They live in a village along National Road Number Three, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have four sons and one daughter.  

Sophan is asking for another loan of $300 to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia nació en la provincia de Paucartambo en la ciudad de Pilcopata y tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos. 

Actualmente, Julia vive en la ciudad de Huancarani y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de comida pero por el momento está trabajando en la municipalidad en el vivero forestal. En esta oportunidad Julia requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, verduras, arroz, aceite y otras cosas más.

El Banco Comunal “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” se reúne cada treinta en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Julia was born in the province of Paucartambo in the city of Pilcopata. She is 42 years old, married and has two children.

At present, Julia lives in the city of Huancarani, where she does her economic activity. She sells food but at the moment she is working in a forest nursery. At this time, Julia needs the loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, rice, oil and more.

The “Once de Mayo - Huancarani” [May 11th- Huancarani] communal bank meets every month in the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo, departament of Cuzco (Peru). Cuzco is known for being a tourist and commercial and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because Machu Picchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, is there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a business man, aged 25. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, he has been managing a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He has employed one person in his business. Previously, he used to farm and to work as a contractor, as a casual worker. In the next 5 years, he wants to buy a van for his transport business. John is requesting for a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to service his motorbike.

loans.use: to service his motorbike.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is married with one child. Jimmy is 31 years of age and he lives in Pulang Yuta, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte.

Jimmy sells coconuts to earn a living, and he has had this business for six years. Each month, he earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type  of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. 

Jimmy has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Jimmy hope to improve and expand his small business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en: Crispina is 37 years old and a married woman with three children between 2 and 14 years old. Crispina sells ready-to-wear clothes to the people in her community. She sells items like shirts and under garments. Crispina earns 7,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts, socks and jeans. Crispina hopes for her business to prosper. She also hopes for her children to finish college and for her family to be healthy always.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts, socks and jeans

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena, the mother of three children, is married to a farmer.  Moving from one place to another in Elmina, Abena has been selling cooked food for 10 years, using her income to assist her spouse in taking care of their children. Abena will use the loan to purchase more food items to cook and sell. With the new profits arising from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase food items to cook and sell.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
FATOUMATA HABITE AU SUD DU SENEGAL , EGEE DE 40 ANS , ELLE A 3 ANFENTS QUI SONT TOUS A L'ECOLE PRIVEE .UN , ETUDIE AU SOS , ET LES 2 AU COLLEGE SACRE-COEUR D'OU L'AINEE FAIT LA 6em SECONDE .
FATOUMATA AVEC SON COMMERCE ASSURE LA NOURRITURE DE SA FAMILLE ET FRAIS DE SCOLARISATION DES ENFANTS QUI SONT DANS LE PRIVE
FATOUMATA ACHATE DES TISSUS MALIEN THIOUB AUPRSE DE SA COPINE COMMERCANTE ENTRE MALI SENEGAL POUR LES REVENDRE ET PLACER AUPRES DES AUTRES JUSQU'A LA FIN DU MOIS ET AVOIR UN BENEFICE.
DANS LES PROCHAINES ANNEES , FATOUMATA VOUDRAIT DEVELOPPER SON ACTIVITE DEVENIR UNE GRANDE COMMERCANTE , VOYAGER VERS DOUBAIS , MAROC POUR LES ACHATS COMME SON AMIE.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, lives in the south of Senegal, is 40 years old, and has three children who are all in private school.  One studies at SOS and two at the College of the Sacred Heart in their second and sixth year.
Fatoumata pays for the children's private school and food for her family with her small business.
Fatoumata purchases fabrics and her friend trades between Mali and Senegal, reselling and replacing them until the end of the month when she has a profit.
In the coming years, Fatoumata would like to develop her business and become a big-time trader, traveling to Dubai and Morocco to buy her wares like her friend.

loans.use: Buy Fabric

loans.name: Ruwa Kumari

texts.en: Ruwa is a resident of Thikedewal. She and her husband, Mr. Lal Bahadur, are engaged in selling green vegetables. They buy the vegetables from Kalimati market and sell them daily in the local market in the morning and evening. They fulfill all the requirements of their family with the income from selling vegetables. Ruwa and her husband have three children: two daughters and one son. Their daughters are studying in grades 7 and 6 and their son is studying in grade 2.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business

loans.name: Tumenjargal

texts.en: Tumenjargal is 55 years old and married.  She lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia.  She started her food cart business in 2000. Her husband helps with her business. She has many regular customers. During the winter, the meat prices will increase as usual so Tumenjargal is requesting a loan for 400,000 MNT, which she will use to buy meat now.  By doing so, she believes that she will not lose her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Arcesio De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Arcesio a sus 46 años de edad es padre de dos hijos de 15 y 16 años de edad, debido a dificultades de salud tuvo que ser operado y se vio obligado a dejar su trabajo como vendedor de frutas, debido a los impedimentos de salud con los cuales quedo el señor Arcesio después de la cirugía, tuvo la necesidad de iniciar en el año 2009 su propio negocio con el cual pudiera generar los ingresos para su familia. Actualmente, el señor Arcesio tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, para la cual requiere de la compra de surtido tal como productos de la canasta familiar, gaseosas y snacks, con lo cual pueda ofrecer mejores productos y así mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos, lo que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: At 46 years old Señor Arcesio is a father of two children ages 15 and 16.  Because of health problems he had to have surgery and had to leave his work as a fruit seller.  Because of his health issues after surgery, he had to start his own business in 2009 so that he could generate an income for his family.  Currently, Señor Arcesio has a small store in his house which he needs to stock. He will purchase basic family grocery products, soft drinks and snacks.  This will allow him to offer better products and increase his sales and income, improve his quality of life and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: stock his store with basic family grocery products, soft drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru: Орзигул разведенная. У нее двое детей. Она любящая мать своих детей. Она старательная и трудолюбивая женщина. Для содержания своих детей в хороших условиях она начала заниматься купле- продажей детской одежды и обуви. Она любит свой бизнес и ей приятно видит улыбку на лице детей, когда они уходят довольными. Орзигул запрашивает займ для покупки новых зимней одежды для пополнения оборотного капитала. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Orzigul is divorced. She is a loving mother of two children. She is a diligent and hard-working woman. In order to provide good living conditions for her children, Orzigul started selling children's clothing and footwear. She loves her business and is pleased to see a smile on children's faces when they leave her store happy. Orzigul is requesting a loan in order to purchase new winter clothing and to increase her working capital. She is hoping for your help and thanks you in advance for your kindness and assistance.

loans.use: to buy children's winter clothing for her store

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Elda tiene 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación, además de ser alegre y sociable. Está casada con José quien es topógrafo de profesión. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de sus tres hijos. La actividad que realiza Elda es la de comerciante, en la compra y venta de frutas y alimentos al por mayor, como plátanos, granos y gallinas en los puertos y en los mercados de su localidad. Lleva realizando éste negocio desde hace 5 años, pagando a estibadores ocasionales para la carga de los productos.
Le agrada su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien y está acostumbrada a levantarse desde temprano para realizar sus compras. Con las ganancias puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y darse algunos gustos. Ahora viendo las ganancias que le deja, tiene planes de invertir en otro negocio como una bodega en su casa en donde le ayudaría a atender sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP, esta contenta de contar con un poyo financiero para alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería pero en mayor cantidad para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elda is 47 years old. She is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to get ahead, as well as to be happy and friendly. She is married to José, who is a topographer. They live together in their own house with their three children. Elda works as a salesperson in the buying and selling of fruit and wholesale foods, like plantains, grains, and chickens, both door-to-door and in the markets in her area. She has been doing this job for five years, sometimes paying stevedores for the shipping of her products.

She appreciates her business because she knows it well and is used to getting up early to make her purchases. With the earnings she can help her husband with household expenses and give him some things he likes. Right now, seeing the money she is making, she has plans to invest in another business, a small shop in her house where her grown children would help her. 

This will be her first loan with the MFP institution. She is happy to have this financial support to be able to achieve her goals. With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles, she will buy wholesale merchandise so that she can get better profits.

loans.use: to buy fruit, grains, and chickens wholesale.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Eman is working in hand with her husband at their grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase more goods needed for the store.

Eman is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the grocery store

loans.name: Sophan's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sophan is 30 years old and married. She has three children. The primary sources of her family’s income are growing cassava. To better support the family, she also sells grocery items. She has been in this business for 12 years. 
Sophan has been a member of VisionFund for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees in harvesting her cassava. She hopes to make more income so as to better off her living’s condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees in harvesting her cassava

loans.name: Irshad Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a 42-years-old married woman, living in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is into a business of refreshment selling in the area near by his house and he has been into this business from 4 years now before he use work as a waiter than he started his own cart of selling refreshment so to earn profits to run his family
Her husband's stall has a better earning and several customers who are regular customers and sometime also takes orders from  people for take away. This business yields a good income for her husband, but his family's needs are increasing day by day and he needs more money to afford household expenses. Now, he wants to buy more raw materials for the making of the items for his business. This is why his wife Irshad,  applied BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan, so that her husband could buy raw materials for his business.
She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for his family.
Irshad thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan for this  support cycle.

loans.use: To buy gool gapa raw material for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase recycled wood for construction

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married and has 6 children. In 1996 he started a small buisness: a general store which she started with just a small variety of products. With dedication and support from her daughter little-by-little it grew into one of the most popular stores in her area. Martha is an example of the daily fight and strength. She is an admirable woman who despite the adversities she's had to overcome continues in the battle.

Now Martha needs a loan for $USD750 to grow her business and purchase a wider variety of goods. Only with your collaboration will this be possible. Don't doubt anymore, remember she needs you.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Martha es casada y tiene 6 hijos, ella en 1996 inició un pequeño negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, comenzando con muy poco surtido, pero con la dedicación y apoyo su hija poco apoco logró ir creciendo y ahora es de las tiendas con mayor popularidad de su localidad. Martha es un ejemplo de lucha y esfuerzo diario, es una mujer admirable, que a pesar de las adversidades que ha tenido que vencer sigue en la batalla.

En este momento ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 750 DLLS pues quiere hacer crecer aun más su negocio, comprando un mayor volumen de mercancía. Sólo con tu colaboración esto será posible, no lo dudes más, recuerda que ella te necesita.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.en:
Maria is a very nice person who lives in the western part of the city where she has a small store. "Please help me keep my store well stocked. I want to have a good convenience store and for my business to prosper. I need a loan of $1,200 to make my dream come true."

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña "Maria" es una persona muy linda ella habita en el poniente de la ciudad y ahí mismo tiene su tiendita. "Por favor necesito que me ayuden a surtir mi tiendita quisiera que mi negocio prosperara y llegar a tener una muy buena tienda de abarrotes para esto se requiere unas cantidad de $1,200.00 dlls y así cumplir mi sueño.

loans.use: Purchase canned goods and other convenience store items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more bags of dried maize for milling

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu B. is thirty-three years and is married with children.  Her husband is a local contractor but his income is not steady.  To make ends meet, Umu runs a fish business in the market of Kabala, Sierra Leone.  With her previous loans from SMT, she expanded her business by purchasing fish from big suppliers – the fisheries - and selling them to smaller fishmongers at wholesale prices.  Umu is not able to meet the demand of her customers due to lack of capital.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $275.  Umu uses her income to assist her parents and provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to increase wholesale supplies for distribution

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang C. E., age 35, is a farmer. Her husband buys and sells recyclable products, earning about $4.80 per day. They have three children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to increase the inventory of recyclable items her husband can sell and to buy an additional piece of farmland to increase her crop output. She believes both these actions will lead to an increase in revenue and income to support the family and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase farmland, plus recyclable materials to resell

loans.name: Hurshedgon

texts.ru:
Hurshedgon A., 22, owns and drives a taxi in Kurgan-Tube. At present, his car runs on gas, but, with gas prices rising every month, Hurshedgon plans to use this loan to convert his car to run on natural gas. The villagers of Kurgan-Tube would benefit from lower taxi fares. Hurshedgon plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахроров Хуршеджон, возраст – 22 года, образование среднее. Хуршеджон имеет собственный автомобиль и занимается оказанием услуг такси для населения города Курган-Тюбе. В настоящее время он работает на бензине, так как цены на бензин ежемесячно растут, что повышает стоимость проезда и бьёт по карману граждан, на полученный кредит он хочет приобрести газовое оборудование и установить его на автомашину с соблюдением всех условий безопасности по его эксплуатации. Установка газового оборудования намного снизит стоимость проезда, так как этот вид топлива намного дешевле и цены на него увеличиваются не так быстро, как на бензин. Так как в городе почти что отстутсвует транспортное сообщение между микрорайонами, это даст возможность местным жителям добираться в любую точку города по приемлемым ценам и не будет загрязнять экологию города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
Exilda is a member of Banco Comunal "Santa Ana", which is located in the province and district of Moyabamba, San Martin department. She sells goods, fruits and vegetables. Her stand is located in a kiosk which she has in front of her house.

The loan of $675, which she plans on repaying within 6 months will help in the purchase of rice, bags of sugar, gallons of different brands of oils, toilet paper in bulk, canned fish, soaps and boxes of soap, sodas in small packages, and wide varieties of fruits and vegetables so that her clients can find everything they need.

She is 61 years old, she is married and has 6 self-supporting children. She considers herself independent enough to be able to make decisions and manage her business. Because of her charisma, she is able to get the attention of many clients. She treats them with the respect they deserve and is able to offer many things in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Translator.

La señora Exilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Ana“, ubicado en la provincia y distrito de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, frutas y verduras, su local está instalado en un kiosco acondicionado en el frontis de su propia casa. El préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en sacos, aceite en litros de diferentes marcas, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado en latas, jaboncillos y jabones en cajas, refrescos en cajitas pequeñas, frutas y verduras diversas en kilos para así tener bien surtido el negocio y los clientes encuentren lo que necesiten. Tiene 61 años de edad, es casada con 6 hijos, todos independientes. Se considera independiente para decidir y manejar su negocio. Por su carisma atrae a sus clientes, además de atenderlas con cordialidad y de tener un negocio surtido.

loans.use: Purchase of goods ( rice, sugar, oil, etc.) Purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta P. T. runs a general store in the city of Jaunjiucillio, San Martin.  She started the store ten years ago after spending the majority of her life selling goods at the main market in downtown Juanjiu.  Enriqueta was tired of traveling and working for minimal wages.  Her store has grown annually and she has many loyal customers.  She provides daily, weekly, and monthly credit to trusted clients.  The people of Jaunjuicillio are also happy to use Enriqueta’s store instead of making the long trip to the main market.

Enriqueta is 62 years old, married, and has six children.  She is happy with her business, the independence she’s gained, and all of the friends she has made.  She is happy to serve her community and help her family.  Education is important and she is looking forward to helping fund her grand children’s University bills.

A member of the community bank Eden Celestial, Enriqueta is requesting a loan of $1,025 to repay over 6 months.  With the loan she would like to restock and add new products like underwear, and school uniforms.  The children of Juanjuicillo return to school soon.

loans.use: To restock and add new products like underwear and school uniforms.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi L., 55 years old, is living with her husband and 4 children in Hung Nguyen, Nghe An. Her husband is a farmer. Her 4 children are all grown-up. Besides working on the rice field, her main activity is to breed pigs and chickens. Her fund came from family savings and borrowed money from TYM Fund. Her money to repay weekly comes from selling stuff in the market and from her children. Her family current income is 300 USD/ month. This time, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy chickens, pigs and food for them. Mrs. L. is the 7th member of the TYM Fund.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Liễu, 55 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Chồng chị là một nông dân. 4 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Ngoài làm ruộng, công việc chính của chị Liễu là chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Nguồn vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi được lấy từ bản thân gia đình và vay từ Quỹ Tình thương. Số tiền trả tuần của chị Liễu được lấy từ tiền chạy chợ của chị và các con đi làm hỗ trợ. Thu nhập hiện tại của cả gia đình là 300USD/tháng. Vòng vốn này chị Liễu xin vay 950USD để mua gà, lợn và thức ăn gia súc. Chị Liễu là thành viên năm thứ 7 của Quỹ Tình thương.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens and food for them

loans.name: Evarida

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Evarida T.. She is single, and has no children. In 2006, Evarida established her call center business. Evarida requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of phone credit vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of leasing and leaseback microfinance, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional phone credit vouchers in bulk.

loans.name: Fikreta

texts.en:
Fikreta was born in 1964 and she is married. Her husband is a seasonal worker and re-sells plastics. His monthly income is 700.00KM. In the period when her husband is not employed, they work together at the market and sell clothes. Fikreta's husband is a demobilized soldier and gets additional income in the amount of 150.00KM.

Fikreta wants to use this loan in the amount of 1200.00KM for buying clothes in order to expand her existing business.

loans.use: For buying clothes.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is a 30-year-old woman. She is a wife and the mother of 4 children who attend school. She is a serious-minded businesswoman who works hard to support her husband and provide for her family. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc to increase her stock of goods available for sale. Mary belongs to the community group called Ezekiel Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Try M., age 28, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh. To supplement the household income, she works as a seamstress transporting small piece of clothes from the factory and make them in order and sell for a profit.  On average, she makes $1 per day. Her husband Mr. Van Nean, 27, is a construction foreman since 2001. He works from place to place and earn $6 each day. One of their children is a student, and the rest are too young to attend the school.
He is requesting a loan to help purchase more construction tools. This will make his work easier. The leftover would be used to buy wood to repair the leaking roof.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools for her husband to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of gasoline to retail in her community.

loans.name: Mamadjon

texts.en:
Mamadjon R. is 41 years old and the father of two adorable children. His wife is a housekeeper. Mamadjon provides transportation services, a business he has been involved in for 20 years, within the cities of Khujand-Gafurov. With his savings he was able to purchase his own minivan, and the business is stable, providing the main source of income for his family. 

Mamadjon plans to fix his van in order to provide higher quality services in the future, so he is requesting a loan of $400 for a four month term to purchase new tires. This will be Mamadjon’s first loan and he would like to thank all for their support and promises to be prompt in his loan repayment. He is counting on your help.

loans.use: To purchase tires for the minivan

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Horm K. is 50 years old and has a business selling vegetables in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works collecting the crops from a small farm, and then sells them at the market to earn an approximately US$5.30 each day. Her husband works as a farmer and makes less than one dollar per day. Actually, he farms just enough for the family members but cannot make a profit. Farming is hard, and sometimes if there is no rain he will face crop damage. This couple has four children, two of whom are students and two others who are employed as garment workers. Horm would like to borrow US$700 from Kiva to rent the banana farm to raise fruit to sell. She has no plan for a future business, but she said she will try hard for her children to get a higher education in order to get good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To rent a banana farm to raise fruit to sell

loans.name: Boltaboy

texts.en:
Boltaboy is a 54-year-old man who dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on two vehicles for his public transport business; he drives the taxi, and he rents the microbus. Boltaboy has about two years of experience in the public transportation business. The competition is rather great in this business because there are so many people who need transportation.

Boltaboy requests a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) so that he can purchase the spare parts for his microbus. He needs to maintain his vehicle because it is essential for his business. He has a wife and three children, two of whom still depend on him for support. Boltaboy is counting on your help so he can continue to prosper.

loans.use: Purchase  spare parts to repair his microbus

loans.name: Che Comfort

texts.en:
Che Comfort B. is married with five children. She lives in Ntassen, just outside of Bamenda, Cameroon.  With this loan, Comfort plans to invest in her grocery store. Specifically, she will purchase rice, books, oil, soap, beer and other drinks.  
 
This is Comfort's second loan, She has been a member of GHAPE since 2007. She has a great deal of experience in her grocery store business. In fact, she manages the store alone. Over the years, her customers have become regular as they build a trusting relationship. She also feels that she has an excellent site for her business. 
 
The profit from this loan will be used to pay her children's school fees. She will also invest much of her profit back into her business. The rest will be used to clothe her children well, provide medical assistance to her family, and feed her family.  
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: 2 bags of rice, books, 5 tins of oil, 2 cartons of soap, beer and other drinks

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin tiene 29 años, es natural de la ciudad de Ayacucho, vive en Puno hace 5 años, convive con su pareja, la cual es enfermera. El es un joven muy trabajador que migró desde la alejada ciudad de Ayacucho en busca en un mejor porvenir, es así que desde hace 8 meses, gracias al arduo trabajo en otros oficios, logró ahorrar un dinerito para poner su stand de venta de celulares. El negocio va viento en popa, ya que cada vez se hace más conocido, obteniendo mayor clientela, además que el buen trato que Franklin da a sus clientes logra que el negocio crezca más y más. Se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de celulares para aumentar sus ingresos y así tener un futuro prospero, para estabilizar a su familia.
texts.en:
Franklin is 29 years old and is originally from the city of Ayacucho. He has lived in Puno for five years now, along with his partner who is a nurse. He is a hard-working young man, who migrated from the distant city of Ayacucho in search of better work prospects. For eight months now, thanks to hard work in other areas, he managed to save enough money to open a cell phone sales stand. The business is going well as he becomes more well-known and expands his customer base. Also, because he provides such care and good customer service, his enterprise is growing more and more. He finds himself in his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the funds requested, he will purchase additional cell phones to increase his income and have a better future and stability for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cell phones that he sells.

loans.name: Centarl B2- Babra Group

texts.en:
Babra N. runs a restaurant in Kabalagala, a city suburb. She has three years' experience in preparing local dishes like luwombo, matooke, groundnut sauce, smoked fish and beef among others. When she sells food worth 80,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$40) she gets a profit of approximately 30,000. Babra will use the loan proceeds to purchase rice, flour and cooking oil.

Babra underwent a catering course in Kampala after which her husband raised some capital for her to set up the restaurant. She is a mother of three and also looks after her late sister’s daughter. Her husband is a supplier of green bananas to market vendors. Her ambition is to venture into selling secondhand shoes imported from abroad. She also desires to send all her children to boarding schools.

Babra will share this loan with the other three members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase rice, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda H. is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. Mavlyuda's lack of a stable job and the low productivity of her husband's business didn't leave enough money to pay the expenses of the home and of her little daughter. This was the reason why Mavlyuda decided to start her own business 10 years ago, selling fabrics for traditional dresses. Little by little she has made her business grow, and by offering her clients the chance to pay in installments, her orders are getting bigger.

Now her business is running normally. However, she would like to continue bettering herself and her business. She is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni that she will pay back in 10 months. With this money, Mavlyuda will be able to buy seasonal fabrics for national dresses. The power to help her business grow is in your hands.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics to  increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana G. is a single parent and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Diana sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, in Elmina.
