She has been doing this business since February of this year. Diana uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Diana will use the loan to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana plans to reinvest and expand her trade in processed fish.

loans.use: Diana will use the loan to purchase increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia’s current family situation is happy despite their struggle to uplift their poor living situation. She wants to avail a loan amounting of PHP5,000 for her hog-raising business to assist her husband in earning for their livelihood so they will able to send her youngest son to college and support their financial household needs. Leticia is hoping that someday despite their poor living condition they will become successful with their sacrifices in sending their child to college. 

Leticia is already 50 years old, her husband is Willie and they are presently residing at Nabbotuan, Solana Cagayan. Blessed with three children, the eldest is Leila, 28 years old, college graduate, the second is Laarni, 26 years old, undergraduate in college and the third is  Wyndel, 15 years old, a junior high school student. She hopes to improve her hog raising into a bigger type of piggery someday so that aside from sustaining her child’s allowances to school, Leticia will also be able to support their farming needs and other necessities.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Nusrat Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Nusrat baji is the wife of M. and they have lived in a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past ten years. Vehari city is famous for its shrines. She is the mother of three daughters. Her eldest daughter helps her in a clothes-making business. The others are receiving education from a local school. Nusrat baji’s husband works in agriculture. He sells fertilizer and seeds to the other farmers and sometimes takes care of their lands and charge fees. Nusrat baji is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her husband's business.

She is the group leader and there are two others in her group: Razia baji requests a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen baji requests a loan to buy plastic beads for making plastic bottle caps and shopping bags.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for reselling

loans.name: Gladis

texts.en:
Gladis owns and operates a hair salon, where she offers cuts, colors, perms and a variety of other beauty services. She has had her salon for five years now. She works alone, 7 days a week, from 7 am to 7 pm. Gladis’s goal for the future is to improve and expand her hair salon by moving into a new, larger space and buying new furniture. Gladis is 37-years old and lives with her partner and their three children who are 20-, 12- and 5-years old.

Though the hair salon is her primary source of income, Gladis has a side business buying and selling jora (white corn that is dried, soaked in large earthenware pots until germination, then boiled). She buys the jora from local producers in the town of San Jeronimo and sells it to people who make their own chicha, a traditional Andean corn beer.

Gladis plans to use her Kiva loan to buy jora. Each sack contains 182 kilos of corn, and costs 300 soles. She plans to buy a total of six sacks with her loan of 1800 soles, and estimates that she will make about 550 soles in profit after selling all of the jora.

Gladis is a member of the Las Triunfadoras" (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes.

loans.use: To buy corn for making chicha

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en:
Upendo has owned a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 5 years. She belongs to the Dodoma road TRM loan group (group code 2023). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 13 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add her current stock to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Upendo is 27 years old, married, and has a 9-month-old child. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is 32 and single with no children. She lives with her family in Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper.

She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise business income to include the sale of cereals in bags to her customers. Yaa has employed workers who assist her in her local food joint. She has been in business for three years now. She belongs to the village bank called "Promise."

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: María Asunción

texts.en:
Maria is married to a painter, with whom she has two school-aged children. She has been a dressmaker for over six years, and is currently working on a project making school uniforms for neighborhood families. She can make about four sweaters a day. Additionally, she just started a small grocery store that she is starting to stock bit by bit. 

This is her first loan with Fundación Paraguaya, so she is only taking out a small amount to get started. She hopes to be able to later take out larger loans in order to stock her small grocery store. In the future she would also like to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy yarn to make sweaters

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Ms Happy M. is a poultry farmer with over 1000 chickens. She has been in the business of rearing chickens for over three years. She will use her loan to purchase more chicks, chicken feed, chicken medicines, etc., to improve her business. Happy has one child who is at school. With her poultry business, she is managing to look after her family successfully. Her future hope is to work hard and invest for her family, especially her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, chicken feed, chicken medicines, etc.

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en:
T. Phạm Thị H. (20211030049) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 08 (8).


T. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, T. operates a family member's furniture making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling bedroom furniture to local businesses and community members.  T. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 3.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. is requesting her first loan from SEDA.  She is requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by T. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030050) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business selling agricultural equipment.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211030051) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


3.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20211030052) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


4.  Trần Thị K. (20211030053) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20211030054) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Phạm Thị H. (20211030049) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 08 (8).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị trong phòng ngủ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20211030050) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán thiết bị nông nghiệp.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211030051) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nghiêm Thị D. (20211030052) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  Trần Thị K. (20211030053) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


5.  Nguyễn Thị B. (20211030054) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Ibréhima

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ibréhima Sidibé est âgé de 36 ans et vit avec ses  4 enfants et son épouse chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Dialanicoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, dès son jeune âge il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Depuis 15 ans il mène l’activité de fabrication de marmites à base d’aluminium. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle. Monsieur Ibréhima a une maîtrise parfaite de son activité.
Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un autre client de Soro Yiriwaso, il décide alors de rejoindre l’institution avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt  individuel.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 15 tas d’aluminium et 5 sacs de charbon  de bois.                                                                                                                                                                             Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). La vente de sa production se fait à Bougouni et une partie dans les villages environnants lors des foires  hebdomadaires.  La plupart de ses clients sont des femmes
Monsieur Ibréhima Sidibé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour agrandir son entreprise.
Il a pour ambition de se construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibréhima Sidibé is 36 years old and lived with his four children and wife at his father place in Bougouni in the Dialanicoro district (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended modern schools, he started working to earn an income at an early age. Since he was 15 years old, he has been running a business making cooking pots made of aluminum. He learned this work from his uncle and has a good command of his business. Introduced to Soro Yiriwaso through another Soro Yiriwaso client, he thus decided to join this micro-finance institution and is now on his first individual loan. He plans on using this loan to buy 15 loads of aluminum and 5 sacks of charcoal. He stocks up in Bougouni and in Bamako (capital of Mali). Sales of his products are made in Bougouni and in surrounding villages during weekly fairs. Most of his customers are women. He plans on realizing a monthly profit of 32,000 francs CFA that will be used to expand his enterprise. His ambition is to build a house in which to live.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is forty-three years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters who are all still in school. As a single parent, she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Georgina is a trader. She trades in cereals such as maize, groundnut, beans, etc. She supplies to retailers in her community and treks as well. Georgina procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for six years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Sola

texts.en: Sola is 34 years old and married. She sells bags of cement to customers in Lagos, Nigeria. This is her main source of income.  Sola hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more bags of cement to sell.  Sola says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy more bags of cement to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años, es una dulce madre de familia dedicada al bienestar de sus seres queridos con quienes vive en su casa propia, la cual está todavía esta en etapa de construcción. Su servicio como costurera lo realiza en una fábrica ubicada en el centro de la capital. Su trabajo consiste en realizar los acabados de las prendas de vestir y por se buen desempeño y dedicación no sólo le aumentaron su sueldo, sino también logró adquirir una máquina de coser con la cual trabaja dentro en su casa todos los fines de semana, confeccionando algunas prendas que  solicitan sus clientes, siendo la mayoría sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que las personas valoran los acabados y diseños que realiza, es así que desde hace 15 años trabaja en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar bajo la presión debido a los cambios de temporada, cuando se trabaja el doble de lo acostumbrado para aumentar la producción. Sus planes a futuro son implementar su propio taller y trabajar en su casa junto a su familia.
Este es su sexto crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde ha venido trabajando con puntualidad en sus pagos y ha sabido ganarse el cariño de sus compañeras de grupo, quienes le tienen gran estima. María solicita un crédito de tres mil soles que le ayudará a seguir implementando su pequeño taller de costura.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and a sweet mother dedicated to the well-being of her loved ones with whom she lives in her own house, which is still under construction. She carries out her business as a seamstress in a factory in the center of the capitol. Her job is to complete finished clothing items and for her good performance and dedication they have increased her salora and she was able to acquire a sewing machine with which she works from her house every weekend, creating clothes that her clients, including the majority of her neighbors, request. What she likes the most about her work is that people value her finished clothes and designs that she creates, and this is why she has worked in this capacity for 15 years. She considers working under the pressure of the changes in weather the most difficult aspect of her job and when she works doubly hard to increase her production. Her future plans are to create her own workshop and work in her house together with her family. This is María's sixth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, where she has worked punctually in her payments and been able to win the affection of the other entrepreneurs in her group who hold her in high esteem. María is requesting a loan of $1050, which will help her to continue to build her dressmaking workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of a textile workshop

loans.name: Oyundalai

texts.en: Oyundalai T. is 39 and lives with her husband and teenage son in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her son is 14 and an 8th grade student in a local high school. She rents a small stall in a local market and sells meat, mostly beef and mutton. She usually purchases meat from the local wholesale markets and resells it at her stall. She has had this business since 2002, and has expanded it successfully; her capital has increased from 20,000 MNT to 2,500,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). In the future, she aims to have her own wholesale point at the local market, where she would be able to sell various meats for local customers. She requests a loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for her business

loans.name: Catholic United Group

texts.en:
Here are Patricia F. G., Cecilia F. K. and Nahomi K.. They are members of the Catholic United group. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. They have been in business for many years now but business has been developing at a very slow pace. They have thus come to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean leones each to help them improve their businesses. 

Patricia F. G. (left) is the leader of this group. Patricia was born in Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone, 40 years ago. She is married to a teacher and they have four children who are attending secondary schools. Patricia sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), cassavas, potatoes, etc. She has been a businesswoman since her childhood days.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Albini Group

texts.es:
El grupo Albini lo conforman Albini del Socorro P.,  Francisca S. J. y Carlos Alberto C..  P. tiene una pulpería surtida con lo necesario pero necesita reinvertir en mayor cantidad de productos como granos básicos.

S.  cosecha y vende frutas está actividad la aprendió con sus padres quienes también eran agricultores y que le mostraron el amor a este trabajo. Mientras Alberto C.  vende frutas y verduras  en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The Albini group consists of P. Albini del Socorro P., Francisca S. J. y Carlos Alberto C.. P. has a store stocked with the necessities but needs to reinvest in more products such as basic grains. S. harvests and sell fruits, an activity learned from her parents who were also farmers and showed her the love of this work. Alberto Chavez sells fruits and vegetables in the market of Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: Sujayla Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Sujayla del Rosario  tiene 39 años de edad, posee 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y los otros dos son menores que están a su cargo. La señora tiene una la elaboración de repostería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 7 años. Porque su mama quería ingresos adicionales que reemplazaran la escasez de trabajo. Al poco tiempo, empezó a vender bocadillos y otros productos así fue como incremento su clientela diario produce encargos que son vendidos. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de harina, colorantes, mantequilla, aceite, huevo y queso. Su sueño es llegar a instalarse en el mercado para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Sujayla del Rosario is 39 years old. Of her three children, one is already independent while the two younger ones are still under her care. Sujayla operates a pastry shop out of her home. She started this business seven years ago so that she could provide her mother with extra income to make up for a shortage of work. Over time, she began selling sandwiches and other products so that she could generate more customer orders on a daily basis. This loan will be used to buy flour, food coloring, butter, oil, eggs, and cheese. Her dream is have a place in the market to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora J. is currently in the business of selling fresh fruit in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase fresh vegetables and more fruit to sell.  Nora is 20 years old and is married with a husband who is a potter. She has two children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to set up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.en:
S. Radjabali is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children. He has been breeding cattle for more than 13 years and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, especially getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets. Radjabali keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, who, along with his wife, help him care for the animals. Radjabali needs a loan of $800 USD to buy more calves to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible.

 

 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: http://www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy calves to expand the business.

loans.name: Perpétue

texts.fr: T. Perpétue est née en 1974 à Zangnanado au Bénin. Mariée à ADANOU Parfait, un menuisier, Perpétue est mère de quatre enfants, dont deux sont à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis cinq ans à Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est surtout le mari de Perpétue qui assure les charges de la famille. Cependant, Perpétue utilise les revenus de son activité pour venir en aide à son mari. Perpétue a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Depuis environs 20 ans, Perpétue vend des produits vivriers et aussi des condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche, oignons, piments, gombo)  à son domicile. Perpétue vend également du poisson frit, de l’œuf et de l’huile, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. Perpétue s’approvisionne à Pahou, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Perpétue a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Perpétue s’accroît au jour le jour; mais Perpétue n’arrive pas à la satisfaire parce que les moyens financiers dont elle dispose sont faibles. Perpétue sollicite donc un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Perpétue T. was born in 1974 in Zangnanado in Benin. Married to Parfait Adanou, a finish carpenter, Perpétue is the mother of four children, two of which are in her care. All of her children are in school. For the past five years, she and her family have lived in Agla in Cotonou, which is the economic capital of Benin. Perpétue's husband is the one who usually takes care of the family's expenses. However, Perpétue uses the income from her business to help out her husband. Perpétue attended school up to secondary school. For approximately 20 years, Perpétue has sold food items as well as sauce ingredients (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra) at her home. Perpétue also sells fried fish, eggs, and oil, which has provided her with additional sources of income. Perpétue buys her stock at Pahou, a market in Benin where food items are sold, and at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Perpétue has already received one loan through Alidé, which she repaid in full. Perpétue's customer base is growing day by day, but she is unable to keep up with the demand because she does not have the financial means to do so. She is requesting a second loan so she can bolster her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn and rice, jugs of vegetable oil, and sauce ingredients

loans.name: Maclovia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maclovia esta casada y tiene una hija que estudia en colegio y su esposo trabaja como empleado de un surtidor de combustibles.

La Sra. Maclovia tiene como actividad la venta de almuerzos en su restaurante donde vende tambien platos extras como pollos broaster y silpancho, su restaurante esta ubicado en la zona San Pedro, esta atividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia ya que con esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Uno de sus deseos de la Sra. Maclovia es ver a su hija profesional y tambien tener otro restaurante y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

El destino del credito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar de  mesas y sillas para su pension.

La Sra. Maclovia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Maclovia is married and has a daughter, who is in school. Her husband works as a fuel distributor. Maclovia works selling prepared lunches in her eatery where she also sells extras like broasted chicken and silpancho (a typical Bolivian food from the city of Cochabamba. It consists of a base layer of rice, followed by a layer of boiled and sliced potatoes, followed by a thin schnitzel-style meat, followed by another layer of chopped tomato, onion and parsley mixed together and topped with either one or two fried eggs). Her restaurant is in the San Pedro neighborhood and this work is her main source of income, with which she helps to support her family and helps her husband with household expenses. One of Maclovia's wishes is to see her daughter become a professional and also to have another restaurant so that she can improve her quality of life. This funding will be used to buy tables and chairs for her eatery. Maclovia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline V. is a 58-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling fish. She lives in Brgy. Vito in Sagay City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Diego. She also helps to manage his piggery. They have five children who are 26 to 37 years old: three of them are currently working. Evangeline has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions by her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Evangeline is now borrowing 19,500 PHP for additional business capital. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Evangeline hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 21 años, es una joven madre que se dedica a la venta de plantas, al igual que su pareja; juntos educan a su hija de 9 meses de nacida.

Desde hace 2 años ambos decidieron incursionar en este rubro, por los consejos que le dieron sus amistades acerca de las buenas ganancias que se obtenía en este negocio. Es así que en la actualidad es su principal fuente de ingresos y a la cual le ponen todo su esfuerzo. Su esposo se dedica a la venta y distribución de las plantas, viajando a otras ciudades y ella se dedica a la compra y contratos con los proveedores. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que solo lo realizan 3 días a la semana: los jueves, viernes y sábados, quedándole tiempo disponible para dedicárselo a su pequeña hija. A su vez, están planeando realizar otro tipo de negocio para sus días libres, pero aún no han decidido qué hacer, además no quieren descuidar a su hija, porque creen que es tan importante el trabajo como el tiempo que pasan con ella.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y María promete ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado será destinado a comprar más plantas para distribuirlas en las ciudades donde tienen pedidos.
texts.en:
María is a 21 years old mother who sells plants along with her partner. Together they are bringing up their 9 month old daughter. Two years ago, they both decided to become involved in this field after hearing advice from their friends about the potential profitability of such a business. This is how plant selling became their principle source of income and where they put all their efforts. Her husband travels to other cities selling and distributing the plants, while she buys and contracts with the suppliers. The best part of her work is that it only keeps her occupied for 3 days a week: Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, which leaves her spare time to dedicate to her baby daughter. One day they will plan another type of business for her days off, but they still haven’t decided what to do and also they do not want to neglect their daughter. They believe that spending time with her is just as important as time spent working. This is her first loan with MFP and María promises to be very responsible with the repayments. The money that they are soliciting will be used to buy more plants to distribute to the cities where they have orders.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional plants to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 39-year-old mother of three. Her husband is employed as a fireman while she runs a grocery shop. She is a hardworking lady who is also involved in poultry farming and sells food.

Monica has been saving part of her income with Faulu Kenya and also paying wages to her five employees. She has requested a loan of Kes 15,000 to add to her stock of onions, peas and cabbages.

Monica dreams of providing a better education for her children. She sees herself becoming financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of onions, peas and cabbages

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina M. is 35 and married with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, 0 selling fruits and vegetables.  Christina has many years of experience in this business.  Christina needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Christina joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Christina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bantilan

texts.en:
Bantilan M. is from the village of Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years old. Bantilan is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Bantilan owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beef products in the local community. Bantilan has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Bantilan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bantilan is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Bantilan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Haminou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un jeune homme célibataire, afin de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens, il s’est lancé dans la vente de CD audio et vidéos. Il a commencé ce commerce en 2008 et s’approvisionne au Niger et en chine.  Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. La demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, pour les satisfaire il sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour l’achat de divers CD audios et vidéos
texts.en:
This is a young single man who decided to go into selling audio CDs and videos in order to take care of his everyday expenses. He launched this business in 2008 and buys his stock in Niger and in China. He has a very broad customer base. As the current customer demand is growing, and he would like to be able to satisfy it, he is seeking his first loan from WAGES to buy various CDs and videos.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing CDs and videos for resale

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama I. sells firewood in bundles at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with the railway system.

Adama has been selling firewood for quite some time now and supports her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more firewood for sale. She hopes to use the new income from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es: El Señor Juan Bonifacio I. C. es el coordinador de este grupo y se dedica a actividades de agricultura con lo que ha logrado sostener a su familia, desde hace más de 20 años.   Los integrantes de este grupo denominado “Restauración” está conformado por 5 personas que buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se dedican a diferentes actividades como lo son la crianza de animales, venta de ropa, venta de medicinas y artículos de consumo diario. Los cuales pertenecen a una misma familia. Actualmente son una familia grande y buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo que han decidido formar un grupo, para solicitar un préstamo, que les servirá para mejorar sus viviendas, ya que últimamente el clima  a estado cambiando, y ellos quieren estar  preparados para el futuro, en lo que pueda acontecer  y reducir el riesgo en cuanto a sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Bonifacio I. C. is this group's coordinator and works as a farmer, which has allowed him to maintain his family for the past 20 years. The members of this group known as Restauracion, are all family members who are looking to better their situation. They make a living through a variety of activities including, raising livestock, clothing sales, as well as selling medicine and everyday needs items. They are part of a large family that formed a group to request a loan for improvements on their homes. Since the climate has been changing lately, they want to be prepared for the future and reduce the risk to their current situation.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvements

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say S., 57, is an older woman and the widow mother of four kids. To earn a living, she owns a small store in a good location. In her shop, she sells different kinds of flowers to people who need to decorate for parties or ceremonies. Also, she takes time to order fruit in bulk to resell for additional income. Her children assist her in her business activities. Say S. normally earns an average of $3 per day to help cover her family’s daily living expenses. She is currently selling well because she has a skill in communicating with people. 

To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a $1,200 loan. She will use some of the loan as capital to accumulate a quantity of various flowers and fruits to sell. With the remaining cash from the loan, she will buy a used motorcycle for her riding needs.

loans.use: To accumulate a quantity of various flowers and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en: Mr. Pum S. is 37 years old and is the president of this group loan, having been selected by its sixteen members from Thlok Doung Tum village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.  The leader Mr. Pum S. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living, B. the farm business does not allow them to earn enough to support their family. Thus, in order to make a better life for their family, Mr. Pum S. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple has two children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 44 years old., married, and has three children ages 9, 16 and 20, all attending school. A farmer for the last 10 years from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya, Jane has two employees, one permanent and one casual. Her farm produces cabbages, potatoes, beetroot and milk, all of which she sells to brokers. Her biggest challenges have been diseases, poor prices for her products and a lack of available labour.

Jane has an exemplary record with Juhudi Kilimo, having recently completed repayment of her second loan of 80,000KES. She is now requesting another loan of 80,000KES from Juhudi to purchase a dairy cow. Jane says that the income from this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her children and improve their heath since she will be able to provide them with enough milk.

In the future she expects to acquire six dairy cows, a goal that will help her to establish dairy farming as her major business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of pepper

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with grown children. He is a small market vendor from Kahovka. Alexander earns his living selling women’s footwear in one of the local marketplaces in his home town. He started this business 13 years ago when he was forced to find ways to provide for his family. Alexander took a risk and launched his own enterprise. Currently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His turnover capital amounts to 16,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 9,000 Grivnyas.  

Alexander is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase his sale rate. He is cheerful and energetic. His customers love buying things from him as they always leave encouraged and inspired. Alexander loves communicating with people and believes his job gives him many wonderful opportunities to do so.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise and increase his sale rate

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey C. is from the city of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rey is the one next to the motorcycle. He is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a business venture, operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Rey has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first taken out by Rey from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Mrs. Tuon  Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group has nine people, all located in Choes village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Tuon S. was born in 1980. She was selected village bank president by the other members, all of whom will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Pot Chhoem, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her husband is also a palm juice collector. Her problem is that her rice field has infertile soil so, to improve production, Mrs. Tuon S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jacklime

texts.en:
Jackline N. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, beans, simsim (sesame seeds), cow peas and groundnuts. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of cow peas and beans to sell.  

Jackline is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has six children and only five of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of cow peas and beans to sell

loans.name: Yovito

texts.en:
Yovito is a 37-year-old man married to a teacher; together they have four children. His family is composed of six people and Yovito and his wife both work to look after the family. He says that his family dream is to see their children well educated and have a better standard of living for the family. 

Yovito is a driver and has been in the transport business for the last eight years.  He however says that accidents have increased on the roads thus the need to fear and be careful on his side. The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his children

loans.name: María Sara

texts.es: María Sara M. D. G. D. 61 años D. edad, resiD. en San Pablo Tacachico, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa una nieta D. 7 años D. edad. María posee una tienda D.  productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como: pan, huevos, leche, granos básicos y otros más, en el cual trabaja junto a su esposo. El negocio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, debido a que se encuentra en calle principal, esto le beneficia en gran manera, ya que le permite contar con muchos clientes fijos, ya que es un lugar el cual siempre esta lleno D. muchas personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar sus productos, D. manera que pueda ofrecer más a sus clientes. Este negocio es D. mucha importantita para ella ya que es la única fuente D. ingresos con la que cuenta para sostener a su familia.
texts.en: 61-year-old María Sara M. D. G. lives in San Pablo Tacachico, located in the department of La Libertad, along with her spouse and a 7-year-old granddaughter. María has a store where she and her husband sell food and basic home necessities like bread, eggs, milk, staple grains etc. The business is well-located, since it is on the main street. This is very beneficial, since it allows them to have a lot of regular customers, since it is in a place that is always full of lots of people. María is requesting a loan through which she will be able to increase her products, so she will be able to offer her customers more. This business is very important for her, since it is her only source of income with which to support her family.

loans.use: To buy food for her grocery store.

location.town: San Pablo Tacachico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky C. is 37 years old, is married, and supports her family by operating a business venture selling fruit. She lives in the Philippines in Brgy. Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fruit-selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Vicky has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to fund the operations of her business. This will be her tenth loan from Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was another step on her journey to economic freedom.

Vicky aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF's alleviation program empowers women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. The women are taking a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon"--a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org and joining the team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of a fruit-selling business

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is twenty-two years old.   He lives in the village of Senquelo in the district of Olmos.  Olmos is an area in northern Peru, primarily populated by small farmers. 

Marcos raises animals, specifically sheep and goats.  He raises the animals to the appropriate size and age and then sells them in local markets.  The animals serve as food for the local populace and are important parts of many traditional dishes.  Marcos has been raising animals for four years.

Marcos plans to use the loan to expand his herd and purchase additional feed for his animals.  His dream is to move on to larger animals one day, specifically cattle.  Marcos has good references and is considered a responsible young man.  He appreciates the opportunity to use credit to get one step closer to his dreams.

loans.use: Expand his herd and supplies of feed

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MAQUIMANTA PURISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el tiene 70 años de edad y es casado y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de empleado en el sector educación, el por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere terminar de construir su casa una. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower, Mr. Guillermo, belongs to the "Maquimanta Purisun" communal bank.  The bank is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Mr. Guillermo is 70 years old, married, and has five children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his work as an employee in the education sector.  Through this job, he was able to help his children get ahead.  Now, Mr. Guillermo would like to finish building his house.  He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials.

Mr. Guillermo is happy to receive this loan and he promises to comply with the terms of his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa O. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagn, Lanao Del Norte. She is 48 years old. Marisa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Marisa is just starting this business.

In 2007, Marisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure for planting and harvesting vegetables for sale

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, es una comerciante de pan y administra un comedor, tiene 45 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposo, el negocio es familiar y trabaja todos los días de la semana, vende pan por las tardes y comida desde la mañana hasta el mediodía, tiene clientela abundante.
Por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales de cocina, estos los necesita en el día a día para preparar la comida que ofrece a los clientes, su compra será en carnes, verduras, condimentos y aceite, manteniendo con estos variedad en su cocina y vender a los clientes platillos de calidad.
Su objetivo es progresar con sus dos negocios, empleando a personas para que distribuyan su pan y ampliar el comedor,  garantizando ingresos diariamente para el mantenimiento del negocio y de los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria sells bread and runs a food stall. She is 45 years old. She lives in San Miguel with her husband. This is a family business and she works every day of the week. She sells bread in the afternoons and prepared food from the morning until the middle of the day. She has a lot of customers.
Right now she is asking for a loan in order to buy kitchen supplies. These she needs in order to prepare the daily meals for her customers. She will buy meat, vegetables, condiments and oil in order to have a variety of food products in her kitchen and sell quality prepared food to her customers.
Her objectives are to progress with her two businesses. She would like to employ people to sell her bread. She would like to expand her food stall in order to increase her daily earnings. The earnings will be used to maintain her business and also for household expenses

loans.use: She will buy meat, vegetables, condiments and oil.

loans.name: Partrick  Irungu

texts.en:
Partrick Irungu W., 37 years old, is married to Cecilia who is a business lady. They have three school-going children.  He has been in the "Matatu" (public transport) business for five years and earns a profit of Kshs. 30,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing group, and he is applying for his first loan to repair and service the vehicle. His "Matatu" operates in Ruai on a route that is in a peri-urban area and well populated.

The profit will be ploughed back into business and in future he looks forward to growing his business and starting a company. He is a very honest and hard-working gentleman.

loans.use: To repair and service the van

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El  señor Francisco es sastre y tiene un taller de sastrería; el crédito lo requiere para comprar la prótesis que necesita su esposa, ella realiza papas fritas y las comercializa. Ambas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Vive en la casa de su suegra ubicada en la zona de Obispo Bosque en la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Franciso is a tailor and he has a talior's shop. He needs the loan to buy a prosthetic that his wife needs. She prepares and sells french fries. These two activities are the main source of income that supports them. He lives in his mother-in-law's house in the Obispo Bosque area of La Paz.

loans.use: To buy a prosthetic for his wife.

loans.name: Alishba's Group

texts.en:
Alishba, 50, has applied for a loan for her husband’s business.  Married, her family lives in a three room house in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan, a city famous for its dairy industry.

Alishba stays at home and does household work.  Alishba and her husband have two illiterate sons who work.  Her eldest has a job in a factory while her youngest helps his father in his crushed wood selling business.
  
Due to good customer service, her husband receives a lot of orders every month.  Alishb's husband, in business for over eight years, wants to buy crushed woods in bulk to fulfill larger orders on time and to earn a good profit.  She hoped this loan will boost the family business.

There are four other members of this group loan.

loans.use: To buy crushed woods for selling

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 55 years-old and she is talented in handwork.  She makes necklaces, bangles, earrings and woven baskets to earn a living.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She was previously employed in a hotel as a house-keeper. 

Being a widowed lady with six children, she works hard to provide for her family.  She has learnt business management skills through the training offered by Kiva partner Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to open another outlet of her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy beads and reeds for making baskets.

loans.use: to buy beads and reeds for making baskets

loans.name: Jezeil

texts.en:
Jezeil is a Paletinian woman from Rafah city, married and a mother of two daughters and three sons. Jezeil's husband is a pharmacist.

Jezeil took out a loan from FATEN to purchase medications, accessories and make-up items to sell in their pharmacy. The loan will help in increasing the variety and quantity of medications plus the accessories that will attract more customers.

Jezeil's husband appears in the picture here since she is a conservative woman as are most Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase medications and accessories to sell in the pharmacy.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Abdul K.. He is a widower and has one child, aged 9 years. 

In the year 2009, Abdul established his used-clothing business. He began this business because he believed he ccould get enough income to support his family.  Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 400,000 every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Abdul requires this loan in order to buy bails of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 200,000. 

In the future, Abdul plans to buy a larger quantity of clothes to supply to other traders, to hire sales persons, and to open another stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bails of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Jeannett Del Socorro

texts.es: Jeanet Del Socorro tiene 52 años, se dedica a un taller de costura. Tiene más de 37 años con su negocio. Este negocio lo inicio por medio de unas amigas que a temprana edad le enseñaron a realizar las diferentes prendas de vestir que sus clientes le encargaban, a pesar de que le costaba realizar los encargos que le solicitaban. Con el paso del tiempo es que ha salido adelante agradece el tener un medio de vida, para salir adelante. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de telas, zipper, tijeras, hilos, aceite, encajes, bordados, botones entre otros productos.
texts.en: Jeanet Del Socorro is 52 years old and has a sewing shop.  She has 37 years of experience in this business.  She began it after some friends showed her, at an early age, how to make different types of clothing that was ordered by their customers, even though it cost her to fill the orders.  She’s managed to get ahead over time and is grateful to have a way of life that allows her to get ahead.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, zippers, scissors, thread, oil, pins, borders, buttons, and other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Ghazar G

texts.en: The client lives in Zovasar village, Aragatsotn region, together with his family of five members. He is engaged in agriculture. Living in a mountainous region with tough climate makes the living quite challenging.  For most of the locals, it is the livestock and potato fields that serve as a source of income.  The client keeps livestock and cultivates the land. He would like to increase the livestock and develop agriculture. With the increased income, the client will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paint.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora se dedica a la venta D. alimentos para los mineros D. las minas D. Carbón del municipio Amagá, ella inició este negocio para ayudarle a su esposo a sostener su familia que está conformada por 6 hijos, ya que él siempre ha estado desempleado.

El negocio D. comidas lo inició con solo 2 clientes y actualmente ya tiene aproximadamente unos 20 que le permiten tener el sustento diario para su familia.

Ella necesita un crédito para tener diversidad D. comidas para sus clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Aurora sells food to the coalminers in the Amagá municipality mines. She started this business to help her husband support their family of six children, as he has always been unemployed.

She started her catering business with just two customers and she now has about 20, so she can proviD. for the daily needs of her family.

Señora Aurora needs a loan to offer her customers a greater choice of meals and thus increase her revenue.

loans.use: to buy groceries for cooking meals.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 21 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income by buying and selling pigs. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bubajjwe Youth Development Group

texts.en:
Farming and selling coffee has been 54-year-old Godfrey's source of livelihood for eight years in Kayunga. A father of four, he decided to engage in this business because coffee is Uganda's premier cash crop which sells well, especially if one is selling it to the many coffee cooperative unions all over the country. Coffee was Uganda's number one foreign exchange export earner in the early 80's. Though times have changed for the worse because of the fluctuations in coffee prices on the international markets, many Ugandans are not about to dispense with this business any time soon. Many people in their late 50s speak with nostalgia about the good old days coming back, when they were able to give their children a good education with earnings from their coffee sales. 

There has been recent improvement with better coffee prices from the re-emerging coffee unions to coffee farmers who have good-grade coffee. As a result, many coffee farmers, Godfrey included, can now bask in the glow of improved sales profits. Godfrey took over this business from his late father. Weekly, he makes sales profits totaling Ugandan shillings 60,000. He says he is going to use this Kiva loan to purchase young coffee plants to grow. He envisages being able to make more profits when the plants mature and produce better high-grade, robust Arabica coffee to sell.

loans.use: to purchase young coffee plants to grow

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 31-year-old woman, married and humbly residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is blessed to have three children with her. She grows corn and bananas to earn a living. After 10 years of handling this work, she finds it tiresome but enjoyable. She gets a monthly income of PHP 3,000 from this activity. Esterlita has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase fertilizers for the corn. She has been connected with GDMPC for a year. She plans to buy a lot in the future to extend the farming area and gain more income from it.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Leoncio es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra frijol, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de su casa. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así mejorar económicamente.  Leoncio es una persona que se preocupa por que su cosecha sea buena para que tenga algunas comodidades.
texts.en:
Leoncio, 51, lives with his wife in his own home, which does not have utilities such as water or electricity.  His home is located in the rural Pitipo district, which is in the department of Lambayeque.  This is an area known for its livestock and agricultural activities.

Leoncio is a farmer.  He has his own land where he cultivates beans.  Once he harvests his crops, he offers them for sale in the different markets in the area where he lives, and this is how he obtains the income to cover his household expenses.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa through Capital Semilla for 2,000 Peruvian soles to purchase fertilizers to improve his lands and his crops.  His goal is to be able to offer his products to the traders at a better price so that he can improve his financial situation.  Leoncio is a person who is always concerned about having a good harvest so that he can have some comforts.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve his lands and his crops

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 29 years old and single. He uses his bicycle to supply cakes to retail shops.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial resources easily. Through Faulu Kenya, he has also learned how to manage his finances by saving his money. Robert hopes to open a bakery in the future and become the major supplier of cakes in his local community.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cakes.

loans.use: To buy cakes to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina de 37 años de edad, soltera quien tiene 1 hijo, ellos viven en una vivienda  alquilada, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Guillermina es una madre que sufrió mucho, años atrás, desde que su esposo lo dejo  ella tuvo que trabajar arduamente para poder darle un bienestar a su querida hija que es su razón de existir.
Ella a los inicios trabajaba como empleada del hogar. hasta que un día se le presento una oportunidad de poder acceder a un crédito y poder realizar un negocio es donde que sin pensarlo dos veces solicito a la entidad de MFP, donde accedió al banquito comunal y le facilitaron un crédito.Ahora Guillermina esta contenta con el negocio que tiene, ella es tan creativa que cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes y venta de viandas, la tienda de Guillermina es tan concurrida, por  la mejor atención que tiene y los precios al alcance del publico.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que Guillermina se compromete en efectivizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.Guillermina esta emocionada por el gran paso que dio al formar parte de su banquito comunal.Con los 1,500 nuevos soles Guillermina comprara productos para el expendio en su tienda.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 37, single and has one child. They live in a rented house in Pichari District.

Guillermina is a mother who suffered a lot, many years ago. Since her husband left her, she had to work very hard for the well-being of her beloved daughter, who is her reason for living.

At first Guillermina worked as a housekeeper, until one day she was given an opportunity to get a loan and be able to have a business. Without thinking twice about it, she applied to MFP, where she joined a communal bank and they gave her a loan. Now Guillermina is happy with the business she has. She is so creative that she has a grocery store and also sells prepared foods. Guillermina's store is very popular because of her excellent service and reasonable prices.

This is her first loan with MFP, so Guillermina promises to make her payments on time. She is very excited about the big step she took when she joined the communal bank. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, Guillermina will buy products to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Robbie

texts.en:
Robbie is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Robbie has a shop that buys and sells coconuts.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconuts to sell.  Robbie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Robbie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Sibi

texts.fr:
Sibi est une femme âgée de 46 ans, elle est mariée à un revendeur de véhicule d’occasion. sibi a deux enfants.
Sibi est une revendeuse depuis 2005,  elle achète et revend du charbon de bois à sa clientèle. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays.
Sibi sollicite de WAGES son premier cycle de prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Sibi, 46, is married to a used car salesman. She has two children. She has been a small-scale retailer since 2005. She buys charcoal and resells it to her customers. She gets her supply of charcoal from the interior of the country. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund is married and with 4 children.  Edmund is 57 years of age and lives in Acad Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. 

Edmund owns and operates a business project in the agricultural sector planting and harvesting coconut for sale. He sell coconut to his contract buyer to earn a living and had this business for about 5 years. Each month, he earns PHP 13,500 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 35,000 to purchase coconut farm fertilizer and other farm equipment.During harvest time he requested his neighbors to help him and he compensate them.

Edmund  has been a member of GDMPC for one year. This is the first cycle of loan taken from the cooperative. In the future, Edmund hopes to improve and expand his business so that he can help his children to have a brighter future and plan to buy another coconut farm.

loans.use: to purchased coconut farm fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 36 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. 

Mary Grace used to engage in a service-based business giving manicures and pedicures to locals. Aside from doing manicures and pedicures, she is also engaged in selling ready-to-wear garments such as shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to purchase additional ready-to-wear garments such as t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Mary grace joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear garments such as t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old and married to Simon. Together they have three children aged 15, 13 and 9 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 2 years. She gets a monthly  income of KES 6,000 from the business.

This is Catherine's first loan term with KADET. She will use the loan amount to purchase more clothes for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 55 and has three adult children. They live happily in a village. She manages a small variety store to generate additional income. She has operated her small business for almost five years and earns a profit of P7,000 a month, which she usually spends for their daily consumption and saves for their future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she still manages her business. Her ambition in life is to make her business grow and give her children a better life.

She wants to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demands but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy additional stock of snack foods, noodles, candies, canned goods, beverages, soaps and soft drinks to sell in her variety store. She mentioned that this loan will help her to work out her plan and make an improvement in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of snack foods, noodles, candies, canned goods, beverages, soaps and soft drinks to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Agostino

texts.en:
Agostino has operated his electronics sales and repair shop in Olkalau town for the last 11 years. He is 40 years old, married to Catherine, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of television sets and radios for sale in his business.

In the future, Agostino hopes to expand his electronics shop to wholesale and become the best electronics dealer in the region, thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more television sets and radios for sale

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 33-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. For three years, she has had a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of items like shampoo, soap, canned goods, and soft drinks. Julie earns 4000 PHP (Philippine pesos) per month with her sari-sari store business. Julie's husband is a farmer and fish vendor. She helps him grow rice on their land.

Julie has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods. Julie hopes to earn more and therefore to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm and more items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS ORQUIDEAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, chicha que es una bebida a base de maíz y también vende desayunos en las mañanas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne, pollo y verduras y también para comprar maíz para hacer chicha.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the "Las Orquideas" communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, which is part of Cusco province, in Cusco department. She is 50, single, and has four children.

The borrower alternates her daily activities with the business of selling meals, as well as chicha, a beverage made from corn. She also sells breakfast in the mornings. She sells in the street from 7:00am to 5:00pm. By means of this business, she is raising her children. 

Her dream is to expand her business selling meals. She is applying for the loan in order to buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, meat, chicken, and vegetables, as well as corn for making chicha.
