Lourdes S. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occ. She is 62 years old. Lourdes is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Lourdes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: José Farid

texts.es: José Farid F. A. de 35 años de edad, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador el cual reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a sus dos hijos y junto a su madre. José posee una venta de ropa para mujer, y delantales, los cuales se utilizan para cuidar la ropa a la hora de cocinar, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Usulután, en donde hace 15 años se dedica a esta actividad, la cual le permite sostener su hogar. José solicita un préstamo para invertir en su venta comprando mayor cantidad y diversos estilos de ropa femenina, tanto para surtir su negocio como también para que su madre comercialice en su casa de habitación. José desea en gran manera mejorar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir mejor.
texts.en: José Farid F. A. is 35 years old.  He is a very responsible and hard-working father who lives in Usulután department together with his two children and his mother.  José has a business selling women's clothing and aprons which are used to protect clothes when cooking.  His business is located in the market in Usulután.  He has been in his business for 15 years and it has enabled him to support his household.  José is requesting a loan to invest in his sales business, buying a larger quantity and range of women's clothes both to stock his business and for his mother to sell from home.  José would like to improve his sales and thereby be able to live better.

loans.use: To buy clothes and aprons to sell

loans.name: Dilabzahon's Group

texts.en:
Dilabzahon T. is a resident of Aravan. She is the treasurer of this group. Dilabzahon is 36 and married.  Her husband works as a driver in the Regional Electro Station. Together they bring up a daughter and a son. Both children are at school. In order to make money to cover family expenses, Dilabzahon sells dairy products. She started this activity 15 years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms. In this way, she earns 2,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a cow for breeding.  In the future, she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a 50-year-old woman from southern Israel, and is married with eleven children and several grandchildren. Fatma has an elementary school education but a strong and proven business intuition. She owns a successful general store which sells children's clothes, women's traditional dresses and different trinkets and gifts. Fatma has taken a loan to expand her enterprise and open a mini-market on the same lot where her general store is located.

The loan will help her with the final renovations and to purchase store supplies. Fatma has trained her daughter to manage the general store so she has the time to develop the mini-market and strengthen her business ventures.

In the future Fatma wants to develop her businesses so they can support and employ not just her and her family but additional workers from the area, creating a source of income for others.

loans.use: To finish renovating her store and purchase store supplies

loans.name: Iveth Azucena

texts.es: La señora Ivet Azucena Pérez Orizaba es originaria de la localidad llamada San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar hermoso donde sus aguas son conocidas como termales o aguas de azufre. Doña Ivet tiene 24 años de edad, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria por que se caso muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse al hogar y también su marido no la dejo estudiar ya que tenía que cuidar de su casa y de su hijo. Doña Ivet como le gusta que le digan, está pidiendo un crédito para invertir en una tienda de celulares, ya que comprara equipos de telefonía celular, accesorios para estos, tiempo aire etc. Ella tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 3 años, el local donde vende sus teléfonos es prestado por sus familiares. Comenta que compra sus teléfonos en una distribuidora autorizada en Zitacuaro Michoacán, donde comenta que le dan precios de mayoreo y así ella les puede ganar algo. A ella le gusta mucho su negocio ya que esta al pendiente de sus hijos, la señora Ivet esta casada con el señor Enrique el cual es comerciante en esta temporada el vende Flor de Noche Buena, ellos tienen dos hijos Daniela de 5 años la cual estudia el jardín de niños y José Pablo de 4 meses. La meta que tiene para su negocio la señora Ivet es seguir invirtiendo en sus celulares y poner en el mismo negocio una copiadora ya que cerca de su localidad no hay copiadoras y una papelería, comenta que con las ganancias que saque de la venta de sus celulares les comprara a sus pequeños hijos algún regalo de navidad.
texts.en: Sra. Ivet Azucena P. Orizaba lives in a town called San Jose Purua in the Mexican state of Michoacan.  It's a beautiful place known for its hot springs and sulfur baths.  Dona Ivet, 24, married very young, in her third year of high school, and has worked at caring for her house and family since then.  Her husband didn't let her study because he wanted her to take care of their son.  Dona Ivet, as she likes to be called, is applying for a loan to invest in her cellular phone shop.  She wants to buy cell phones, accessories and telephone minutes to resell.  She has operated the business for approximately 3 year in a space that she borrowed from relatives.  She says that she buys her merchandise from an authorized dealer in Zitacuaro because she pays less there and can earn more when she resells the merchandise.  She likes the business very much because it allows her to keep an eye on her children.  Sra. Ivet is married to Sr. Enrique who sells seasonal flowers.  They have two children: Daniela, 5, who is in kindergarten and a 4-month old baby named Jose Pablo.  Sra. Ivet's goal is to continue investing in her business.  She wants to buy a copier in the future because there are none nearby and sell other paper and office products.  She says that she plans to buy her young children Christmas gifts with part of the earnings from her business.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria T. is from the city of Pob.1,Oroquieta City. She is 60 years old. Silveria is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Silveria owns & operates a tailoring business providing women's tailoring services to local community members. Silveria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Silveria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Silveria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Silveria is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Silveria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea B., 52, is set to break the common notion about being a farmer's wife. Irenea, a CCT* Community Partner, is, unlike common wives of farmers, a productive entrepreneur. She is married to Ignacio, and they have seven children. Three of them are already working, one is in elementary, and the other three are not yet of school age. They live as one family in Silang, Cavite.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is the main focus of Irenea. She sells valuable products that meet the daily, immediate needs of her community. Being 35 years in business, she quite knows what her regular customers need. She also sells vegetables to support her customers' call for a balanced diet. Monthly, Irenea earns a net income of Php 7,900.

To further help her grow her business, Irenea decides to apply for a Php 18,000 loan. This she plans to use to furnish her store with more variety of products that will meet different tastes of different customers. She also plans to start selling meat as well. With this loan money at hand, she is set to break her perceived limitations when it comes to business.

Irenea admits that she also has customers who do not pay their debts. However, she also wants to break that bad habit of theirs and see that her business will prosper. Quite simply, she dreams of securing a bright future for her whole family. 


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of grocery items and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Sabore Ole

texts.en:
Sabore Ole N. is 36 years old. He is married and a father of four school-going children. Sabore is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his third loan which he is planning to use on his farm to prepare it and buy farm inputs. The farm being located along the main road makes it easy for him to get customers for his maize. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm to increase his maize production.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more maize for commercial purpose. Sabore is a hardworking man and determined to reach his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare the land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAPAC QOYA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Qoya, provincia D. Calca, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Celia; La socia tiene 77 años D. edad, la socia  es viudad; la socia  trabaja  administrando sus terrenos D. cultivo y elaborando chompas, ella produce chompas al por mayor y las venD. D. forma independiente y según sea la demanda, ella cultiva en sus tierras maíz, trigo, papa, ella levantó su cultivo D. maíz y requiere abonar sus terrenos y remover la tierra con tractores, ella para esto necesita alquilar un tractor y comprar abono para preparar el terreno para la siguiente siembra, la socia desea el crédito para comprar semillas para la nueva siembra, preparar el terreno, abono, e ir mejorando su vivienda poco a  poco.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “CAPAC QOYA” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Qoya, province of Calca, departament of Cuzco.

The member is Celia. She is 77 years old. She is a widow and works managing her crop land and making sweaters. She produces the sweaters wholesale and sells them according to the demand. On her land she grows corn, wheat, and potatoes. She harvested her corn crop and need to fertilize her land and move the dirt with tractors. For this, she needs to rent a tractor and buy fertilizer to prepare the land for the next planting. She wants the land to buy seed for the new planting, to prepare the land, for fertilizer and to improve her housing little by little.  

The member is happy with the loan that has been given to her and is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: To invest in preparing the land, buying fertilizer.

loans.name: Rhubie

texts.en:
Rhubie R. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental.  She is 32 years old.  Rhubie is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Rhubie owns and operates a transportation services business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services.  Rhubie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Rhubie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhubie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC.  Rhubie is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to repair the existing vehicle for better service.  This loan will be the 22nd loan taken out by Rhubie from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.ar: باسمة في عمر 53 سنة متزوجة ولها 5 اولاد تحب عائلتها وهي تعمل في التجميل قص وبيع العطورات والكريمات لها في عملها 17 سنة تحب عملها وتريد التطور والتحسن في العمل لها خبرة واسعة في هذا المجال وتسعى الى تطوير عملها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء ماكنة للخياطة حتى تتمكن من اضافة مهنة جديدة لها لكي تزيد ن مدخولها تحب عملها فهي متطورة ومتجددة وتحب ان تزيد من مدخولها
texts.en: Bassima, 53, is married with five children. She has been working as a beautician and a seller of perfume and cream for women for 17 years. Bassima has a lot of hands-on experience and she always seeks to develop her business. Bassima wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a sewing machine as she wants to learn a new craft to increase her income. Bassima is ambitious and likes her work.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 52 años de edad, reside junto a sus hijos en el distrito de Paiján, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí el ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de aproximadamente 25 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Angela desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes durante la temporada de navidad, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Angela, age 52, lives with her children in the Paiján district.  There is a lot of commercial activity in this area, which is located in the La Libertad region.  It is over two hours to the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has a grocery store in her home.  She sells varied products like basic needs items and groceries to her neighbors.  The business is approximately 25 years old.  She currently has a fixed and loyal customer base.  Thanks to this business she has been able to support her family and get it ahead during all of this time.

Angela wishes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  That way she will be able to meet customer demand during the Christmas season.  That is why she feels it is advisable to request a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel  se dedica al comercio desde hace varios años, vende ropa, zapatos. Con el fin de apoyar a su familia y lograr la construcción de su casa, el cual la está haciendo toda de concreto, lo que es de gran satisfacción poder lograr el objetivo.
Esta construcción la ha logrado gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado durante cinco ciclos, y que ha venido poco a poco construyendo, teniendo la mano de obra sin costo, ya que su esposo  es de profesión maestro de obra.
Con esta nueva solicitud, comprara materiales de construcción, para seguir levantando paredes para lograr la terminación de su vivienda. Un techo digno y un techo mas seguro.
texts.en:
For several years, Isabel has been working in retail commerce -- she sells clothing and footwear in order to support her family and to finish building her house. It is very satisfying to Isabel to be able to achieve this goal and she's been able to advance this construction thanks to the financing from Afodenic that she has received over five loan cycles.

Little by little Isabel and her husband have been building the house; she does not need to pay for the labor since her husband is a construction foreman by profession. Isabel will use the new loan to purchase construction materials so that she could continue building the walls and finish her new house that would give her family a safe and decent home.

loans.use: to purchase the construction materials necessary to finish building her house

loans.name: Duo San Juan De Dios Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Juan de Dios:
El dúo  San Juan de Dios ,este grupo esta conformado por la representante del grupo quien es Olga madre de 4 niño ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos además de ropa para bebe la cual le ha sido muy rentable ella solicita este crédito para la compra de cosméticos y para la compra de ropa de bebe.

Alicia es madre de 4 niños también  ella se dedica a vender verduras, y esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de verduras ya que esta conciente de que nececita mas capital para trabajar ella nos cuenta que se siente muy contenta porque su negocio a prosperado  hambas tienen a sus niños en las escuelas del municipio,  los diferentes negocios que tienen son muy rentables por lo mismo están  solicitando un crédito nuevamente ya que para esta temporada de Semana Santa hay mas negocio ellas demostraron sus  puntualidad en las cuotas mensuales por lo que prometen pagar de la misma manera si se les llegara a autorizar un crédito mas ya  que esto ayudaría a que sus hijos se desenvuelva mas y así ser personas de éxito.
texts.en:
San Juan de Dios Duo: Olga is a member of the duo named "San Juan de Dios" and she is the representative of the group. She is the mother of 4 children and she sells cosmetics and baby clothes. It has been a profitable business. She requests a loan to purchase cosmetics and baby clothing. 

Alicia is the mother of 4 children and she sells vegetables. She requests a loan to purchase vegetables. She is aware of the fact that she needs more working capital. She says that she is very happy because her business has been profitable. 

Both have their children attending schools in the municipality. The different businesses they have are very profitable which is why the request a new loan. During this season of Holy Week there is more business. They have both demonstrated punctuality with their monthly payments and they promise to continue making their payments in the same manner if a loan is granted to them again. This will help their children to develop and to grow up to be successful people.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and baby clothing.

loans.name: Bikwasire

texts.en:
Bikwasire is a 30 year-old married father of 7 children, aged 8 to 2 years. His wife is a housewife, which makes him the only income earner in the family. He lives with his family in his own home in Karuguuza, Uganda. He runs a retail shop and has been doing it for 8 years. He has been able to buy land and build a house from this business and he wishes in future to upgrade his business to a wholesale business. 

Bikwasire needs a loan to purchase general store items like sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.use: to buy items like sugar. salt, cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Allin Llankaquna Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Allin Llankaquna” y se van a reunir cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco, Perú).  El banco comunal se distingue por estar conformado por gente trabajadora, agricultores, artesanos, comerciantes y ganaderos. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo de la Asociación Arariwa y invertirán el dinero para mejorar sus negocios. 

En esta reunión conocimos a la señora Jesús y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Quiquijana a 3 horas de la ciudad de Urubamba. Actualmente, Jesús vive en la ciudad de Urubamba junto con su pareja y sus cuatro hijos. Desde niña sus padres le enseñaran el trabajo del campo y ahora que es mayor trabaja de forma independiente alquilando chacras para cultivar flores y verduras. Inició su negocio hace cuatro años  y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Ella cultiva flores como claveles, gladiolas y en otras oportunidades verduras como perejil, ruda y hierba buena. Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y abono. Ella tiene 48 años, es una persona con muchas ganas de superarse y tener un negocio exitoso día con día, siempre con el deseo de brindarle lo mejor a su familia. El sueño de la Señora Jesús es poder exportar sus flores bonitas a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Allin Llankaquna.  They meet every month in the city of Urubamba (Cusco, Perú).  This communal bank distinguishes itself by being comprised of hard-working people, farmers, craftsmen, merchants, and ranchers.  The group is comprised of nine members.  This is the first time they have requested a loan with the Asociación Arariwa.  They will use the money to improve their businesses.

We met Jesús at this meeting.  She tells us that she was born in the city of Quiquijana, which is three hours from the city of Urubamba.  Jesús currently lives in the city of Urubamba with her husband and their four children.  When she was a child her parents taught her field work.  Now that she is an adult, she works independently.  She rents small farms to cultivate flowers and greens.

She started her business four years ago.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She grows flowers like carnations and gladiolas.  At other times she grows greens like parsley, rue, and mint.

She now needs a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  She is 48 years old.  She is a person with a great desire to succeed and to have a successful business day after day.  She always wishes to give the best to her family.

Jesús’ dream is to be able to export beautiful flowers to other cities.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucía Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Lucía Guillermina es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es madre de tres hijos menores a los que ha tratado de darles lo mejor y una buena educación, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en un colegio de la localidad donde ha brindado sus servicios por más de veinte años para el aprendizaje de los niños.

Cuenta con su propia vivienda, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para compra de medicamentos y pago de gastos médicos de ella debido a que ha estado afectada de salud. Por tal razón decidió solicitar el crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Lucía Guillermina is from the town of El Sauce.  She is the mother of three dependent children who she has tried to provide with the best in life and a good education.  She works as an elementary school teacher in a school in her town where she has provided her services teaching children for more than twenty years.

Lucía owns her own home.  One of the needs she has at the moment is the need to take out a loan to buy medicine and pay for medical expenses since she has experienced some health issues.  For this reason, she decided to request her fourth loan from Ceprodel with the goal of meeting her need and providing her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for medical expenses.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is 38 years old and is married. She has 4 school aged children. Macario is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 4,000 per month. 

Macario is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase the needed fertilizers and pesticides. He grows vegetables and has had this production for almost 20 years.

In the future, Macario hopes to have a plentiful harvest and earn a higher income to finance the schooling of their children and satisfy their basic daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a hard working 31-year-old business woman. She is married and blessed with six children who go to school and are ages 15, 13, 11, 9, 6 and 4. For the last three years, she has been providing for her family by engaging in crop farming. She hopes in the next five years to be a major supplier of vegetables. Her dream is to be financially stable.

She had previously taken a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, which she has fully paid. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 51 years old and lives in P12 Northern Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Teresita has a bakery. She earns about PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. Teresita has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos 49 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Carlos desde hace unos años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1300 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado y aves de corral, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará su calidad de vida. Carlos con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 49 years old and lives with his wife and children in his own house, which lacks basic services. It is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande district, pertaining to Piura department. The zone is characterized by its agricultural, cattle-raising, and artisan activity.

For many years, Carlos has been commercializing corral animals (pigs, sheep, and farm fowl). He raises them in corrals at the back of his house, feeding them balanced feeds, grains, and natural grasses. Once they have reached their ideal growth, he sells them to customers or in the different markets of the zone, and with this income, he covers necessities and family expenses.

Carlos is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,300 new sols to buy balanced feed and farm fowl. Once they are fattened, he will sell them to customers. With these earnings, he will pay off this loan and improve his quality of life. With great effort and much work, Carlos tries to get ahead in order to help his family economically.

loans.use: buy animal feed and corral fowl to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ameena's Group

texts.en:
Ameena is a very active lady who supports her family financially by selling clothes. She purchases these clothes from the wholesale market and sells them to her neighborhood clients for a profit.  
Her husband is a master locksmith. He is an expert in unlocking jammed locks and also making duplicate keys.  
Ameena has 6 children. The eldest one operates a lathe machine while the other 2 are also master locksmiths, learning the trade from their father. 
Ameena has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her youngest son who wants to buy tools for his locksmith business.  
He is confident that he has now gained enough knowledge from his father to be able to handle his business independently. Ameena is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him. 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Ameena.

loans.use: To buy tools for a locksmith business.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his family's living conditions, Marlon patiently endures the pain of managing his farming business. According to Marlon, farming is not an easy type of work as a source of income. One must strive hard to provide sustenance for the crops to achieve an abundant harvest. 

He is 33 years old and had been cultivating his farm for almost 10 years. Marlon earned about PHP 30,000 at the last cropping season in May from his own farm land. Net income earned every harvest is used to sustain the education of his three children.

Marlon is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 due to insufficient funds to buy the seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With the help of this loan, he can improve his rice production. 

Marlon hopes to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Bernadette has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from different suppliers. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock from AVON, NATASHA & FULLERLIFE.

Bernadette has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock from AVON, NATASHA & FULLERLIFE.

loans.name: Sopp Madina Toure Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe existe il y'a six mois.il est formé par 10(dix) femmes qui habitent pour la plupart le village et ont comme activité principale le commerce.

La responsable du groupe s'appelle Mme Penda. Elle est mise en médaillon en bas au milieu de la photo.
Elle est veuve et âgée de 62ans et prends en charge ses deux enfants. 

Elle pratique le commerce de détails et l'embouche ovine et caprine. Elle maitrise bien ces activités  pour les avoir pratiquées depuis plusieurs

Elle achète avec son prêt de produits comme le sucre, le café ,le savon. Elle paie aussi de petits ruminants (moutons, chèvres).

son objectifs est de soutenir ses enfants dans leurs diverses entreprises.tout en subvenant a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Sopp Madina Toure Group was established six months ago by ten women who, for the most part, live in the village. Their main business is buying and selling.

Mrs. Penda is in charge of the group. She's the one in the inset at the bottom of the picture. She's 62 years old, a widow and takes care of her two children.

Her business consists in retailing, and she also raises sheep and goats. She knows all the ins and outs of her business, since she's been in it for several years. 

With her loan, she will buy products such as sugar, coffee and soaps, as well as small animals (sheep, goats). Her goal is to support her children in their various endeavors, while at the same time providing for herself.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and soaps

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 41, married, and has three school-age children. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village. Due to financial difficulty, she is engaged in selling fresh meat and pork sausages in the market to supplement her husbands income. Since their children are now in secondary and tertiary level school, they need to earn more income to support their education. Despite the hardships of life she and her husband are striving hard to earn income, for they want their children to become professional someday.

She aims to improve the business but she has inadequate capital, therefore, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fresh meat and longganiza (pork sausages) to sell in the market. She hopes that the loan will contribute a lot to the improvement of the business.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat and longganiza (pork sausage) to sell in the market

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia  is 34 years old . She is married and has 4 children. Lucia  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages and, at the same time, she is into cooking and selling viands and other cooked food. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages and ingredients for the menu for the day.

Lucia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucia  hopes to improve her business and uplift her family's way of living.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell in the store, and ingredients for the menu of the day

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora anastasia cuenta con 42 años de edad, está casada con el señor german con quien tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales solo 4 estudian Jonás, Alejandra, Esteban y Adriana, el mayor está cursando el primer año de prepa los mas pequeños están en segundo, cuarto y sexto año de primaria, ya que los demás están casados, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de antojitos, desde hacen 15 años.
Doña anastasia dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar de manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a sus hijos con sus estudios, también porque quiere mejorar aun mas su calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de insumos como: chiles, jitomates, cebollas, carnes, pollo, queso, aceite, leña, sal, etc. para continuar con las ventas en su negocio.
La meta que ella tiene para su negocio, y espera poder cumplirla es la de invertirle muchísimo más, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere construir un local, para poner una pequeño restaurante, y así mejorar e incrementar un poco mas sus ingresos, puesto que podrá asegurar el futuro y educación de sus hijos.
Le da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por la confianza que les ha brindando, ya que gracias a ese apoyo ahora puede ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y continuar con la inversión en su negocio, para que sea el mejor.
texts.en: Anastasia is 42 years old and married to German, with whom she has seven children. Four of her children, Jonás, Alejandra, Esteban and Adriana, are in school. The oldest of those is in preparatory school, and the younger ones are in high school, sixth grade and fourth grade. The other ones are married. Anastasia makes a living making and selling snacks, since she wanted to find a way to support her husband with household expenses and their children's education, as well as improve their quality of life. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken, cheese, oil, firewood, salt, etc., to keep her sales going. Her goal for her business is invest much more into it so she can grow it rapidly because she wants to build and set up a small restaurant, and in this way she can increase her income and ensure her future and her children's education. She is grateful to Kiva donors for putting their confidence in her, and thanks to this support she can offer her children a better quality of life and continue investing in her business so it can improve.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken, cheese, oil, firewood, salt, etc.

loans.name: Maniafu Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Maniafu Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Alfred is the facilitator of the Maniafu Group. He takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on quarter of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfred was only able to harvest 7 bags of maize on quarter of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children, ensure food security, and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Maniafu Group will each plant between quarter and 1 acre of maize.
Alfred is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, maize, oil, and other items

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena, 31, has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for three years. She sells various items like oil, vinegar, soap, shampoo and canned goods. Rowena earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She said her store is really helpful in providing for her family's daily needs.

Rowena requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods and noodles. She hopes for her business to grow and for her two children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, soy sauce, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Paula Petrona

texts.es:
La sra. Paula es  una mujer emprendedora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popuplar, tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes la prefieren porque sus productos son de buena calidad y los precios son accesibles, tiene un mas de un año de haber iniciado su negocio, poco a poco esta saliendo adelante, todos los dias se levanta  a las 5 de la mañana para atender  a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, lacteos, embutidos, carnes, refrescos y pan para surtir su negocio, desea tenerlo bien surtido para navidad que es cuando mas se vende.
Paula tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
texts.en: Paula is an enterprising woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She sells items of popular consumption.  She has a home-based grocery store.  Her customers prefer her because her products are high quality and the prices are affordable.  It’s been over a year since she opened the business and it’s gradually getting ahead.  She rises daily at 5am to start taking care of customers.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, dairy products, cured meats, meats, soft-drinks and bread to stock her store.  She wants to have it well-stocked for Christmas which is when she sells the most.  Paula also raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dairy products, cured meats, meats, soft-drinks and bread.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам женат и имеет одного ребенка. Он является фермером в дехканском хозяйстве и занимается посевом ячменя и клевера. Одновременно занимается скотоводством. Часть выращенного урожая  уходит на корм скота, а остальную часть продает за хорошие цены. Жена помогает по бизнесу особенно во время посева семян. Уктам запрашивает займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки высококачественные семена ячменя и клевера, а на остальную сумму хочет купить крупный  и мелкий рогатый скот.
texts.en: Uktam is married and has one child.  He is a farmer at a dekhan farm and is involved in sowing barley and clover.  Concurrently, he is involved in animal husbandry.  Uktam uses some of his harvest to feed the livestock and sells the rest at good prices.  His wife helps him with the business, especially during the sowing of seeds.  Uktam is requesting a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni to purchase high-grade barley and clover seeds and to buy cattle and small livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds and livestock

loans.name: Khourn

texts.en: Kourn, 48, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over 10 years and have extensive experience and are successful in their career. She is involved in growing rice to generate income for the family. Additionally, her husband is a construction worker. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Kourn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to run a new business: purchasing motorbike spare parts to sell at home to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to invest more money to run a bigger motorbike spare parts shop to make more profit. Moreover, she plans to build a new house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts to sell at home

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – фермер из Водяного. Она занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивая ранние овощные культуры в теплицах. Она замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает сына и дочь. У Людмилы три больших теплицы и еще 2 для рассады. В хозяйство вложено 70 000 гривен. Людмила занимается фермерским делом уже 20 лет. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 25 000 гривен. 

Людмила планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 12 000 гривен в покупку полиэтиленовой пленки на 5 000 гривен, семян для рассады на 3 000 гривен, а также переделать отопительную систему в теплицах для рассады (4 000 гривен). На вырученную прибыль Людмила планирует благоустраивать жилье, перестраивать времянку, делать гараж.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Ludmila is a farmer from the Vodyanoye village.  She is involved in agriculture by growing early vegetables in greenhouses.  She is married and, together with her husband, is raising a son and a daughter.  Ludmila has three large greenhouses and two more for seedlings.  She has 70,000 hryvnia invested in her business.  Ludmila has been involved in farming for 20 years.  Her annual expenses for seeds and plastic amount to 25,000 hryvnia.  Ludmila plans to invest this Kiva loan in the sum of 12,000 hryvnia to purchase plastic for 5,000 hryvnia, seeds for sowing for 3,000 hryvnia, and also to remodel the heating system in the seedlings greenhouses (4,000 hryvnia).  Ludmila plans to use the resulting profit to improve her home, rebuild a temporary structure and build a garage.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for 5,000 hryvnia, seeds for sowing for 3,000 hryvnia, and also to remodel the heating system in the seedlings greenhouses (4,000 hryvnia)

loans.name: Aswar

texts.en:
Aswar just began working with Ruma on July 23, 2013 to run Ruma’s new business cashing in and cashing out customer’s money for Ruma’s bank partner. As a new agent with Ruma, Aswar needs and hopes to get a Kiva loan for working capital to start his new business. Aswar wishes this new business will be another source of income for his family.

Aswar lives in Gilimanuk, Bali, a rural area about five hours from Denpasar. Aswar is single. Prior to joining Ruma, Aswar worked on the BT Cocoa staff

loans.use: to have working capital to process branchless banking transactions .

loans.name: Setha's Group

texts.en:
Setha is aged 28 years and is a young mother of one daughter. Setha has been working as government officer while her husband buys and sells mango in the village. Having been in working for 8 years, they can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to support the family 
This is the eighth loan for Setha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Setha wants to use her portion to buy more mango to resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more mango to resale

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 46 years old. He is married with five children aged between 4 and 14 years, 4 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 10 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to improve his welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 60 years old, married and has four children.

Corazon is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Corazon has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Suyapa Amparo Sosa

texts.en: My business is called â€œLinda Nenaâ€? and it is a family businesss.  We sell childrenâ€™s clothes and shoes, as well as flowers, sweets, and other Ã­tems. We have a very strategic location in the city of Tegucigalpa.  Now we do both retail and wholesale business.  Business is good and we need to invest to satisfy our clients.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory: school supplies, flowers, and sweets.

loans.name: Ada Cecilia

texts.en:
My name is Ada V., and I sell new women's and men's clothing like shirts, blouses, shirts, pants, and jeans. My business is 3 years old. My clientele is very good because I sell my products for a low cost. My goal is to increase my clothing inventory to have greater product variety. With the earnings I will be able to provide food for my family and be able to rent a place to have a large store.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ada V. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama y caballero como ser camisas, blusas, camisetas, faldas, pantalones, jeans, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clietela es muy buena ya que vendo a bajo precio, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de ropa para tener mas variedad de productos y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y alquilar un local para poner una tienda grande.

loans.use: to buy new women's and men's clothing
